loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is married and has eight children. She assists her husband in taking care of the home.
Yaa is a fishmonger at Elmina. To smoke the fish, you go to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.
Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known as a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.  
Yaa's loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke and then sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has two children. She sells cassava, plantain, bananas and groundnuts at Elmina. Efua uses her income to see to the maintenance of her home. Efua will use this loan to purchase bananas and other goods for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a widow who takes care of four children. She sells cassava and at the same time prepares banku for sale at Elmina. Banku/akple is a fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water to make a smooth whitish consistent paste.
To prepare banku, Esi first prepares a corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough. She mixes the cassava and corn doughs and cooks them into a porridge-like consistency. To get the right consistency, she has to stir the mixture on a hot firewood stove. The texture of banku has to be fine, but firm. 
The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. The most popular side dish for banku is okra stew.   
Esi's loan will be used to buy bags of maize and cassava to make dough for banku, which she will then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and cassava to make dough for banku.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She helps to pay utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. 
Aba sells gari and charcoal at Elmina. In the picture, she is standing close to the gari she sells. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Gastelu

texts.es: Gastelu, de 28 años es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Esperanza y su papá Cecilio. A los que quiere mucho y protege en su casa propia. A pesar de su corta edad, trabaja con ahínco para su futuro, de su pequeña hija “Mariela” y el de sus padres. Su principal actividad económica es la “agricultura”, ahí siembra café y maíz en los terrenos de cultivo de sus padres, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero en sus tiempos libres. Pues cuenta que otra de sus actividades, es la pesca de peces de agua dulce. Cuenta que tres veces a la semana con sus instrumentos de pescar,  ingresa al río en busca de peces “chupadora”, “mota” y “liza”, los cuales vende en le mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde obtiene 10 soles por cada kilo. Su record es pescar 30 kilos al día. Su objetivo es obtener instrumentos industriales y una lancha con lo que pueda alcanzar mayor cantidad de peces y así tener mayores ganancias. Además de ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Sabe que con constancia lo logrará. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Gastelu de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Gastelu, age 28, is a responsible son.  He lives with his mother, Esperanza, and his father, Cecilio.  He loves them very much, and he takes care of them in their own house.  In spite of his young age, he works extremely hard for the future of his daughter, Mariela, and his parents.

His main business activity is agriculture.  He grows coffee and corn on his parents’ fields.  He takes care of them with great dedication in his free time.  

He has another business activity, fishing for freshwater fish.  He says that three times a week he takes his fishing gear and gets in the river looking for “chupadora”, “mota”, and  “liza” (types of freshwater fish in Peru).  He sells them in the market in the city of Pichanaki.  He gets ten soles per kilo.  His record is catching 20 kilos a day.

His objective is to get industrial tackle and a small boat, which he will use to be able to get a greater quantity of fish.  This way he will have greater income.  He will also save enough money to buy his own fields.  He knows that with perseverance he will do it.

He belongs to the “Los Naranjales” (The Orange Groves) communal bank.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the opportunity they are giving him.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  Upon receiving your support Gastelu will use the money to buy corn seeds for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu is married and has three children. Her husband is a security guard. She supports him to educate, feed and clothe their children.
Alimatu cooks banku and serves it with okra soup and fish under a tree at Ampeyin near Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy maize and fish to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a wooden structure from which she can make her sales.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish to cook to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama buys fresh fish from the market and comes home to smoke them for sale at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Ama has three children she is taking care of right now. The income she generates is used to take care of her children. A loan will help her buy more fresh fish to smoke to sell. This will result in an increased income to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a widow and has four children. She sells raw rice by moving from one area to another in Elmina, a business which she has run for some time now. In the picture, the container in Adjoa's hand is a measuring cup which she uses to measure the rice. 
Adjoa is going to use her loan to purchase bags of rice to retail. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to retail.

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama las turquesas y se integra de cinco personas y cada una tiene diferente actividad, quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Vila  ella es  casada con el señor Teodoro y con quien procreo tres hijos de los cuales dos ya están casado y uno aun esta a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  telas  para elaborar vestidos, blusas, faldas, entre otro y sale a venderlo en comunidades cercanas de su pueblo, en y  viene practicando esta actividad hace un año y cuatro meses en la que le ha dado un buen resultado.

    Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fueron sus vecinas ya que la invitaron a formar parte del grupo y es como  se animo y decidió trabajar con la venta de telas, así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.
 
      Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y  el préstamo  solicitado pueda seguir trabajando para apoyar a su hijo quien está estudiando y quiere apoyar lo hasta que termine una carrera.

     Quienes integran el grupo son las señoras, María del rosario  quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales, así también se integra Ramiro quien invertirá en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces de nuégado, Javier Inocencio  quien invertirá en su bonetería y mercería, la señora Faustina quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos fritos  y pozol.
texts.en:
The group is called Las Turquesas [Turquoise] and is made up of five people, and each of them does different work. The featured member is Vila, who is married to Teodoro, and has three children with him. Of the children, two are already married, and one is still in their care. 

Vila requests the loan to purchase fabric for making dresses, blouses, skirts and other items to sell in communities near her town. She has been doing this work for one year and four months, and has had good results. Her neighbors inspired her to begin this business. They invited her to be a part of the group, and this encouraged her so she decided to start work selling clothing and thus help her husband with the household income. 

What she would like most is to be able, through her work and this loan, to continue working to support her son who is in school. She wants to support him until he is settled in a career. 

The other women in the group are María del rosario, who will invest the loan in purchasing ingredients for making tamales, and Faustina, who will purchase ingredients for making fried tacos and "pozol" [a pre-Hispanic drink made from fermented corn dough mixed with water]. The other members are Ramiro, who will purchase ingredients for making "dulces de nuégado" [a type of sweet fritter with honey and nuts], and Javier Inocencio, who will invest in his hat shop and sewing store.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Miriam Magaly

texts.es:
Miriam Magali vive en el barrio  asunción, es madre soltera con dos hijos a su responsabilidad de la edad de cuatro años y el bebe de cinco meses de edad.

    Ella  trabaja con una compañera quien vende discos y solicito el préstamo para dedicarse a otra actividad  que es la venta de comidas en donde  lleva practicando apenas dos meses en la que quiere trabajar  el crédito comprando ingredientes que  utilizara para poder realizar su trabajo.

    Quien lo motivo a dedicarse a esta actividad  fue su familia ya que también quiere apoyarse para darle una buen educación a sus dos hijos que están creciendo, aun asi también  su papa la poya con el sostenimiento de sus hijos.

    Lo que más desea es que  con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir mejorando día con  día sus ingresos y sus hijos no les hagan falta lo  más necesario y con el tiempo tener un local para vender comidas.
texts.en:
Miriam Magali lives in the Asunción neighborhood.  She is a single mother with two children she is responsible for.  One is four years old, and the other is a five-month-old baby.

She works with a friend selling CDs, and is requesting the loan for another activity, which is selling meals.  She has been doing this for barely two months, and wants to use the loan to buy ingredients that she will use to do this work.

What motivated her to work in this activity was her family, and also that she wanted to help her children by providing them with a good education.  Her children are growing, and her papa still helps her out with their upkeep.

What she wants most is to be able to improve her income on a daily basis by means of this small business, and for her children to not lack for anything they need.  With time, she would like to have her own premises for selling meals.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Don Fermín vive  una  localidad muy bonita ya que celebran la fiesta del santo domingo y san marcos y es muy apreciado por las ferias de ese lugar, el es casado con  la señora Teodelinda  con  quien procreo un hijo que ya está casado.
 
   El solicito el préstamo o para invertirlo en la compra de  madera para la elaboración de muebles, en donde lleva practicando veinte  años en la que le va bien  ya que ha visto mucha mejoría en su  trabajo que  tanto le gusta realizar.
 
    Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  desde muy pequeño ya que su padre también se dedicaba a  lo mismo y decido practicar lo mismo ya que vio que es un buen negocio que da resultado y gracias a dios le va bien.

    Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo pueda incrementar mas su negocio y salir adelante con su esposa que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
Don Fermín lives in a very pretty area where they celebrate the Fiestas of Santo Domingo and San Marcos.  He is very appreciative of these festivals that take place here.  He is married to Señora Teodelinda, with whom he has one son, who is himself married.

He is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing some wood for making furniture.  He has been doing this work for nearly 20 years, and it's going very well for him. He has seen great improvement in his work, which makes him very happy to do it.

His inspiration for this activity began when he was very young, as his father also worked in this field.  He decided to practice it himself as he saw that it was a good business which would give results, and thanks be to god, go well for him.

What he most wants is to increase his business further though his efforts and the loan, and to move forward in life with his wife.  She is the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a single parent taking care of 4 children. Nana sells food items such as tomatoes, plantain, spices, liquid soap, and others at Elmina. She sees to the well-being of her home. 

Nana will use the loan to purchase food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Don Daniel vive, en el  barrio  asunción, el es casado con la señora adula y con quien procreo  tres hijos quienes  dos ya están casado  y una  a su responsabilidad.

     El  solicito e l préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  herramientas para  su taller mecánico, en donde viene trabajando  hace  ocho  años y   ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que   con ello  a sacado a delante  a su pequeña familia.

   Su inspiración ´por esta actividad comenzó  desde muy pequeño  ya que  su papa lo corrió de su casa y busco la  manera de  sobrevivir  y trabajo  en un taller mecánico en  la que aprendió y desidia  dedicarse a  lo  mismo .
     Lo que desea  es que con esta péquela actividad pueda  ir a aumentando  su    negocio para  poder  apoyar otras personas que deseen  trabajar con él  y así logren tener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Asunción neighborhood.  He’s married to Adula and has three children.  Two of them are already married and one is still his responsibility.  He requested the loan to buy tools for his repair shop where he’s been working for the last 8 years and 8 months.  He comments that he does well because he’s been able to support his small family through the business.

His inspiration for this type of work started when he was a young boy because his father threw him out of the house and he had to find a way to survive and worked in a repair shop where he learned and decided to go into the same occupation.  What he wants is that with this small activity he can gradually build up his business in order to be able to offer work to others who might want to work with him and so that they can earn their own income.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Elmina. She cooks food like banku, fufu and kokonte (starchy recipes using plantain, cassava, yam and corn). She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a trader. She assists her husband to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Barrio Las Canoas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Barrio las Canoas” está conformado por siete personas son siete mujeres y cuatro hombres  el nombre lo eligieron ya que así se llama el barrio donde viven u el lugar está dividido en varias secciones sin embargo a los integrantes de este grupo lo que más le gusta de su comunidad sus árboles es algo que admiran porque los vecinos de la comunidad ha sabido cuidar muy bien sus árboles.
Los integrantes les grupo invertirán el préstamo en la compra de borregos en diferentes cantidades ya que ha esto se dedican todos es la primera vez que participan en un crédito con FRAC y KIVA.
Sin embargo el representante del grupo que es el señor Alberto invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes comprara todo aquello que considera que le hace falta como leche, pan, huevo, refresco, agua, azúcar, frijoles, etc. En si comprara lo que más vende que en todo caso sería alimentos para la gente de la comunidad.
En la actividad lleva ya diez años en todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas anteriormente si ya que dada fiado y no le querían pagar es por eso que dejo de dar fiado y ahora ya no lo hace, porque a la hora de pagar no quieren y a perdido amistades. Quien le ayuda a atender la tienda es su esposa su meta es llegar a tener otro negocio en otra localidad o municipio también quisiera comprar unos animales más adelante.
Don Alberto tiene 51 años de edad está casado con la señora Mónica que tiene 46 años están casados desde hace 28 años, juntos han procreado 5 hijos uno aun dependen de ellos Jesús que tiene 16 años estudia la secundaria.
texts.en:
The “Barrio las Canoas” group is composed of seven women and four men.  They chose that name because that’s the name of the neighborhood where they live and the place is divided up into several sections.  However, what the members of this group most admire about their community is the trees because the neighbors from this community have been very good about caring for their trees.  The members of the group will use the loan to buy various amounts of sheep since this is what they are all involved in.  This is the first time they’ve participated in FRAC and KIVA loans.

However, the group representative is Alberto and he will invest the loan in his grocery store.  He will buy everything he considers necessary like: milk, bread, eggs, soft-drinks, sugar, water, beans, etc.  As a matter of fact, he will buy everything that sells the most which would be food items for the people in his community.

He’s been in business ten years and has had no problems lately. Previously he did because he’d sell on credit and then they wouldn’t want to pay him back so he stopped selling on credit; he doesn’t do it anymore because when payment time comes around many don’t want to pay and he has lost friendships that way.  His wife helps tend to the store and his goal is to have another business in another location or town; he’d also like to buy some animals later on.

Alberto is 51 years old and married to Mónica who is 46 years old.  They’ve been married for 28 years and have five children together.  Jesús, 16, goes to middle school and still depends on them.

loans.use: to buy everything needed to stock his store.

loans.name: Helen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Helen,  tiene como actividad la consultoría en educación superior,  actividad que realiza durante la semana  dictando clases en diferentes institutos de la ciudad de La Paz.
La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo  y ella, es una familia joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella  y su familia, el esposo trabaja  en una empresa de crianza y pesca de truchas, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mobiliario para su oficina que esta instalando para desarrollar mejor su actividad y brindar apoyo a otras instituciones educativas.
texts.en: Helen is a higher education consultant, an activity she carries out during the week teaching classes in various institutes in the city of La Paz.  Her family consists of her husband and herself; it’s a young family with a strong drive to succeed in life.  This activity is her main source of income for herself and for her family.   Her husband works at a trout farm.  The loan is going to be used to buy furniture for the office she’s opening to better carry out her activity and provide support to other educational institutions.

loans.use: to buy office furniture.

loans.name: Xochicalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Xochicalco está conformado por la señora Valentina va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos de dama, caballero y niños y catálogos, la señora María de Lourdes va a comprar jabón, huevo y azúcar, la señora Isabel va a comprar naranjas, zanahorias y un extractor de jugos, la señora Evarista va a comprar aguacate, limón y durazno, la señora Luz Aurora va a comprar malteada, Aloe, te y calcios. La señora Isabel tiene 52 años de edad, ella es soltera tiene 6 hijos  4 mujeres y 2 hombres, ella vende jugos, picaditas, dobladitas y tortillas hechas a mano por kilo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar naranjas, jerez, huevo, maíz, crema, queso, manteca y gas, ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años en la venta de jugos y hace medio año inicio con la comida y las tortillas, su negocio es importante porque de ahí saca para la comida, es una distracción y le gusta hacer tortillas, dobladitas, ella se siente orgullosa de vender y le da gracias a Dios por su negocio de que sus hijas le ayudan a atender a los clientes y los recomiendan con mas personas, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar el maíz y las verduras para seguir en su negocio, está planeando hacer tacos de arroz de guisados. Ella está muy contenta con su préstamo que va a recibir va a poder realizar su sueño de crecer su negocio. Ella quisiera que sus hijos también tuvieran un negocio para cuando ya estén viejos tengan de donde agarrar. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por sus préstamos que Dios los bendiga les de mas fuerzas y trabajo y que nos sigan apoyando”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Xochicalco.”  Its members are: Valentina who will use her loan to buy ladies’, men’s and children’s shoes and catalogues; María de Lourdes who will buy soap, eggs and sugar; Isabel who will buy oranges, carrots and a juicer; Evarista who will buy avocadoes, lemons and peaches; Luz Aurora who will buy malt, aloe, tea and calcium.

Isabel, 52, is single and has six children: four girls and two boys.  She sells juice, snacks, turnovers and hand-made tortillas by the kilogram.  She requested her first loan to buy oranges, sherry, eggs, corn, cream, cheese, shortening and gas.  She started her business six years ago selling juice and half a year ago started with the meals and tortillas.  Her business is important because that’s where she earns income to buy food, it’s a distraction for her and she enjoys making tortillas and turnovers.  She’s proud to sell and thanks God for her business.  Her daughters help her tend to customers who recommend her to other people.  She uses profits to buy the corn and vegetables needed to stay in business.  She’s planning to start making grilled meat tacos.

She’s very happy with the loan she’s going to get because she’ll be able to make her dream of growing in business a reality.  She’d like her children to also have businesses so that when they are old they’ll have something to fall back on.   The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “Thank you for the loans.  May God bless you and give you more strength and work and may you continue to support us.”

loans.use: to buy oranges, sherry, eggs, corn, cream, cheese, shortening and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like corrugated metal sheeting and wood and to pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Las Naranjas y se integra D.  seis señora quien  cada una  se dedica a diferente actividad, L. señora  quien se le tomo L. entrevista se llama Tereza es viuda y a su responsabilidad tiene  a dos hijos que L. apoyan con los ingresos D. L. casa.

     ElL. solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en  L. compra y venta D. ropas para luego venderlo fuera D. L. localidad, en esta actividad lleva  un año y once meses en L. que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso además antes también compraba productos agrícolas D. L. región.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que es una mujer soL. y no quiere  que le haga falta lo mas necesario y  también  apoyar a sus  hijos que un están a su responsabilidad.

  Lo que más desea es que con este apoyo que le están brindando y  su actividad pueda  salir delante.

  Las personas que integran en el grupo  son las señoras: Rosalinda quien  invierte al préstamo  en L. compra D. ropas para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños, L. señora  María Vitalina invierte en L. compra y venta D. cosméticos, así también L. señora  Silvina quien  invierte en L. compra  D. frutas D. L. región, CarmeL. invierte en L. compra D. productos para surtir su papelería, y por último L. señora Hilda quien invertirá en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Las Naranjas (Oranges) group is maD. up of six women who each has her own business.  Tereza is the one who gave the interview.  She is a widow and has two children who help her with the money for the house.

She is requesting a loan to buy, and then sell, clothing at a distance from where she lives.  She has been doing this work for a year and eleven months and she tells us that it is going very well.  She has had a good income while previously she also bought farm products from the area.

She was inspired to do this work when she, as a single woman, didn’t want to miss out on what she needed, and also to help her children who are her responsibility.

What she most wants from this financing is that it will help her get ahead.

The other members of the group are: Rosalinda, who will use the loan to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing, María Vitalina who will buy cosmetics, Silvina, who wants to buy fruit from their area, CarmeL., who will purchase products to supply her stationery store, and lastly, Hilda, who will buy merchandise to supply her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Morenitas está conformado por las señoras Roció, Paula van a comprar con su préstamo alimento para borregos, vacunas y vitaminas, la señora Juana va a comprar Refrescos por caja,  la señora Alma Delia va a comprar  Yogurt natural, vasos y cucharas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos orgullosos de recibir estos préstamos, gracias por confían en nosotros y no les vamos a defraudar y que nos sigan prestando para crecer los negocios". La señora Juana tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja de peón de albañil ellos tienen 4 hijas mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella vende refrescos y dulces, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar refrescos, chocolates, paletas etc. y una parte para comprar cemento para las cadenas de su casa. Ella inicio su negocio hace cuatro años la necesidad y falta de recursos economicos, su hija se enfemo y no tenia para comprar las medicinas, su negocio es importante porque va saliendo y no falta el dinero, ella se siente orgullosa de que ya está terminado de construir su casa, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para comer y para volver a invertir.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Morenitas.”  Its members are: Rocío and Paula who will use their loans to buy sheep, vaccines and vitamins; Juana who will buy soft-drinks by the case; Alma Delia who will buy natural yoghurt, drinking glasses and spoons.  The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “We are proud to receive these loans.  Thank you for trusting us.  We will not defraud you.  Please continue lending to us so that we can grow in our businesses.”

Juana, 44, is married.  Her husband works as a bricklayer’s helper.  They have four adult daughters who are employed.  She sells soft-drinks and candy.  She requested the loan to buy soft-drinks, chocolates, lollypops, etc. and part of it to buy cement for the chains at her house.  She started the business four years ago because of need and the lack of economic resources.  Her daughter got sick and she did not have money to buy medicine.  Her business is important because she’s getting ahead and she doesn’t lack money.  She’s proud because she’s finishing building her house.  Profits from the business have provided food to eat and funds to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, candy and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: la nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Paula va a comprar con su préstamo cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, las otras integrantes siguen en su negocio de alfareria. La señora Paula tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo varón de 15 años de edad, el estudia en bachilleres, ella vende cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, ella solicito su préstamo para mejorar el negocio va a comprar cazuelas ollas y jarros de diferentes tamaños y modelos para tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años es un oficio que sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar en la alfarería y la mayoría en su pueblo se dedican a la alfarería, ella inicio con poquito y fue creciendo poco a poco con su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo, ella sale a vender ofrece sus productos en las ferias y en los tianguis, ella se siente orgulloso de su negocio a crecido,  ella vende muy bien el barro por los productos que se ven bonitos, ella utiliza las ganancias en los gastos de la casa y para la  escuela de su hijo, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más productos de diferentes modelos y tamaños y lo piensa lograr con los prestamos, ella está feliz con este préstamo tiene la oportunidad de crecer su negocio. Sus sueños y esperanza son que su hijo siga estudiando y que su negocio crezca. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad  “gracias por ayudarnos, estamos contentas con su apoyo y vamos a echarle ganas para salir adelante con los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
The new group member is Paula.  She will use her loan to buy clay tureens, pots and jugs.  The other members continue with their pottery business.  

Paula is 40 years old, married and has a 15-year-old son going to high school.  She sells clay pots, tureens and jugs.  She requested the loan to improve her business.  She will buy pots, tureens and jugs of different sizes and styles to have available for her customers.  She started her business twenty years ago; her parents taught her how to work in pottery.  Most of the town is involved in pottery.  She started out with just a little and gradually grew with her work and with help from her husband and son.  She goes out to sell at the markets and street fairs and she’s proud of the work she does.  Her business has grown.

Her pottery sells well because her products look pretty.  She uses profits to cover household expenses and for her son’s school.  She’s planning to expand the business buying more products of various styles and sizes and she plans to accomplish this with the loans.  She’s happy with this loan because she gets the opportunity to grow with her business.  Her dreams and hopes are that her son continues in school and that the business grows.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thank you for supporting us.  We are happy with your support and we are going to work very hard to get ahead with our businesses and with our families.”

loans.use: to buy clay pots, tureens and jugs.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Flor Margarita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama flor margarita esta integrado por once integrantes indígenas que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Alma Yuridia  de 21 años de edad es una persona  con muchas ganas de triunfar  y desea que sus sueños se ajan realidad.
Ella estudio hasta  la secundaria terminada  y le gustaría seguir estudiando para poder aprender mas cosas.
La señora Alma Yuridia tiene  una pequeña niña de cuatro años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces desde  ase dos años le gusta mucho su negocio por que vende en Las mañanas en  un jardín de niños y en la tarde  se establece afuera de su casa.
Pidió el préstamo para  comprar más dulces como son: chicles, paletas, pulpas, chicharrones, sabritas y jugos.
Uno de sus sueños es que su esposo Demetrio y ella tengan su propio negocio con local  ya que están trabajando  mucho para lograrlo.
Las otras integrantes  son:
Beda Sofía- quien se dedica a la venta de tamales.
Celestina - quien se dedica  a la venta de comida.
Margarita  - quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Yessenia- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Lucia- quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Norma Angélica- se dedica a la venta de  dulces.
Javier – quien se dedica a la venta de nixtamal y masa.
Alicia- quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Fabiola- quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Magali- quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le han dado  para que puedan comprar mas mercancía  y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor Margarita” and has eleven indigenous members who carry out a variety of economic activities.  One of the members is Alma Yuridia, 21.  She is a person with a strong drive to succeed and she wants her dreams to become a reality.  She completed middle school and would like to continue her studies to be able to learn more things.  Alma Yuridia has a four-year-old little girl.

She has been selling candy for the last two years.  She likes her business very much because she sells during the morning at a Kindergarten and in the afternoons outside her house.  She asked for the loan to buy more candy like: chewing gum, lollypops, fruit pulp, fried pork rinds, Sabritas brand snacks and fruit juices.  One of her dreams is that she and her husband, Demetrio, have a proper store in a locale; they are working very hard to accomplish this.

The other members are:

Beda Sofía - who sells tamales.
Celestina – who sells food.
Margarita  - who sells fish.
Yessenia- who sells clothes.
Lucia- who sells soft-drinks.
Norma Angélica- who sells candy.
Javier – who sells nixtamal [tortilla dough] and masa [corn dough].
Alicia- who sells soft drinks.
Fabiola- who sells food.
Magali- who sells groceries.

They thank Fundación Realidad for the support it’s given them to be able to buy more merchandise and obtain more profits.

loans.use: to buy candy, chewing gum, fruit pulp, fried pork rinds, Sabritas brand snacks and juice.

loans.name: Cuautomatitla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Cuautomatitla, está conformado por la señora Elia va a comprar con su préstamo maíz por carga, las señoras Emiliana y Flaviana van a comprar frutas nuez, durazno, tejocote, peras por caja, las señoras Josefa, Juana y María Isabel van a comprar refrescos, jabón, aceite, huevo, cloro, queso, azúcar, sal, sabritas y bimbo, la señora Francisca va a comprar tortillas, arroz, aceite, frijol, sopas, lácteos, verduras para elaborar la comida, los señores Carlos, Gemma, Petra y Dionicia van a comprar F. y plantas rosas, margaritas, geranios, crisantemos, tuberosas, margarita, nube,  la señora Clara va a comprar frutas y verduras, jitomate, chiles, tomate, plátanos, manzana, la señora María Érica va a comprar ropa blusas, pantalones, faldas, suéteres, camisas, las señoras Perfecta y Diana van a comprar dulce, chicles, paletas, chocolates, chicharrones, yogurt etc. La señora Perfecta tiene 65 años de edad, ella es casada, no trabaja su esposo ya es mayor, ellos tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad ya casados, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces, chocolates, chicles, bombones y paletas de hielo, ella inicio su negocio hace 12 años, inicio con poquito y fue creciendo, su negocio es importante porque con este negocio se van sosteniendo va sacando para la comida y los gastos de la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su tienda de abarrotes, su negocio es muy conocido por el tiempo que lleva en su localidad, ella utiliza las ganancia para comprar ropa, zapatos y para volver a invertir en la tienda de abarrotes. Sus sueños y esperanza son agrandar su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos agradecidos con ustedes por los préstamos que nos dan, gracias por la confianza y por ayudarnos en nuestros negocio”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called "Cuautomatitla", and is made up of the following members:

Elia will use her loan to buy corn by the load.

Emiliana and Flaviana are going to buy fruits, nuts, peaches, tejocote (hawthorn), and pears by the case.

Josefa, Juana and María Isabel are going to buy soft drinks, soap, cooking oil, eggs, bleach, cheese, sugar, salt, potato chips, and sliced bread. 

Francisca is going to buy tortillas, rice, cooking oil, beans, soups, dairy products, vegetables for making meals.

Carlos, Gemma, Petra and Dionicia are going to buy flowers and rose plants, daisies, geraniums, chrysanthemums, flower bulbs, and baby's breath.

Clara is going to buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, chilis, bananas, and apples. 

María Érica is going to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, skirts, sweaters, shirts.

Perfecta and Diana are going to buy candy, chewing gum, popsicles, chocolates, pork rinds, yogurt etc.

Perfecta is 65, and married. Her husband is older, and no longer works. They have six adult children who are already married. She has a grocery store, and is applying for the loan in order to buy candy, chocolates, chewing gum, sweets, and popsicles. 

She started her business 12 years ago; it started small, and has grown. Her business is important because with it, they are supporting themselves, and she is earning money for food and for her family's expenses.  

She feels proud to have her grocery store. Her business is very well known because of the length of time it has operated in her town.  She uses the profits to buy clothing and shoes and to reinvest in the store. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, "We are thankful for the loans you are giving us...thank you for trusting us, and for helping us in our businesses."

loans.use: To buy candy, chocolates, chewing gum, sweets and popsicles for her store.

loans.name: Orión Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama orión y se integra D. tres señoras quienes cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad, quien se le tomo L. entrevista se llama María Olga  elL. es viuda y su responsabilidad tiene a dos hijos.

 
      ElL. solito el préstamo para invertirlo en L. compra D. ingredientes para L. elaboración D. comidas en donD. lleva trabajando seis meses y le va bien  ya que se siente muy cómoda con su actividad pues lo prepara en su domicilio.

      ElL. se inspiro en esta actividad para tener sus propios ingresos, así apoyarse para darles lo  más necesario a sus hijos quienes están a su responsabilidad y sigan  estudiando para que logren terminar  una carrera.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda  aumentar sus ingresos para así rentar un local en el mercado y poder vender más cómoda los alimentos que elL. elabora.
 
     Las personas que se integran en el grupo son las señoras: Macarena quien solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en L. compra D. perfumes D. L. marca fraiche y L. señora Adalea invertirá en L. compra D. cosméticos D. L. marca Avon, jafra, blondi y fuler.
texts.en:
Three women belong to Orión Group, each working in her respective job.  María Olga is the one who was interviewed.  She is a widow and is responsible for two children.

María Olga requested the loan to buy ingredients to make food, work she has been doing for six months.  It's going well for her, since she feels very comfortable with this work because she prepares the food in her home.

She was inspired to do this work to have her own income, and so support herself to give the necessities to her children, who are her responsibility and continue studying so they will be able to finish their academic studies.

What María Olga most wants is that this little job and the loan increase her earnings so she can rent a place in the market to be able to sell the food she makes more easily.
 
The members of this group are Macarena, who requested the loan to buy Fraîche brand perfumes, and Adalea, who will buy Avon, Jafra, Blondi, and Fuller cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement and zinc and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, medicine and pay for college expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc and perlines (supports).

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es: Minerva esta casada y tienen 6 hijos la mayor estudia para estilista,  y los que siguen estudian preparatoria y primaria, y el menor tiene un año. Ella es originaria de una población donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de flor de nochebuena y donde hacen unas artesanías en barro preciosas las cuales los turistas las compran por el atractivo que tienen. Mini como de cariño le dicen tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 17 años aproximadamente, esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para invertir en la tienda de abarrotes que atiende, con el crédito que le otorgaran ella comprara artículos como pañales desechables, enlatados, sopas, cerillos veladoras, café, focos etc. platica que surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de ella donde le dan precios bajos. Platica que ahorita en este momento no tiene problemas fuertes su única preocupación es que sus hijos estén bien de salud y en la escuela. El crédito le beneficiara por que podrá tener su negocio muy surtido y así podrá tener mejores ganancias. Comenta que la meta que tiene es poner otra tiendita en una comunidad donde no aya para que sus hijos los mayores se hagan responsables y la atiendan.
texts.en:
Minerva is married and has six children. The oldest is studying to be a hairstylist and the others are still in secondary and primary school. The youngest is one year old. She is originally from a town where the principal activity is the growing of poinsettias and where they make some beautiful precious clay handicrafts that the tourists find attractive and buy.

Her nickname is Mini and she says that she has had a grocery store for around 17 years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as disposable diapers, canned soups, matches, candles, coffee, light bulbs, and other items.

She says she buys her products in different stores from a town near hers, which has low prices. She tells us that right now at this very moment she has no major problems and her only concern is that her children are healthy and attend school. This loan would benefit her because she could have a well-stocked business and thus higher profits.

She comments that her goal is to have another little store in a community that doesn't have one and for her older children to take responsibility for it and look after it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Ayidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOKPO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Assiba, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Assiba est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Raphaël. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Julienne Assiba a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a environs cinq ans, Julienne Assiba mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (maïs, biscuits, cartes de recharges téléphoniques) et des friperies de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Julienne Assiba achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Assiba sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Ayidokpo group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Julienne Assiba, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has sought financial aid from Alidé, and their aim is to increase their business volume. Julienne Assiba is 47 years old and married to an entrepreneur named Raphaël. The couple has four children, all at school and in their care. The couple lives with their children and together provide for the family's needs. Julienne Assiba left school at secondary level. For around five years she has been selling a variety of products (corn, biscuits, telephone recharge cards) as well as selling second-hand clothing as a secondary activity. This business allows her to respond to her family's needs without any great difficulty. Julienne Assiba buys her products in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand, she is requesting a first loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Ayidokpo group.

loans.use: to buy corn and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Severiana

texts.es: Doña Severiana es una mujer trabajadora y constante, ella es casada pero ya no tiene hijos que dependen de ella ya que todos se casaron, doña Seve como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace  mas de 30 años atiende una tienda de abarrotes que sus padres le dejaron, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su tienda de abarrotes dice ella “quiero tener bien surtido mi changarro ya que de aquí comemos mi viejito y yo y es nuestro único patrimonio por eso pido el crédito para que mi negocio crezca”. Comenta que comprara jabón, cloro, galletas, refrescos, garrafones de agua, leche, huevo etc. ella esta muy contenta por que quiere salir adelante con su negocio, el sueño que tiene Severiana es comprar material para construcción y vender ya que tiene un local a lado de sus abarrotes que no se ocupa y sacar provecho del local.
texts.en:
Severiana is a hard-working persevering woman. She is married but none of her children depend on her, as all of them are married. She is known by her nickname of Sevi in her community.

She has had a grocery store for more than 30 years that her parents left her. She is asking for a loan in order to invest in her grocery store. She tells us, "I want to supply my grocery store as this is how my husband and I earn our daily bread and it is all we have, and this is why we are asking for a loan in order for my business to grow." 

She comments that she will buy soap, bleach, cookies, soft drinks, bottles of water, milk, eggs, and other items. She is very happy because she wants to improve her business. 

Severiana's dream is to buy and sell construction material and she already has a place next to her grocery store, which is empty, and she wants to take advantage of it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 43 años de edad esta casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian uno la secundaria y dos la primaria, doña Hilda desde hace 10 años se dedica al bordado de prendas artesanales como servilletas, almohadones, manteles, blusas, etc. los cuales vende en su localidad y en una ciudad grande del país, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de marquice, agujas, hilos, estambre, et. para elaborar sus artesanías bordadas, platica que el material lo compra en la capital ya que le dan bajos precios y así le puede ganar algo a lo que hace ella. Dice que su mama fue que le enseño hacer las costuras y ella espera que su hija también sepa coser ya que es muy buen negocio. la meta que tiene la señora es mas adelante invertir en el negocio de cultivo de aguacate ya que en su población es la principal actividad económica.
texts.en:
Hilda is 43 years old, married and has three children. One of which is in high school and two of which are in primary school. 

Hilda has been producing handmade items for 10 years such as napkins, pillows, tablecloths, and blouses, among others. And she sells them in her neighborhood and in one of the largest cities in the country. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy embroidery patterns or stencils, needles, thread, and yarn in order to make her embroidery handicrafts. She says that the prices are lower in the capital city so that she can earn something for what she makes. 

She says that her mother taught her to do needlework and that she hopes that her daughter also learns to sew as it is a very good business. The dream that she has is to one day be able to invest in the business of growing avocados because this is the main economic activity in her town.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to make embroidery handicrafts

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 23 años de edad y estudio hasta quinto año de primaria por falta de recursos económicos, Doña Leticia es casada y tienen tres hijos de nombres los cuales estudian la primaria y el preescolar. Doña Lety como es conocida en su localidad esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para invertir en su negocio de frutas y verduras de temporada como aguacate, nopales, papas, quelites, guayaba, naranja etc. ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 3 años. Comenta que a diario a las cuatro de la mañana sale a surtir a la central de abastos a una población cercana a su localidad para que le den un buen precio y para agarrar la fruta fresca.  Uno de las dificultades es que a veces no tiene muchas ventas y se le echan a perder sus verduras por que abecés tiene pocas ventas. Comenta doña Lety que el préstamo les beneficiara por que gracias a este podrá surtir mejor su puesto de frutas y con las ganancias podrá aportar un poco más de gasto para su casa y así sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida, una de las metas que tiene la señora Leticia es tener un puesto en el mercado ya que donde esta es ambulante, también dice que en su casa vende frutas y legumbres y ahí quisiera poner un  local establecido ya que lo tiene en su cocina y le gustaría hacer un local especial para su negocio.
texts.en: Leticia is 23 and only has a 5th grade education because of lack of resources.  She is married and has three children in preschool and elementary.  Since Lety is well known in her town she is requesting a loan to invest in her fruit and vegetable business to sell seasonal fruit such as avocado, nostle fruit, potatoes, spinach, guava, oranges, etc.  She has been in business for approximately three years.  She starts her day at 4:00 a.m. when she goes to the produce market in a nearby town.  There she buys fresh fruit at a good price.  One of the difficulties she has is when sales are slow and the produce goes bad.  Lety says the loan will be beneficial because she will be able to stock fruit and with the earnings contribute more to the household expenses which will improve her children's lifestyle.  One of Leticia's goals is to have her own stall at the market, since now she is a street vendor.  She also sells fruits and vegetables out of her home where she would like to set up a stand instead of using her kitchen as a salespoint.

loans.use: To sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE A DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rosine Yémadi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rosine Yémadi est âgée de 31 ans et n'est pas encore mariée. C'est une célibataire qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Rosine Yémadi a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Rosine Yémadi mène comme activité la vente de conserves et parallèlement, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son quartier. Rosine Yémadi exerce cette activité depuis huit ans environs. Rosine Yémadi s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Rosine Yémadi désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Rosine Yémadi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The "Gloire A Dieu" group is made up of 3 women who live in the same area of Benin. The group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their level of business activity.

The group's representative, Rosine Yémadi, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. Rosine Yémadi is 31 years old and single. She lives alone and earns enough to cover her own living expenses. She does not have much formal schooling and has been earning a living selling canned goods and prepaid phone cards to customers in her area for about 8 years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Rosine Yémadi would like to be able to reinforce and diversify her business activities so that she can better meet customer demand. For this reason, she and the other members of the "Gloire A Dieu" group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and prepaid phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiene 41 años de edad está casada con el señor José desde hace 26 años de dicho matrimonio nacieron tres hijos, Omar de 22 años que aun está estudiando la universidad, Alicia de 18 años ya no estudia, Elizabeth de 10 años está en sexto año de primaria.

La señora Guadalupe y su esposo son comerciantes desde hace tiempo ella desde hace 20 años y su esposo desde hace 30 años, venden todo tipo de artículos de licuadoras, ellos salen a vender 3 o 4 días ala semana lunes viernes y domingos, son los días en que más vende. Venden caminando en las plazas de los mercados.
Esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar vasos aspas, empaques, roscas, tapas no puede dar una cantidad exacta ya que no todos los artículos tienen el mismo precio. el desafío que presenta su negocio es la baja venta que hay en unos días, cuando los placeros no dejan vender a gusto, y sobre todo cuando llueve eso nos impide vender en la calle.

La meta que tiene doña Guadalupe es que su hijo termine de estudiar su carreara de contabilidad y que el negocio suba de ganancias para poder cumplir con los pagos.
“ Mando saludos a las personas que nos prestan el dinero ya que es de gran ayuda para mí y para mi familia”
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe is 41 and has been married to José for 26 years.  They have three children, Omar, 22, who is at college, Alicia, 18, who no longer studies, and Elizabeth, 10, who is in 6th grade.

Guadalupe and her husband are merchants and have been in business for several years: Guadalupe, 20, and her husband, 30 years.  They sell all kinds of blender articles.  They go out three or four days a week, and Mondays, Fridays and Sundays are when they sell the most.  They are street vendors in the market plazas.

She is requesting a loan to buy pitchers, blades, seals, coils, and lids although she cannot specifiy an exact amount because not all of the articles have the same price.  The challenges for the business now are the slow sales volume, difficulties created by plaza business owners, and especially the rain, which keeps them from going out to sell.

Guadalupe's goal is for her son to finish his accounting degree and for the business to increase its earnings so it can meet its payment obligations.

"I send a greeting to all the lenders because the loan is of great help to me and my family."

loans.use: To buy blender pitchers and accessories.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora Eufemia tiene 50 años de edad está casada desde hace 35 años con el señor Pedro quien trabaja de comerciante vendiendo fibras, vasos de licuadoras, ellos aun tiene una hija que dependen de ellos Martha que tiene 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria.

Doña Eufemia vende calcetas durante toda la semana, ya sea en la plaza de los municipios más cercanos de su comunidad o en la misma comunidad ranchando así le llaman cuando caminan vendiendo. Es su actividad lleva ya 9 años, esta vez ha solicitado para comprar más calcetas ya que le urge vender más para apoyara a su hija con los gastos de la escuela piensa que con la cantidad que solicito le alcanzara para comprar unas cuatro docenas, en diferentes colores y tamaños.

Hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún problema, lo de siempre que las ventas bajan pero comenta que eso no es novedad, la meta que tiene o la esperanza es que su hija termine de estudiar y poder expandir un poco mas su negocio.
“Gracias por el préstamo ya que gracias al crédito podemos tener más mercancía y las posibilidades de ganancias son aun mas grandes”
texts.en:
Eufemia is 50 years old and has been married to Pedro for 35 years.  He is a merchant and sells fibers and blender pitchers.  They have a 14-year-old daughter, Martha, who lives with them and is in junior high school.

Eufemia sells stockings during the week either in the municipal plaza closest to her community or in her own community, working as a street vendor.  She has been in business for nine years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more stockings because she needs to help her daughter immediately with school costs.  She believes the loan amount she has requested will allow her to buy four dozen pairs in different colors and sizes.

For the time being she has had no real problems, only experiencing slow sales which is nothing new.  Her goal is for her daughter to finish her education and for the business to grow more.

"Thank you for the loan that will allow us to have more merchandise and to earn even more profits."

loans.use: To buy stockings.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina tiene 36 años de edad esta casada  desde hace 17 años con el señor Javier quien  trabaja de comerciante vendiendo fantasía y bonetería. Juntos han procreado cinco hijos Gamaliel de 15 años que esta estudiando la preparatoria, Diana Lizet que tiene trece años ella está cursando tercero de secundaria, Leidi Esmeralda de 12 años está en el segundo año de secundaria, Litzi Joselin que tiene 10 años ella está en quinto año de primaria, Alan Daniel de 7 años el más pequeño está cursando el segundo año de primaria.
Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 17 años, la cual tiene el nombre de “Miscelánea el paso” esta vea ha solicitado para subastara su tienda de abarrotes ya que la hacen falta varios productos como alimentos enlatados, leche, azúcar, pan, huevo, aceite, etc. Comprara lo que cree que vende más en este caso serian los productos alimenticios.
El desafío que presenta es la competencia que tiene en sus comunidad ya que hay ya muchas tiendas, sin embargo quiere dar la mejor calidad y a precios más bajos para poder aumentar su clientela ya que es una de sus metas aumentar y no perder, también un problema es cuando da fiado y no le quieren pagar.
Otras de sus metas es expandir su negocio “Yo estoy muy gradecida con el préstamo que nos otorgan ya que para mí y para mi familia es de gran ayeada para suplir los gastos del hogar y escúllela”
texts.en: Florentina is 36 and has been married to her husband Javier since age 17.  Her husband sells costume jewelry and accessories. Together they are raising 5 children: Gamaliel, age 15, Diana Lizet, 13, Leidi Esmeralda, 12, Litzi Joselin,10 and Alan Daniel, 7.  Florentina has run a small store since she was 17, called “Miscelánea el paso.”  She seeks this loan to buy inventory of food items such as milk, sugar, eggs, canned items and other products.  She wants to buy mostly foodstuffs since they are fast-selling items.  She faces several challenges such as competition in her community from other stores, and seeks to provide good service and low prices to grow her customer base.  Another difficulty is that many clients want to run credit tabs instead of paying cash for purchases.  Florentina also has the goal of growing her business.  She notes “I am very grateful for this loan which is of great help to my family to meet our household and school expenses.”

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, eggs, canned items and other food products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 45 años está casada con el señor Manuel desde hace 19 años, de dicho matrimonio nacieron cinco hijos que aun depende ellos, Dulce de 18 años está estudiando la preparatoria, Rogelio de 16 años también se encuentra en la preparatoria, Lidia de 14 años está en la secundaria, Janet de 12 años está en la primaria, el más pequeño de 6 años Aron esta en primero de primaria.
La señora Juana y el señor Manuel son comerciantes desde hace 18 años ellos vende bolsas de platico, de rafia y mandiles venden en las plazas de los municipios más cercas de su comunidad venden camina nado a lo ellos le llaman ranchando, ella vende sábados domingos y lunes y su esposo todos los días.
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que le hacen falta varáis cosas las cantidades no las puede dar ya que depende del precio de cada artículo y falta ver si le conviene comprar por mayoreo u menudeo.
Su problema es que el placero no los deja vender y quizás cuando las ventas bajan y sacan ni para el pasaje sin embargo no es motivo para no tener metas ellos quieren que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y poner un local bien arreglado ya sea en la comunidad o en otro lugar.
“Gracias a FRAC y KIVA por el préstamo porque con su ayuda yo podre salir adelante”
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is 45 and has been married to Manuel for 19 years.  They have five children who are still in their care, Dulce, 18, who is in high school, Rogelio, 16, also in high school, Lidia, 14, who is in junior high school, Janet, 12, in elementary, and the youngest, Aron, 6, in elementary.

Juana and Manuel are merchants and have been in business for 18 years selling plastic bags, raffia and leather aprons in the municipal plazas closest to their community.   They are street vendors and Juana works Saturday, Sunday and Monday and her husband everyday.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in the business since they are in need of several things.  She cannot specifiy quantities becaught it depends on the price of each item and whether it is purchased wholesale or retail.

The problems they run into are when plaza business owners make sales difficult or when sales are slow and they cannot even earn enough to cover their transportation.  But this does not mean that they do not have a goal which is for their children to finish their education.  They also want to set up a stand somewhere in the community or elsewhere.

"Thank you to FRAC and KIVA for this loan which will help me get ahead."

loans.use: To buy leather aprons and bags.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Doña Josefina tiene 50 años de edad esta casad con el señor Juan el cual trabaja de comerciante juntos han procreado dos hijos, Juan Ángel de quince años ya no estudia Y Rodolfo de 13 años de edad el tampoco ya no estudia.
Ella vende chales en el tianguis esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que casi no tiene mercancía. Ella piensa que más o menos le alcanzaran para comprar 50 chales, ella los compra ya hechos porque estos si los hacen en maquina,  cuenta que porque hay otros que si los hacen a mano. Pero están más caros, y también ya casi nadie los quiere comprar para ella es muy triste que las personas ya no valoran lo que las manos mexicanas hacen porque ya todo viene de china y estos productos están hechos con maquinas.
La señora Josefina vende todos los días en los mercados caminando, en su negocio lleva ya 20 años de experiencia. El desafío que presenta es que los placeros siempre la andan correteando porque no dejan que venda en el mercado.  También cuando los alumnos entran a la escuela las ventas bajan ya que los padres tienen que cubrir los gastos de la escuela y se quedan sin dinero. Pero a pesar de esto doña Josefina tiene metas las cuales son mejorar su vivienda y que algún día llegue hacerse de otro negocio de lo que sea.
Ella deja un mensaje “Gracias por las personas que nos prestan el dinero, y por preocuparse por las familias mexicanas que somos de bajos recursos nos ayuda de mucho”
texts.en:
Doña Josefina is 50 years old and married to Señor Juan who works as a businessman. Together they have 2 children. Juan Angel is 15 years old and no longer studies and Rodolfo is 13 years old and also doesn't study.

She sells shawls at the open air markets. This time she is asking for a loan to invest in her business as she barely has any merchandise left. She thinks that she has enough to buy 50 shawls more or less. She buys them ready-made as they are machine-made. She tells us that there are others that are handcrafted but these are more expensive. Also hardly anybody wants to buy the handcrafted ones. It makes her sad that people no longer value what Mexican hands can produce as now everything comes from China , machine-made. 

Señora Josefina sells her shawls everyday walking the street markets and has 20 years experience doing this. The challenge she faces is that the street vendors chase her away as they don't want to let her sell in the market. Also when the children go back to school sales go down as their parents have to cover school expeenses and are out of pocket. However, despite this Doña Josefina has goals which are to improve her house and that one day she can get into another business. 

She leaves us with this message: "Thank you to the people who lend us money and who are concerned about low income Mexican families; it helps us a lot."

loans.use: to buy shawls.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
PAULA
La señora Paula tiene 50 años de edad está casada con el señor Agustín desde hace 40 años. El señor Agustín y doña Paula ya no tienen hijos que dependan de ellos.

Los dos son comerciantes se dedican a vender hules, vasos, plásticos, desde hace doce años su esposo es quien ya tiene más tiempo de hacho cuando ella se caso con don Agustín  vendían pero otras cosas ella solo sale a vender solo cuando hay tiempo su esposo si sale todas los días a vender. Ellos ranchan así le llaman cuando salen a vender caminando en los municipios más cercanos de su localidad.

Ella ha solicitado para comprar mas mercaría piensa comprar media docena de cada caso para vender ella aparate y quizás las guanacias aumenten. Su desafío mas grande es cuando las ventas no están bien y son muy bajos sin embargo se esfuerza para que por lo menos salga para lo de la comida en casa.

Su meta más grande es arreglar su casa también un local sin  embargo ella comenta que lo mejor es caminar por que así vende más. “Yo le agradezco a FRAC Y KIVA por la  ayuda que nos brindan ya que nos sacan de muchos apuros”
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 50 years old and has been married to Señor Agustín for 40 years. Señor Agustín and Doña Paula  no longer have any dependent children.

Both of them are merchants who have been selling tablecloths, glasses and plastic products for the last 12 years. Her husband is the one with more experience as when they got married they used to sell other things but she would only go out to sell when she had the time whereas her husband goes out every day to sell. They walk the streets selling in the places closest to their area.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise. She is thinking of buying half a dozen cases of each product to sell individually later and then perhaps profits will increase. Her biggest challenge is that when sales are low she has to make the effort to at least go out so as to put food on the table.

Her biggest goal is to improve her house and also have a locale. However, she says that it is better to walk around as she sells more that way. "I am grateful to FRAC and KIVA for the help they give us as they help us out with many problems".

loans.use: to buy plastic tablecloths and  blender glasses.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 27 años de edad está casado con el señor Fabián desde hace 9 años juntos han procreado a cuatro hijos Lizet de de 8 años que está en tercer de primaria, Evelyn de siete años de edad que está cursando segundo año de primaria, Alex de cuatro años aun no va a la escuela y Miguel que es el más pequeño  de dos años.

Su esposo vende controles para T.V. para DVD, antenas de todo tipo, rastrillos desde hace 13 años, esta vez han solicitado el crédito para comprar más producto del mismo tipo pero para ella sola ya que solo le ayudaba a su esposo ahora ella se quiere independizar para poder elevar sus ganancias ya que los gastos están fuertes entre escuela y hogar.

Ella venderá en la plaza cuatro días a la semana sábados, domingos, lunes y martes. Por el momento su inicio desafío es que los placeros no los dejan vender a gusto y tienen que salir corriendo con la mercaría. Su esperanza es que a ella le vaya mucho mejor que su esposo ya que le gustaría ayudar con los gastos y mejorar su vivienda. “Estoy muy agradecida con el apoyo ya que es de gran ayuda porque podre poner mi puestito aparte”
texts.en:
Carolina is 27 years old and has been married to Sr. Fabián for nine years. They have four children: Lizet is eight years old and in the third grade, Evelyn is seven years old and in the second grade, Alex is four years old and has not started school, and Miguel is the youngest at two years of age.

Her husband has been selling remote controls for televisions and DVD players, antennas of all types, and rakes for 13 years. This time she is requesting a loan to buy more of these same types of products, but for herself. Carolina was the only one helping her husband, but now she wants to be independent so that she can generate more income for school and household expenses.

She sells in the town square four days a week: Saturdays, Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays. At the moment, her initial challenge is that the street vendors do not sell what people like so they must go directly to the market. Her hope is that she does much better than her husband since she likes helping with the expenses and improving her home. Carolina says, “I am very grateful for the support because it will be a great help in making my small sales post stand out from the rest.”

loans.use: to buy remote controls, antennas, and rakes.

loans.name: Sonagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SONAGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amina, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Amina est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à Jean, un maçon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Amina assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes du ménage. Amina n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Amina vend des tissus de façon ambulante, depuis près de cinq ans. Amina achète ses tissus au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Amina n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Amina et les autres membres du groupe SONAGNON sollicitent ensemble un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The SONAGNON group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative is called Amina (she is the lady raising her hand in the photo).  This is the fourth time that this group has requested the financial support of ALIDé in order to expand their businesses.

Amina is 54 years old and married to Jean, a builder.  The couple have two children who are both in school and their responsibility.  Amina and her husband jointly cover their household expenses.  Amina did not attend school.  In order to cover her various expenses, Amina has been selling fabric as a street vendor for nearly five years.  She buys her fabric in Benin.

Amina's customer demand is increasing but, bearing in mind her limited means, she is no longer able to properly meet this demand.  Owing to the fact that they have limited capital, Amina and the other members of the SONAGNON group are together requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  They have fully repaid their previous loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena tiene 39 años de edad está casada con el señor Israel desde hace 22 años tiene dos hijos aun que dependen de ellos Aldo Eruviel de 11 años que está cursando sexto año, José Manuel de cuatro años todavía no va  a la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante el vende artículos de licuadoras, vasos, aspa, rosca, empaque, y tapas.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio de jarcería, donde comprara fibras, pasticos, fregones en cada producto piensa invertir mil quinientos pesos porque las cantidades no las puede dar exactas, la señora lleva 19 años en la actividad.

Ella considera que el problema que presenta son las bajas ventas ya que considera que no es como antes ahora ya casi nadie compra productos de este tipo. Sin embargo la meta que tiene en mente es que su negocio crezca un poco más, también le gustaría tener un local.

“Es la primera vez que participo en el crédito, espero no quedar mal, para que me sigan apoyando para yo poder salir adelante con mi negocio”
texts.en:
Doña Elena is 39 years old and has been married to Sr. Israel since she was 22 years of age.  They have two dependent children, Aldo Eruviel (age 11) who is in the sixth grade and José Manuel (age 4) who is still not in school.  Her husband is a merchant who sells household goods such as blenders, glasses, fans, thread, packaging, and lids.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in her cleaning supply business.  She plans to buy scrubbers, plastics, and scouring pads.  With each product she plans to invest 1500 MXN because the quantities are not exact.  Elena has been in this business for 19 years.  

She considers her problem with low sales to be one that she has not had to face before.  Almost nobody purchases these types of products nowadays.  Nonetheless, her goal that she intends to reach is to grow her business a little more.  She would also like to have a shop.  

Elena says, “This is the first time I have participated in a loan, so I don’t want to fail.  Instead, I hope you will continue supporting me so that I can move forward with my business.”

loans.use: to invest in her cleaning business, buying scrubbers, plastics, and scouring pads.

loans.name: Mi Niño Jesus De Iv Programa Group

texts.es: Sara es una mujer casada de 30 años de edad, tiene una hija y pertenece al grupo de “Mi Niño Jesus de IV Programa, con 8 intengrantes son personas creativas y empeñosas  en cada labor que hacen. Sara tiene el negocio de venta  de articulos de fiestas (piñatería, adornos, decoraciones) en este trabajo tiene 3 años, todo empezó trabajando para una señora, da ahí aprendió y puso su propio negocio, quiere lograr alcanzar toda sus metas y apoyar a su conviviente con la educación para su pequeña hija, con su ultimo préstamo piensa en viajar a provincia para alquilar un local y vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Sara is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has a daughter.  She is part of the group “Mi Niño Jesus de IV Programa”, which has eight members who are creative individuals and committed to each of their businesses.  

Sara has a business selling party supplies such as piñata materials, ornaments, and decorations.  She has been in business for three years.  Sara started out working for another lady, but she used what she learned to start her own business.  She wants to accomplish all of her goals and to support her partner with the education of their young daughter.  With her latest loan, she plans to travel to the province so that she can rent a space where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to expand her business by renting a space for her shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora gloria cuenta con la edad de 45 años, está casada con el señor Anselmo con quien tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 estudian que son los más pequeño, Jerry que cursa sexto año de primaria y Juan Carlos que está en cuarto, ya que los demás todos están casados, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, desde hace mas de 7 años.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, por la falta de trabajo que hay en su comunidad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que como es campesino había días en que no tenía trabajo y más cuando era temporada de lluvias, también para contar con una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de insumos como son: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, pollos, carne, leña, maíz, etc. Para continuar con la elaboración de su rica comida. 
Una de las metas que tiene doña gloria, es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner una fonda de comida mexicana, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos, para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan estudiar una buena carrera profesional.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esta ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old and is married to Anselmo, with whom she has 7 children.  Of these, only the two youngest are still in school: Jerry is in 6th grade, and Juan Carlos is in 4th grade.  All of her other children are married.  Gloria has had a business selling Mexican snacks for more than 7 years.

She says that she started this business due to the lack of jobs in her community, so that she could help out her husband with the expenses.
