Since her husband is a farmworker, there have been days when he didn't have work, and this is particularly the case during the rainy season.  In addition, her business allows them to have a better quality of life.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as: chile peppers, tomatoes, onions, chicken, meat, firewood, corn, etc.  She will use these supplies to continue making her delicious dishes.

One of Gloria's goals is to grow her business a lot, since she wants to eventually have a Mexican food restaurant.  This way she could increase her income, so that she can continue to support her children with their education and help them get a professional degree.

Gloria is very grateful to FRAC and to the Kiva lenders for this great support that they are offering her, since thanks to this help, her business and her family life have changed quite a lot.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: chile peppers, tomatoes, onions, chicken, meat firewood, corn, etc.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.es:
L. señora fidencia cuenta con 58 años D. edad, está casada con el señor amado con quien tiene 8 hijos, D. los cuales ya todos están casados y han hecho su vida aparte, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. carnes y quesos, desD. hace mas D. 18 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su forma D. vida y contar con una solvencia económica, y así poder vivir más cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas carne y quesos.
El anhelo más granD. que tiene doña fiD. (ya que es como mejor L. conocen  sus amistades), es el D. poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y algún día tener una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, para así incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias y ahorrar una parte, por cualquier problema que llegue a atravesar. 
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad, por todo el apoyo y L. confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio. “GRACIAS”
texts.en:
Fidencia, 58, is married to the man she loves, with whom she has eight children, all of them married with their own lives.  She has been selling meats and cheeses for more than 18 years.

She says she started this work because she wanted to support her husband with the household expenses and their children's education.  She also wanted to improve her way of life a little and depend on economic solvency, and so be able to live more comfortably.

She is going to buy more meat and cheeses with the loan she received.

What FiD. (as her friends know her best) most desires is to be able to make her business grow even more, and some day have a little grocery store so she can increase her profits a bit more and save some for any problem she happens to encounter.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for all the support and trust they are offering her, since her life and her business have changed thanks to the support received.  "Thank you."

loans.use: to buy more meat and cheeses.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Wilberforce is the facilitator of the Upendo SHG group. He takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wilberforce had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wilberforce was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilberforce and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Wilberforce will educate his children, and buy food throughout the year.
In 2012, the members of Upendo SHG group will each plant between half and three acres of maize.
In the photograph, Wilberforce is pictured with his group members. Standing at the far left of the photo is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmela, vive en una colonia llamada  Juan sabines y celebran la fiesta de la virgen de Guadalupe el 12 de diciembre, ella vive en unión  libre con el señor dammaseno y con quien tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad.

    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo n la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, hoja de guineo, aceite, pasas, chile ancho, entre otros para la elaboración de tamales, en donde lleva practicando once meses  y ella comenta que le va bien ya que ha logrado tener ganancias para seguir trabajando.

    Lo que lo  motivo a esta actividad es su familia ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  para que así le den lo más necesario a sus hijos que vienen creciendo y necesitan de su apoyo, aun así también su esposo trabaja en de albañil en la misma localidad.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad puedo ir mejorando día con día sus ingreso, para que pueda a hora y comprar un lugarcito para poner su venta.

    Los integrantes del grupo son las señoras: Romelia quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de ropas, doña Martha Noemí, en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y por último  la señora Jael quien el por primera vez que solicita un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de medicamentos naturales.
texts.en:
Señora Carmela lives in Juan Sabines where they celebrate the feast of the Virgin of Guadalupe on the 12 December. She is in a common-law marriage with Señor Dammaseno with whom she has 2 dependent children. 

She is a housewife and is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: meat. banana leaf, oil, raisins, chilis and other products to make tamales, which she has been making for the last 11 months. She says that she is doing well as she has been able to make enough profit to continue working.

What motivated her to start this business is her family as she also wants to support her husband with the household income so that they can give their growing children what is necessary as well as their support. Her husband also works as a bricklayer in the same area.

What she wants the most is that with this small business she can continue to improve her income day by day so that she can save and buy a small place to put her stall.

The members of the group are: Senora Romelia who will invest the loan to buy clothes, Dona Martha Noemi who will buy ingredients to make tacos and last of all Senora Jael for whom this will be the first time that she asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of natural medicines.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina has two businesses. She cooks food and smokes fish for sale. She has been smoking fish for 12 years now. 

She is married and has three children. She uses her income to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying land.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Nawinyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nawinyi Group in Western Kenya! This group is in Chwele district, where One Acre Fund will serve more than 10,000 farmers in 2012.  Like the majority of farmers from Western Kenya, the members of Nawinyi group rely on maize as their primary staple crop.  
Judith is the facilitator of the Nawinyi group. She takes care of four children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest five bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Judith plans on paying school fees for her children, and buying chickens or goats as a form of savings and asset development. 
In 2012, the members of Nawinyi group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture the field officer is featured standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia moves around to sell drinks, bowls, utensils and ladies bags in Elmina. Her husband is a driver. She responsibly takes care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy utensils and bags to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy utensils and bags to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman.  For the past eight years, Ekua has sold drinks, soap, steel wool, toothbrushes, toothpaste and other goods in the vicinity of Elmina. Ekua also assists her husband in taking care of the home. Ekua will use her loan to purchase more soap, steel wool and other items for sale. With the profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to open a provision shop someday.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, steel wool and other items for sale.

loans.name: Nalukesi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nalukesi Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Dickson is the facilitator of the Nalukesi SHG group. He takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access farm inputs on credit, and receive agricultural education relevant to maize farming. In the recent 2011 season, Dickson had an excellent maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dickson was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dickson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Dickson will buy food for his family, and invest in assets such as livestock.
In 2012, the members of Nalukesi SHG group will each plant  between half and three-quarters of an acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is divorced and has five children. She is standing close to the cupboard in which she stores the bread after she has taken it out of the oven to cool (she does this to prevent flies from settling on the bread before it is bagged). She has run her business for about 12 years. Theresa will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, currants and other ingredients for baked goods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, currants and other ingredients for baked goods.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba lives in Elmina with her husband, who is a carpenter. They are blessed with one child. She makes and sells kenkey. Kenkey is made from fermented corn dough. She wants to increase her production of kenkey and thus needs a loan of 1,000 GHS to buy more corn. She wants to buy more now because the price of corn keeps increasing.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married and has one child. She sells cloth and utensils at Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a welder. Beatrice assists her partner to take good care of their home. She will use the loan to purchase more utensils to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is divorced and has eight children. She is a fishmonger who lives in a fishing community called Elmina, located near Cape Coast. She has been a fishmonger for 12 years. The income she makes helps to provide food for the family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Musitati Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musitati Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eunice is the facilitator of the Musitati group. She takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eunice will pay for school fees and basic needs for her family.
In 2012, the members of Musitati group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells rice porridge in the vicinity of Elmina in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has two children she is taking care of. Her business is about eight years old. She is responsible for caring for her home. Her loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients to make porridge to sell. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and other ingredients to make porridge

loans.name: Poulina

texts.en: Poulina is married and has three children. Poulina sells beans, groundnuts and oranges at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a mason. Poulina uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the general needs of the home. She will use the loan to purchase additional oranges for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Poulina plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase additional oranges for sale.

loans.name: Mulukhu V.h.c Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulukhu V.H.C. Group in Western Kenya!  Stephen is the facilitator of the Mulukhu V.H.C. Group. Like the majority of farmers in this part of Kenya, Stephen and his group members rely on maize as their staple crop.  
Stephen takes care of eight children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest four bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Stephen will pay for school fees and ensure that there is enough food in the home.
In 2012, the members of Mulukhu V.H.C. Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es casada, 47 años D. edad, cursó los grados D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica al bordado D. blusas, inició este trabajo como trabajadora para un negocio D. su señora madre y hasta el momento lleva 20 años D. experiencia.

Organiza un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un prestamos que le servirá para la compra D. lustrina D. diferentes colores, ya que el el material principal para que ella pueda producir mas, en el futuro espera tener suficiente capital, incrementar sus ingresos y tener varios empleados. Las demás integrantes del grupos se dedican al bordado, la tejeduría y a la venta D. comida.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina is 47 years old and married. She attended primary school and has 3 children none of whom studies. She embroiders blouses. She started this work as an employee in her mother's business and up until now has 20 years of experience.

She organizes a group with the goal of asking for loans that will be used to purchase lustring (alpaca material) of different colours as it the main material so that she is able to produce more. In the future she hopes to have sufficient capital, increase her income and have several employees. The other members of the group work in embroidery, weaving and selling food.

loans.use: to buy lustring (shiny alpaca material)

loans.name: Namukoya Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namukoya Group in Western Kenya! John is the facilitator of Namukoya group, a group of farmers who are veterans of the One Acre Fund 2011 program, and will re-enroll for 2012.
Many farmers in this area live in very modest conditions, and generally do not have enough money at one time to pay for supplies vital to productive farming before planting season. As a result of poor farming productivity, income poverty and hunger are persistent problems for farming families.  
John takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access high quality inputs on credit, and raise the productivity on his farm. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.  
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, John will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Namukoya Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tafuta Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tafuta OAF Group in Western Kenya! Ronald is the facilitator of the Tafuta OAF Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Ronald takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ronald had an excellent maize yield harvesting fourteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ronald was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ronald and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Ronald will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Tafuta OAF Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Ronald is pictured with his group members, and his field officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tunyo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tunyu Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Priscilla is the facilitator of the group. She takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Priscilla had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Priscilla was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Priscilla and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Priscilla will invest in animal rearing and educate her children.
In 2012, the members of Tunyu Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Priscilla is pictured in the above photograph together with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Patrick is the facilitator of the Upendo Group. He takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting twelve bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest six bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Upendo Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Patrick is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mvumilivu Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Godfrey is the facilitator of the Mvumilivu Group. He takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting ten bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Godfrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Godfrey will educate his children and invest in business.
In 2012, the members of Mvumilivu Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Godfrey is pictured with his group members, and the One Acre Fund field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia, de 45 años; habita en el centro poblado Villa Ashaninga. Ahí formó su familia junto a Teófilo, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia. Para el futuro de los suyos, ella trabaja en grupo con su esposo. Él que se dedica a la siembra de cacao, maíz y cítricos en sus terrenos de cultivo, cuenta que solo poseen 2, pero más adelante sea adquirir más, “eso es mi meta”, afirma. En sus tiempos libres ayuda a su esposo y sobre todo en la cosecha, pues ahí obtienen los resultados de tanto trabajo, vendiendo a los compradores que viajan a sus mismos cultivos donde obtienen ganancias considerables. Pero como la cosecha solo es una vez al año, trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo hamburguesas y papa fritas en una carreta a fueras de su casa, según cuenta tiene una ganancia neta de 30 soles al día. Asimismo su esposo trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos y sembríos. De esa manera pueden solventar los gastos de educación, alimentación y vestimenta durante el año. Ahora desea ahorrar para poder concretar su proyecto y así tener mayor cantidad en sus cosechas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde aprendió todo lo necesario para ahorrar y salir adelante. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Amalia tiene pensado sembrar maíz en sus terrenos productivos. Por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semillas y contrata de personal para que le ayuden en siembra.
texts.en: Amalia is 45 years old and lives in the town centre of Villa Ashaninga. Here she had her family with Teofilo her husband of 25 years.They both have 9 children but only live with 4 of them in their own house. For the future of their children, she works together with her husband. He plants cocoa, corn and citrus on his farming land. She says that they only own 2 but in the future wants to acquire more. "That is my goal," she tells us. In her free time she helps her husband especially at harvest time as it is then that the results of so much work is obtained, selling to the buyers who come to their very land to make considerable profits. However, as the harvest is only once a year, she works at the weekends selling burgers and fries in a stall outside her house. According to her she makes a net gain of 30 soles (PEN) a day. Likewise her husband works as a labourer at different farms and with different crops. In this way they can cover their expenses for education, food and clothing for the year. She now wants to save in order to realize her project and so have a larger harvest. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Naranjales" and this is the 3rd loan with MFP where she learned everything she needed to know about how to save and get ahead. This is why she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Amalia is thinking of planting more corn on her farming land. Receiving your support, she will invest the money asked for to purchase seeds and hire labourers to help with the planting.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and corn seeds and also hire manual labourers.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: El Sr. Nicanor  agricultor nacido  en Chuquisaca, convive con la Sra. Severina,  ella es ama de casa y se dedica a l cuidado de los hijos, hace 20 años que la familia tiene su parcela de 60 hectáreas  en Pampa el Coscal, distante a 40 km de la localidad de el Torno, donde vive y trabaja, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, yuca, es el segundo crédito que tiene con la institución  ya que es la única entidad financiera que le ha dado una mano para mejorar su calidad de vida es por eso que se siente muy agradecido ya que esto le permite crecer económicamente, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, el Sr. Nicanor con la ayuda de su esposa comercializa los productos en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicanor is a farmer born in Chuquisaca. He lives with Ms. Severina. She is a homemaker, dedicated to caring for their children. This family has had their 60-hectare parcel of land for 20 years. It is located in Pampa el Coscal, 40 kilometers from the locality of El Torno, where they live and work.

Nicanor plants corn and yucca. This is his second loan through Emprender, as it is the only financial entity that has given him a hand to help improve his quality of life. For this reason, he feels very grateful, as this will allow him to grow economically. He will use the loan money to plant corn and prepare the land. Nicanor sells his products in the regional market with the help of his wife, directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to prepare his land and plant corn

loans.name: Estefani Yareth

texts.es:
Estefani cuenta con 21 años de edad es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ahorita está viviendo con sus padres, a quienes se dedica a cuidar, ya que es la más chica de 6 hermanos, tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hacen 2 años.
Dice que inicio con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a sus padres económicamente, para mejorar un poco sus gastos y tener una muy buena calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, refrescos, aceite, frijol, arroz, azúcar, galletas, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para así tener mejor surtida su tienda.
Ella está convencida que uno de sus más grandes sueños se podrá cumplir, ya que es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su tienda, puesto que quiere ampliar un poco mas su local, para así tenerlo más surtido con una amplia variedad de productos, y así incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos, tanto como para continuar apoyando a sus padres.
Estefani dice que está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, pero sobre todo por la confianza, ya que con esta ayuda ha logrado mejorar el negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Estefani is 21, single, and has no children.  She lives with and cares for her parents since she is the youngest of six siblings.  She has been running a grocery store for two years.

She says she began this small business because she wanted to have a way to support her parents, cover expenses and have a better lifestyle.  She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as milk, softdrinks, oil, beans, rice, sugar, cookies, toilet tissue, soap, etc., so her store is well-stocked.

She is convinced that one of her greatest dreams can become reality, and that is for her store to grow.  She wants to expand the current location so she can add more product variety.  This will increase and improve her income so she can continue to support her parents.

Estefani is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for this great support, especially for the confidence shown in her, because this help has improved the business and the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy milk, softdrinks, oil, beans, rice, sugar, cookies, toilet tissue, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza cuenta con 24 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 3 hijos, Abelardo, Abraham y amairani, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando segundo primer año de secundaria, el menor 5 año de primaria y la más pequeña segundo año de preescolar, se dedica a la venta de carne, chorizo y quesos, desde hace mas de 6 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida y tener una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas carnes, chorizo, crema y quesos.
La meta que tiene doña lencha (como mejor la conocen sus amigas y personas del pueblo), es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es poner una carnicería, para tener más variedad y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a FRAC y los donadores de kiva por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”
texts.en:
Lorenza is 24 years old. She is a single mother of three children. They are named Abelardo, Abraham and Amairani. The three of them go to school and the oldest is in the seventh grade, and the middle child is in the fifth year of primary school, and the youngest is in her second year of pre-school. She has sold meats, sausages and cheeses for 6 years. 

She says she decided to begin this activity because she wanted to find a way to get her children ahead and offer them a good quality of life and better finances to support their studies. She loan she received was invested in buying more meats, sausages, cream and cheese.  

Doña Lencha's goal (as her friends and neighbors know her) is to grow her business more. What she really wants is to open a butcher shop to have more variety and improve her income. This will help her to support her children getting a profession.  

“I am thankful to FRAC and the Kiva donors for trusting me and offering me their support.”

loans.use: to invest in buying more meats, sausages, cream and cheeses.

loans.name: Banana Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Banana Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eliud is the facilitator of the Banana Group. He takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to high quality farming inputs. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had a very good maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest six bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eliud will pay for school fees.
In 2012, the members of Banana Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Eliud is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: El señor Donato es agricultor, nació en la comunidad de Pérez del departamento de Cochabamba, el tiene 51 años de edad esta separado por el momento de su mujer, pero vive junto con su hijo mayor de 29 años, los dos trabajan en la agricultura, en los sembradíos de maíz, verduras y yuca. También se dedican a criar ganado vacuno, fruto del cual ellos  producen  queso con la leche obtenida de las ordeñas. Es su primer crédito que ha solicitado  con la institución, el señor Donato se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que se le esta brindando ya que esto le permite crecer económicamente, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, el Sr. Donato con la ayuda de su hijo comercializa los productos en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Donato is a farmer. He was born in the community of Pérez in the department of Cochabamba. He is 51 years old and at this time is separated from his wife. He lives with his oldest son, who is 29 years old. Both of them are farmers, planting corn, vegetables and yucca. They also raise cattle with which they produce cheese with the milk. This is his first loan that he has asked for from the institution. Donato is very grateful for the support that has been offered since it has allowed him to grow financially. He will use the money from the loan to plant yucca and to prepare the land. With his son's help, Donato will sell the products in the local market, directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to plant yucca.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 36 años habita en el Centro Poblado “Villa Ashaninga”. Ahí formó su familia junto a Augusto su esposo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos todo ellos menores a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. Con la seriedad y coraje que la caracteriza, ella comenzó a forjar su economía en la “agricultura”, la principal actividad de su familia. Con ayuda de su esposo mantiene su siembra de café, el cual cosechan una vez al año, obteniendo ganancias considerables, pues cuenta que sus cultivos son jóvenes y no requieren de mucho mantenimiento, pero ella los fertiliza constantemente para mantener su calidad. Asimismo se dedica durante el año, al negocio de miel de abeja de la selva, cuyo costo es muy alto, pues tienen propiedades curativas. Vende un promedio de 20 kilos diarios; cuenta que ya tiene 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad, donde tiene clientes fijos. Además Augusto, su esposo, trabaja en el trasporte público con un motocarro, cubriendo las rutas Pichanaki a Sangani donde también obtiene ganancias diarias. Ahora el objetivo de esta familia, es mejorar su nivel de vida y expandir su negocio de miel. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Carmen de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de la maleza que crece en sus cafetales, además de calaminas para techar uno de los cuartos de su casa.
texts.en:
36-year-old Carmen lives in the village of 'Villa Ashaninga'.  There she formed her family together with her husband of 15 years, Augusto.  The couple have three dependent children who they care for and educate in their own home.

With the seriousness and courage that she is noted for, Carmen started creating her own household finances by working in agriculture, the main business activity of her family.  With the help of her husband, she grows coffee which she harvests once a year, making considerable profits.  She tells us that her crops are young and don't require a great deal of maintenance.  However, she fertilizes them constantly to maintain their quality.  During the year, Carmen also works selling rainforest-bee honey.  The cost of this honey is very high because it has curative properties.  She sells an average of 20 kilos a day.  She tells us that she has 8 years experience in this business and has regular customers.  In addition, Augusto, her husband, works in the public transport business with a motorcycle taxi, covering the Pichanki to Sangani route.  This also makes them daily profits.

The current aim of this family is to improve their standard of living and expand their honey business.  Carmen belongs to the 'Los Naranjales' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to make her loan repayments punctually.  With your support, Carmen will invest the money she has requested in buying tools for weeding her coffee plantations.  She will also buy sheets of metal so that she can roof one of the rooms in her house.

loans.use: to buy tools for weeding and to buy sheets of metal for her house

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Almost two years ago, Emily started playing roller derby and fell in love with the sport. After playing for some time, she noticed that there aren’t many retailers who sell roller derby equipment. In March 2011, shortly after selling equipment informally, Emily opened Blue City Skates. She moved the business to a store front and started a website for skaters who don’t have access to a local skate shop. She dedicates most of her time to her main job, but hopes to be at the store full-time after the business grows. Emily’s derby coach volunteers his time at the business to facilitate repairs and sales.
Blue City Skates sells roller skates, protective equipment and accessories for roller derby, hockey, figure skating, speed skating and skateboarding. The business has become increasingly successful, and Emily believes it’s due to the need for recreational skating equipment in her community. She opened the only local skate shop within 200 miles, and most of her advertising has been by word of mouth. 
Emily will use this loan to stock up on skating equipment for the web store. She will also use a portion of it for formal advertising, as well as paying for a sign to put in front of her store.

loans.use: to purchase skating equipment for her web store, and pay for advertising.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar nació en el departamento de Ancash y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.  

El señor Edgar tiene 41 años y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene una hija, él es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en una empresa exploradora de petróleo, él también tiene un pequeña hospedaje. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Edgar requiere el préstamo para  implementar el hospedaje y desea comprar toallas, jaboncillos y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Edgar was born in Ancash department and currently lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Edgar is 41 years old, married, and has one daughter.  He is a hard-working father who supports his family.  He works for an oil exploration company and also owns a small guest house.  He has been in this business for five years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Edgar needs a loan to equip his guest house.  He would like to buy towels, soap and other products.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meets once a month in the town of Salvación.

In the depths of the rainforest in Madre de Dios, there are many natural riches to be found.  The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty.  In the large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers on which it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to equip his guest house, to buy towels, soap, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: New Horizons [Nuevos Horizontes] Group

texts.es:
La señora Aracely Feliciana es casada, tiene 28 años D. edad, cursó los grados D. estudios primarios, tiene 2 hijos 1 D. los cuales estudia, se dedica ala tejeduría D. telas típicas: servilletas, cortes, y sabanas; inició este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 12 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el poyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que servirá para la compra D. materiales: hilos y labores D. diferentes diseños y colores, el el futuro espera contar con suficiente capital y mejorar sus ingresos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican: a la tejeduría, venta D. comida, y a la venta D. productos D. belleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aracely Feliciana is married, 28 years old, has completed primary school and has 2 children, 1 of whom attends school. She weaves traditional fabrics: napkins, cuts of cloth and sheets. She began this job as a worker, currently has 12 years of experience and also counts on the support of her husband who is in the same line of work.

She has organised a group with the aim of soliciting a loan which will allow them to purchase materials: thread and needlework with various designs and colours. In future she hopes to have enough capital to improve her income. The others in the group work in: weaving, food sales and the sale of beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase thread

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina nació en la ciudad de Yanatile y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.  

La señora Paulina tiene 36 años y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un pequeño restaurante donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the town of Yanitile and lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Paulina is 36 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hard-working mother who supports her family.  She has a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Paulina needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, etc.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest of Madre de Dios are home to many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty.  In the large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

La señora Cecilia nació en el departamento Apurímac y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad D. Salvación D. la provincia D. Manu del departamento D. Madre D. Dios.  

La señora Cecilia tiene 66 años y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Cecilia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas D. arroz, bolsas D. azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Salvación. 

La selva D. Madre D. Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques D. Madre D. Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos D. Madre D. Dios la caza es abundante. La selva D. Madre D. Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se pueD. navegar en canoas o lanchas.

Cecilia was born in Apurímac department and currently lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre D. Dios department.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meets once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest in Madre D. Dios hold many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty.  In the large and mysterious forests of Madre D. Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers on which it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina nació en el departamento Apurímac y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.  

La señora Albertina tiene 45 años y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la municipalidad de Salvación, ella también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pasamanería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Albertina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo betunes, cepillos, relojes, pasadores y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Albertina was born in Apurímac department and currently lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Albertina is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  she is a hard-working woman who supports her family and works in Salvación municipality.  She also has a small business selling miscellaneous goods. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.  On this occasion, Albertina needs a loan to buy merchandise such as shoe polish, brushes, watches, hair slides, etc.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meets once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest in Madre de Dios hold many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of spectacular beauty.  The large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where one can sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoe polish, brushes, watches, hair slides, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, de 22 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Rubén, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Cuando tenía 14 años, comenzó a asumir responsabilidades, pues esperaba a su primer hijo. Ello la motivó a comenzar por si sola un negocio donde puede obtener el soporte económico para su familia. La agricultura, actividad que formó desde niña; le ayudó a salir adelante. Sus sembríos constan de café, achiote y yuca, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Cuenta que antes alquilaba extensas áreas de tierra productiva, pero con el tiempo y apoyo de su esposo; logró comprarse uno propio. Lo que más le gusta a ella es comercializar sus frutos en cada campaña agrícola, pues tiene mucho rozamiento en ello, su alegría y experiencia le ayuda a obtener buenas ganancias. Además cría gallinas del campo, las que enseba para luego comercializarlas y así obtener un dinero extra. Ahora sus planes son sembrar mayor cantidad de café, para poder tener una producción fructífera el año que entra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Viviana de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
22-year-old Viviana lives in the indigenous community of Santa María.  There she formed her family together with Rubén, her husband of eight years.  The couple have five children who they care for in their own home.

When she was 14 years old, Viviana started taking on responsibility as she was expecting her first child.  This motivated her to start her own business so that she could financially support her family.  Farming, an activity she has known since she was a child, helped her to get ahead.  She grows coffee, annatto and cassava.  Viviana grows these crops on her own farmland.  She tells us that she used to rent large tracts of land but, over time and with her husband's help, she managed to buy a plot of land of her own.  What Viviana most enjoys is selling her crops each season as there is a lot of interaction involved.  Her cheerfulness and experience help her to make good profits.  In addition, Viviana raises hens which she fattens and then sells in order to make extra money.  Her current plans are to grow a larger quantity of coffee so that she can enjoy an extremely productive year this coming year.

Viviana is a member of the 'Los Amigos Cafetaleros' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your help so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Viviana will invest the money she has requested in buying coffee plants and natural fertilizers for her next sowing period.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
Delia Maria  ha usado el préstamo anterior para el inicio de su negocio y el dinero restante para comprar mercadería. Ahora ella solicita un nuevo préstamo para el mejoramiento de su negocio  y para comprar  víveres y útiles escolares.
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Delia Maria used her previous loan to start her business, with the remaining money being put towards buying merchandise. She is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business, and to buy provisions and stationery for her store. Delia Maria's dream is to buy a car and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and stationery to stock her store

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es: La señora  Erika, se dedica a la venta de ropa, chompas según a la temporada,  es cliente de emprender, forma parte de un grupo solidario  unión la portada desde el año 2007. Actualmente tiene un crédito paralelo que esta en su  tercera secuencia, la cliente es   madre soltera y tiene un hijo de  un  año,  ella se distingue  por ser un clienta  exitosa  en su negocio y tiene  grandes expectativas para seguir creciendo como un cliente  emprendedora. El  crédito lo invertirá en compra  por mayor de chompas de mujer, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona la portada. La Sra. Erika se siente muy feliz y agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que con la oportunidad que le dan permite que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Srta. Erika sells clothes, especially sweaters and jackets, depending on the season. She is a client of Emprender, and has been part of the solidarity group since 2007. Erika currently has another loan which is in it's third cycle. She is a single mother with a one-year-old child, and her home is located in the La Portada neighborhood. Erika is well known for being a client who is successful in her business, with high expectations for continued entrepreneurial growth.

This loan will be invested in buying wholesale women's sweaters. Erika is very happy and grateful to the institution for the support, as the opportunities she has been given have allowed her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale women's sweaters

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino nació en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios ósea vive en la selva del Perú.   

El señor Marcelino tiene 59 años y tiene es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, él es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la Región de la Provincia de Manu como vigilante, él también tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde elabora carpetas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Marcelino requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Marcelino was born in the city of Salvación in the heart of the Madre de Dios department.  He lives in the Peruvian jungle.

Marcelino, age 59, is married and has five children.  He is a hard-working father who gets his family ahead.  He works as a security guard in the region of the Manu province.  He also has a small carpentry shop where he makes desks, chairs, tables and other things.  He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Marcelino now needs the loan to buy wood.

The “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) communal bank meets once a month in the city of Salvación.  

The Madre de Dios jungle has a lot of natural resources at its core.  The Madre de Dios forests are lavish and present an extraordinary beauty.  Hunting is abundant in the large and mysterious jungles in Madre de Dios .  Majestic rivers, which one is able to navigate in canoes or small boats, cuts through the Madre de Dios jungle.

loans.use: to buy wood.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Felipe Nolasco

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Nolasco es casado, tiene 58 años de edad, cursó 6 años de educación primaria,tiene 3 hijos que lo apoyan, se dedica a tender una tienda de consumo, inició este negocio con su señor padre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra productos para su negocio: aguas gaseosas, jugos, galletas, dulces, fideos, lácteos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Felipe Nolasco is married, and he is 58 years old.  He has six years of an elementary school education.  He has three children who help him.  He has a store selling food.  He started this business thanks to God.  He has ten years of experience so far.  He has his wife’s support; she does the household chores.

He is requesting a loan to buy products for his business.  He will buy carbonated waters, juices, cookies, sweets, noodles, and dairy products, etc.  He hopes to have a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy products for his store, such as carbonated waters, juices, cookies, sweets, noodles, and dairy products.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ricardo nació en la ciudad del Cusco en el departamento del Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.     

El señor Juan Ricardo es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en el Gobierno de la Provincia de Madre de Dios de la ciudad de Salvación como jefe de la unidad de personal y en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio mecánico. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Juan Ricardo requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para implementar su pequeño taller mecánico. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 
La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Juan Ricardo was born in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department.  He currently lives in the city of Salvación, Manu province, Madre de Dios department.

Juan Ricardo is a hard-working father who gets his family ahead.  He works as the head of the personnel unit for the government of Madre de Dios in the city of Salvación.  In his free time he works as a mechanic.  He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Juan Ricardo now needs a loan to buy materials to set up a small mechanic’s shop.

The “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) communal bank meets once a month in the city of Salvación.  

The Madre de Dios jungle has a lot of natural resources at its core.  The Madre de Dios forests are lavish in presenting extraordinary beauty.  Hunting is abundant in the large and mysterious jungles in Madre de Dios.  Majestic rivers, which one is able to navigate in canoes or small boats, cut through the Madre de Dios jungle.

loans.use: to buy materials like brakes, pistons, and others.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora florentina cuenta con 38 años de edad y está casada con el señor bismar, con quien tiene 2 hijos, diana y Ricardo, de los cuales los dos estudian la mayor está cursando el segundo año de secundaria y el otro en cuarto año de primaria, se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hacen 10 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque buscaba apoyar a su familia, para mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con una buena solvencia económica y así continuar ayudando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió, lo va a invertir en la compra de mas ropa como son: pantalones, shorts, camisas, playeras, blusas, faldas, vestidos y ropa interior, para tener una amplia variedad de prendas.
El más grande sueño que tiene doña flor (como la conocen en su comunidad), es el de invertirle mucho mas al negocio, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de ropa en su propia casa, puesto que así incrementara sus ingresos, y asegurar la educación profesional de sus hijos.
Dice que está profundamente agradecida con los donadores y fundación realidad, por este gran apoyo que les están brindando.
texts.en:
Florentina is 38 years old and married to Bismar.  The couple have two children, Diana and Ricardo, who are both in school.  Their daughter is in her second year of high school and their son is in his fourth year of elementary school.  Florentina sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years.

Florentina says that she decided to start working in this business because she was looking to support her family, improve their quality of life and be in a good financial position.  She also wanted to continue helping her children with their education.  She invested the loan that she received in buying more clothes such as pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and underwear, so that she could have a wider range of garments available.

Flor (as she is known in her community) tells us that her biggest dream is to invest a lot more in her business so that she can make it grow quickly as she would like to build a sales location and set up a clothes store in her own home.  This would increase her income and guarantee her children's education.  She says that she is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders and Fundación Realidad for the great support that they are providing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and underwear

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocio nació en la ciudad de Arequipa y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios.   

La señora Rocio tiene 30 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene una oficina de radio transferencia donde las personas realizan envíos de dinero y otras  cosas más, ella también se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas, helados, salchipapas y gas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Rocio requiere el préstamo para comprar un carrito salchipapero. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 
La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en: Rocio was born in the town of Arequipa and currently lives in the town of Salvación, in Madre de Dios department. Rocio is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has one son. Rocio is a hard-working mother who supports her family. She has a wire transfer office where people send money transfers. She also sells beer, soda, iced treats, salchipapas (traditional Peruvian fast food) and gas. She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well. On this occasion, Rocio needs a loan to buy a cart for selling 'salchipapas'. The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet once a month in the town of Salvación. The depths of the rainforest in Madre de Dios are home to many natural riches. The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty. In the large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound. The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling 'salchipapas'

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es:
La señora heriberta tiene la edad de 36 años, está casada con el señor Ángel con quien tiene 3 hijos, Erick, Daniela y aron, quienes están estudiando el mayor está cursando el tercer año de prepa, la otra tercer año de secundaria y el menor 6 año de primaria, tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mas de 7 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quería independizarse un poco y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: aceite, leche, arroz, frijol, sal, agua, refrescos, jabón, etc. Para tener mejor surtido.
Doña heriberta tiene un gran sueño y es el de ampliar un poco mas su local, para así tenerlo muy bien surtido y contar con una amplia variedad de productos, ya que así mejorara e incrementara sus ganancias, y así asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, que puedan terminar una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, ya que con esta ayuda ha mejorado su negocio y la vida de su familia
texts.en:
36-year-old Heriberta is married to Mr. Angel. They have three children, Erick, Daniela and Aron. The eldest is studying in the third year of high school, the second in junior year, and the youngest is in the sixth year of primary school. 

Heriberta has a grocery store which she has run for over 7 years. She decided to invest in this business because she wanted some independence, earn her own money, and support her children in their studies. She wants to improve her family's financial solvency and quality of life.

This loan will be invested in purchasing more goods such as oil, milk, rice, beans, salt, water, soft drinks, and soap, giving her a wider variety of products to sell. 

Heriberta has a big dream to expand her business and premises a bit more, so that she can increase the stock and sell a wider variety of products. This will improve the business and increase profits, thus securing the future of their children who could have good professional careers.

She thanks the foundation for the great support that they are providing, and this aid has improved her business and family life

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as oil, milk, rice, beans, salt, water, soft drinks, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Ana Marisol vive en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios.   

La señora Ana Marisol es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene una hija, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño hotel en la ciudad de Salvación donde brinda servicios de hospedaje a los extranjeros y personas que llegan a la ciudad, ella tiene cuartos simples, dobles y matrimoniales y los precios van desde los 10, 15 y 35 soles. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ana Marisol requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al hotel.  

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.  (En la fotografia la socia esta acompañada de su esposo).
texts.en:
Ana Marisol lives in the city of Salvación in the department of Madre de Dios.

She is married, and she and her husband have one daughter. She is a hardworking woman who wants her family to have a better life. She has a small guesthouse in Salvación where she offers lodging to foreigners and other people who travel to the city. She has single and double rooms and her prices are 10, 15, and 35 soles a room. She's had the hotel for several years now and it's going very well. Ana Marisol is requesting a loan to do some maintenance and repairs on the hotel.

The members of the Nueva Generación village bank meet every 30 days in the city of Salvación.

The Madre de Dios jungle is stunningly beautiful and rich in natural resources. Abundant wildlife makes hunting easy in its vast, mysterious forests. Majestic rivers cut through the Madre de Dios jungle and are navigable by canoe or boat. (In the photograph, Ana Marisol is accompanied by her husband.)

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for her hotel.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, de 21 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Lorena, su esposa desde hace un año. Ambos vive en su casa propia. Apenas 3 años que comenzó a forjar sus propios ingresos económicos. Desde niño sus padres le enseñaron a producir la tierra y vivir de ella. Sus principal cultivo constan de café, los cuales comenzó a sembrar en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, por el momento cuenta con una pequeña parcela; pero más adelante comprará más. “Con trabajo, empeño y ahorro lo lograré”, menciona muy entusiasmado. Pues ahora que comenzó a trabajar con su banco comunal, espera ahorrar y tener el capital para invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas y poder incursionar en la siembra de otros productos oriundos de la selva. Además desea tener la estabilidad económica para la llegada de sus futuros hijos, que espera tener más adelante con su esposa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Dany de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para la siembra de plantitas de café y si el dinero le alcanza; comprará herramientas para la limpieza de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Dany, 21, lives in a house in his native village of Santa Maria and has been married to his wife, Lorena, for one year.  Barely 3 years ago he began to earn his own money. Since he was a child  his parents taught him to produce from the earth and to live with her. His main crop is coffee that he started planting on his own fields.  Currently he has one small parcel but he would like to buy more in the future.

He says enthusiastically, “With hard work and savings, I will succeed“.  He has begun to work with his communal bank and he hopes to save and have the capital to buy more fields and to be able to start planting other native products of the jungle.  He also wants to have economic stability for his future children that he hopes to have with his wife.  He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is his second loan from MFP where he appreciates the support of all of you.
He also promises to be punctual with his payments.  Dany will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to plant his coffee seedlings and if he has enough money, he will buy tools to prepare his fields.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer and perhaps some tools

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
L. señora Griselda tiene 24 años D. edad y está casada con el señor Antonio, con quien tiene 2 hijos Tania y Rafael, D. los cuales solo L. mayor estudia, está cursando el tercer año D. preescolar, ya que el más pequeño apenas tiene 1 año D. edad, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. colchas y blancos por catalogo, desD. hacen 6 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, por L. falta D. oportunidades D. trabajo, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus pequeños hijos, también para gozar D. un mejor estilo D. vida, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas mercancía como son: catálogos, edredones, cortinas, sabanas fundas para almohadas y salas, ya que así contara con una amplia variedad D. artículos.
Una D. las metas que tiene doña Griselda es L. D. hacer crecer aun más el negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner su distribuidora D. colchas y blancos, y así mejorar e incrementar las ganancias.
Estoy muy agradecida con los donadores D. kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que nos está brindando  ya que gracias al apoyo contamos con un mejor negocio y forma D. vida.
texts.en:
Griselda is 24 years old and married to Antonio.  The couple have two children: Tania and Rafael.  Only their eldest is in school.  She is in her third year of pre-school.  Their youngest is only one year old.

Griselda's business is selling bedspreads and soft furnishings through a catalog.  She has been in this business for six years.  She says that she decided to start out in this small business because there weren't any job opportunities and she wanted to support her husband with their household expenses and in paying for their young children's education.  She also wanted to enjoy a better lifestyle.  Griselda invested the loan that she was given in buying more merchandise such as catalogs, comforters, curtains, sheets, pillowcases and cushion cases.  This meant she had a wiD. range of goods available.

One of Griselda's goals is to grow her business even further as she would like to build business premises in which to set up a wholesale store selling bedspreads and soft furnishings.  This will help her to improve and increase her profits.  She says "I am very grateful to Kiva lenders for all their support and for the trust that they are placing in us.  Thanks to their support, we have better businesses and a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as catalogs, comforters, curtains, sheets, pillowcases and cushion cases

loans.name: Anamely

texts.es:
La señora anamely cuenta con 33 años de edad, está casada con el señor Juan, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Wendy, América y estefany, de las cuales las tres estudian, dos están en segundo y cuarto año de primaria y la más pequeña esta en tercer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo, desde hacen 8 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas catálogos, labiales, rubores, cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, etc. Y así contar con un mejor surtido de productos.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña Ana (ya que así le dicen en su familia) es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio. “GRACIAS”
texts.en:
Anamely is 33 years old and married to Juan.  The couple have three children: Wendy, América and Estefany.  All three girls are in school.  The two eldest are in the second and fourth year of elementary school and the youngest is in the third year of pre-school.  

Anamely's business is selling perfume and cosmetics through a catalog.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She tells us that she decided to start out in this business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband a little and to support their children with their education so that they can enjoy a better future.  She also wanted to be in a very good financial position.

Anamely invested the loan that she received in buying more catalogs, lipsticks, blusher, creams, perfume, deodorants, etc.  This gave her a better selection of products.  Ana (as her family call her) says that one of her dreams is to grow her business much further and to provide an excellent service so that she can gain more customers and make more and better income.  She says that this is the best support that she could have been given because, as a result, she now enjoys a better quality of life and has a good business.  "THANK YOU".

loans.use: to buy more catalogs, lipsticks, blusher, creams, perfume, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Green

texts.es: Green, de 23 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Carmen, su esposa desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Solange y Gabriel a los que cuidan en su casa propia. “Recién estoy comenzando, aún me falta mucho”, afirma el joven y apuesto Green. Quien cuenta con un terreno productivo, donde siembra café, su único sustento económico.
