Sus ganas de trabajo son increíbles, él es consiente que para tener cultivos de calidad y extensas áreas de cultivo, tiene que ahorrar mucho e invertir gran capital. No se desanima, su alegría y vitalidad le ayudarán a progresar y salir adelante. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es limpiar la maleza que crece entre sus cafetales, como también la temporada de cosecha; pues ve su esfuerzo recompensado en la comercialización de sus frutos en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Pero no solo a esta actividad se dedica, también trabaja en un taller de soldadura durante el año a la espera de la cosecha, porque necesita ingresos económicos para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brinda. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Green de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de sus cafetales, además de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
23-year-old Green lives in the indigenous community of Santa María.  There he formed his family together with Carmen, his wife of five years.  The couple have two children: Solange and Gabriel.  They care for their children in their own home.

"I just recently started out in this business and am still lacking a lot" says the young, handsome Green who has a plot of farmland where he grows coffee, his only financial means of support.  Green's desire to work is incredible.  He is aware that in order to produce good-quality crops over vast tracts of land he must save up a lot and invest a lot of capital.  He is not discouraged.  His cheerfulness and vitality will help him to make progress and get ahead.  He already has three years experience and what he most enjoys about his work is getting rid of the weeds that grow between his coffee plants and also the harvest season.  This is when he sees his hard work rewarded when he sells his beans in the town of Pichanaki.  

However, this is not the only work that Green does.  He also works in a welding shop during the year while he is waiting for the harvest season because he needs income with which to buy food and pay for his children's education.

Green is a member of the "Los Amigos Cafetaleros" community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given.  For this reason, he pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  With your support, Green will invest the money that he has requested to buy tools for weeding his coffee plantations and natural fertilizers to spread over his crops.

loans.use: to buy tools for weeding and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
L. señora margarita cuenta con 78 años D. edad, está casada con el señor armando quien es campesino, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo L. menor estudia, Ana erendira está cursando el 4 año D. L. carrera en derecho, ya que los demás todos están casados, se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. pan desD. hace mas D. 30 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, por que su madre se dedicaba a esto y le enseño muy bien, para así apoyar un poco a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también así hacerse D. una mejor solvencia económica y  calidad D. vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en L. compra D. mas insumos para L. elaboración del pan como son: harina, huevos, azúcar, piloncillo, manteca, carbonato, colorante, caneL., levadura leña, etc.
ElL. dice que una D. las metas que tiene para su negocio, es L. D. hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner su panadería, así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, y poder seguir apoyando a su hija con sus estudios, para que pueda terminar su carrera.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores D. kiva por todo el apoyo que les están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ahora cuenta con un mejor negocio y nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 78 years old and married to Armando who is an agricultural worker.  They have five children but only their youngest is still studying.  Ana Erendira is in the fourth year of a law degree.  The other children are all married.  Margarita has been making and selling bread for more than 30 years.

Margarita tells us that she decided to start working in this business because her mother was in the same business and she taught her very well so that she could support her husband a little with the household expenses and help pay for their children's education.  She has also managed to improve her financial situation and her quality of life.

Margarita invested the loan that she received in buying more supplies for making bread such as flour, eggs, sugar, 'piloncillo' (unrefined whole cane sugar), butter, bicarbonate, dyes, cinnamon, yeast, firewood, etc.  She says that one of the goals she has for her business is to grow it a lot as she would like to build premises for her bakery so that she can improve and increase her profits and continue supporting her daughter in her studies so that she can finish her degree.

Margarita is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all the support that they give her because it has meant that she now has a better business and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, eggs, sugar, 'piloncillo' (unrefined cane sugar), butter, bicarbonate, dyes, cinnamon, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
L. señora Martha cuenta con L. edad D. 39 años y está casada con el señor Isidro desD. hacen 19 años, juntos tiene 3 hijos génesis, Emanuel y sarai quienes están estudian, L. mayor curso el segundo año D. prepa, uno más segundo año D. primaria y L. pequeña tercer año D. preescolar, se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. pan desD. hacen 10 años.
Dice que se animo a invertir en este negocio, ya que quería buscar L. forma D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también para gozar D. un mejor nivel D. vida, al igual que una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas insumos como son: harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, caneL., bicarbonato, leña, etc. Para continuar con L. elaboración D. su producto.
Doña marta comenta que uno des retos que tiene en su negocio es el D. hacerlo crecer un poco más, ya que quiere poner una panadería, para así tener una amplia variedad D. productos, así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que le ayudan a seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
“Estoy muy agradecida con fundación realidad por este gran apoyo que han dado, ya que podre ampliar un poco más le negocio y tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto con mi familia”. Gracias
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old, and has been married to Isidro for 19 years. They have 3 children, Génesis, Emanuel and Sarai, who are in school. The oldest girl is in her second year of high school, the boy is in his second year of elementary school and the little girl is in her third year of preschool. 

Martha has worked making and selling bread for 10 years. She says she was inspired to start this business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with the household expenses and her children with their studies, and to enjoy a better standard of living as well as economic solvency. She is going to invest the loan money in purchasing more baking supplies, such as flour, oil and butter, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, baking soda, firewood, etc., so she can continue making her products. 

Martha says that one of her business goals is to make it grow a little more. She wants to have a bakery shop so she can have a wiD. variety of products, thereby increasing and improving her sales and income, so she can continue supporting her children with their education. "I am very grateful to Fundación Realidad [FRAC] for this great support they have given, so that I will be able to expand the business a little more and have a better quality of life for me and my family. Thank you."

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as flour, oil and butter, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, baking soda, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Yuridia

texts.es:
La señora yuridia tiene 30 años de edad, y está casada con el señor cesar, con quien tiene 2 hijos Eduardo y Carmen de los cuales los dos estudian, el mayor está cursando el segundo año de primaria y la más pequeña primer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la venta de colchas y blancos por catálogos desde hacen más de 8 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y a sus pequeños con sus estudios, también para contar con una buena solvencia económica y una mejor vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: sabanas, cortinas, edredones, toallas, fundas para almohadas y salas, etc. Y así tener un poco mas surtido.
Doña Yuri (así es como le dicen sus compañeras del grupo), comenta que el más grande propósito que tiene para su negocio, es el de hacerlo crecer  mucho mas, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de blancos, puesto que así aumentara sus ganancias, para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
Ella está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por esta ayuda que les están ofreciendo, ya que les beneficia muchísimo.
texts.en:
Yuridia is 30 years old and married to Cesar.  The couple have two children, Eduardo and Carmen, who are both in school.  The eldest is in his second year of elementary school and the youngest is in her first year of pre-school.  Yuridia sells bedspreads and other home products through catalogs.  She has been in this business for more than eight years.

Yuridia says that she decided to start out in this business because she was looking for a way to support her husband with their household expenses and  pay for their young children's education.  She also wanted to be in a good financial position and enjoy a better quality of life.

Yuridia invested the loan that she received in buying more merchandise such as sheets, drapes, comforters, towels, pillowcases, cushion covers, etc.  This helped her to stock her business a little better.  Yuri (as she is known by her fellow group members) says that her biggest goal for her business is to grow it a lot more.  She would like to build premises and set up a store selling home products.  This would increase her profits and guarantee her children's education.

Yuridia is very grateful to Kiva lenders and FRAC (Fundación Realidad A.C.) for the help that they are providing as it benefits her a lot.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sheets, drapes, comforters, towels, pillowcases, cushion covers, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
L. señora Susana cuenta con 40 años D. edad y está casada con el señor marco Antonio, con el cual tiene 4 hijos, Antonio, mariza, Gerardo y María lucero D. los cuales, solo 2 estudian el mayor primer año D. prepa y L. otra está cursando segundo año D. secundaria, ya que los demás están casados, elL. se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos  mexicanos, desD. hacen más D. 4 años.
ElL. comenta que decidió iniciar con esta pequeña actividad, ya que quería independizarse un poco y buscar L. amanera D. apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas insumos como son: jitomates, chiles, cebollas, carne, pollo, maíz, lechuga, aguacate, papas, quesos, aceite, sal, etc. Y así seguir con L. preparación D. sus ricos antojitos.
Doña Susana dice que L. meta que tiene para su negocio, es D. hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere poner un comedor económico, para así contar con una amplia variedad D. platillos, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias puesto que podrá continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
Da las gracias a FRAC y los donadores D. kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, y sobre todo por confiar en elL..
texts.en:
Susana is 40 years old and is married to Marco Antonio.  The couple have four children: Antonio, Mariza, Gerardo and María Lucero.  Two of their children are in school.  The eldest is in his first year of senior high school and the other is in her second year of high school.  The rest are married.  Susana makes and sells Mexican snacks.  She has been in this business for more than four years.

Susana tells us that she decided to start out in this small business because she wanted to become independent and find a way of supporting her children in their education.

Susana invested the loan that she received in buying more supplies such as tomatoes, chilis, onions, meat, chicken, corn, lettuce, avocado, potatoes, cheese, oil, salt, etc. so that she could continue making her delicious snacks.  Susana says that her goal for her business is to grow it much further.  She would like to set up a cheap eatery so that she can offer a wider range of dishes and thereby improve and increase her profits which would allow her to continue supporting her children with their higher education.

Susana thanks FRAC (Fundación Realidad A.C.) and Kiva lenders for the great support that they are providing.  Above all, she thanks them for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as tomatoes, chilis, onions, meat, chicken, corn, lettuce, avocado, potatoes, cheese, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es: Pepe, de 34 años habita en la comunidad nativa de Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Matilde, su esposa desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos todos ellos menores, a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. “Tuve que trabajar mucho para lograr todo lo que hoy tengo, hasta lo más pequeño”, menciona Pepe. El trabajo al que se dedica es la “agricultura”, sus siembras constan de café, plátano y achiote; los cuales siembra en sus 6 terrenos productivos, que son propios. Según cuenta trabajó mucho para poder adquirirlos, pues no tenía nada y poco a poco junto dinero. Ahora él cuida con mucho esmero de sus cultivos, “no es nada difícil”, afirma; pues su esposa e hijos lo ayudan con dedicación. Durante al año programa cada siembra para tener ingresos económicos constantes, ya que tiene que solventar los estudios de sus hijos y ahorrar para mejorar su producción; pues los comerciantes que visitan su zona, exigen siempre productos de calidad en cada cosecha. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Pepe de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales (guano de coral), para esparcir en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Pepe, 34, lives in the indigenous community of Santa María, with Matilde, his wife of 12 years, and their family. They have 5 young children, whom they care for and educate in their own home. 

"I had to work hard for everything I have today, even the smallest little thing," says Pepe. The work he does is farming. His crops consist of coffee, plantains, and annatto [a tree whose fruit and seeds are used for flavoring, colorants and dyes for foods and cosmetics] which he grows in the 6 productive fields that he owns. He worked very hard to be able to acquire these lands, starting with nothing and gathering money little by little. 

Now he looks after his crops with enormous care. "It's not difficult," he says, since his wife and children help him with great dedication. Throughout the year he plans each planting so as to have a constant source of income. This way he can cover the costs of his children's education and save to improve his produce, since the dealers who visit his area always demand quality products from each harvest. 

He belongs to "Los Amigos Cafetaleros" [The Coffee-grower Friends] communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP. With your support he hopes to continue in his goals. He also promises to be punctual with his payments. On receiving your support, Pepe will invest the requested money in purchasing natural fertilizers (farmyard manure) to spread in his coffee fields.

loans.use: to purchase bags of natural fertilizer to spread in his coffee fields.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
En este  grupo se salieron  unas de sus imtegrantes por que sus negocios no funcionaron era mas lo que invertian en comprar lo que necesitan que lo que ganaban , pero a pesar de eso estan felices por que lo intentaron.
Las persona que entraron al grupo son: la señora Margarita,la señora Donaciana, la señora Sixta y el señor Candido quienes ya tiene su negocio pero desean hacerlo mas grande.
La señora Felicitas se dedica a la venta  de pan  ,e guta  ucho su negocio por que le deja muy buenas ganancias ya que desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a la venta de pan po que mama ha eso se dedicaba.
En las fechas que tiene mas ventas es cuando hay bodas, bautosos y muertos ya que es cuando le encargan el pan tres dias antes .
Pidio el prestamo para comprar mas ingredientes para hacer pan como son: harina,huevo,manteca,levadura y royal.
Esta muy agradecida con su madre ya que fue ella quien le enseyo ese negocio y esta muy orgullosa de si misma por poderlo manegar , por que sus clientes estan muy contentos por el buen servicio que les brinda  y por hacer ese pan tan delicioso y por manos de una persona indigena que  tiene ganas de superarse.
Se siente contenta por que cuendo hay vacaciones y van personas al pueblo  le compran pan ya  que cuando  que cuando se van a regresar le compran por mayoreo para  que las otras personas lo prueben.
Le da las gracias a funadcion por el apoyo que le ha dado y por el interes que muestra por sus compañeras del grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called San L..  One of its members dropped out because her business didn’t work out; she was investing more in purchases than what she was earning in profits.  Despite this, however, she’s happy to have attempted it.

The people who joined the group are: Margarita, Donaciana, Sixta and Cándido who already have businesses and want to make them bigger.

Felicitas sells bread.  She likes her business very much because it produces good profits.  She’s sold bread since she was a little girl because her mother was also in this occupation.

The dates when she sells most is when there are weddings, baptisms or the Day of the Dead because orders are placed three days ahead of time.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make bread like: flour, eggs, shortening, yeast and Royal baking powder.

She is very grateful to her mother because she taught her this business and she’s very proud of herself for being able to manage it and because her customers are very happy for the good service she provides and because the bread she makes is so delicious and made by an indigenous person who wants to improve herself.

She feels happy because when it is vacation season people come to the town and buy bread from her and buy it at wholesale to take it back to where they came from so other people can taste it.

She thanks the Fundación for the support it’s provided and for the interest it shows for her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es: Ingresaron al grupo Virgen de Juquila la señora Rosalinda va a comprar un anaquel y medicamento para surtir su farmacia, la señora Yesenia va a comprar telas por metro, hilos, agujas, resorte, botones, forros, etc. para surtir su taller de costura, las demás integrantes siguen en su actividad de alfareria. La señora Ernestina tiene 40 años de edad , ella es casada tiene 2 hijas le ayudan a trabajar a elaborar los ollas y los platos de barro, ella solicito su crédito para comprar barro, barro blanco y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la alfarería, este negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo y es en su casa no descuida a sus hijas, ella se siente orgullosa de saber  elaborar las ollas y los platos de barro, a ella le gusta cuando vende y tiene dinero, las ganancias las vuelve a invertir en los materiales para seguir trabajando, ella está feliz y contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar el barro, barro blanco y leña para tener materiales almacenados e ir trabajando, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando,que crezca su negocio y toda la familia este bien. Los integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, muchas gracias con su ayuda salimos adelante con los negocio y vivir mejor con la familia.
texts.en:
Rosalinda, who will buy shelving and medicines to stock her pharmacy, and Yesenia, who will buy fabric by the meter, thread, needles, elastic, buttons, lining, etc. to stock her sewing shop, joined the “Virgen de Juquila” group.  The other members continue with their pottery activities.

Ernestina, 40, is married and has two daughters who help her make clay pots and dishes.  She requested the loan to buy clay, white clay and firewood.  She started her business five years ago; her parents taught her how to make pottery.  This business is important because she has work and it’s home-based so she can watch her daughters.  She feels proud to know how to make clay pots and dishes.  She likes it when she makes sales and has money.  She reinvests profits in materials so that she can continue to work.  She’s happy and content with this loan she’s going to get that she’ll use to buy clay, white clay and firewood in order to have supplies on hand to continue working.  Her dreams and hopes are to continue working, that the business continues to grow and that the entire family is well.  

The group members thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans; thanks to the loans they can make progress in business and live better with their families.

loans.use: to buy clay, white clay and firewood.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.en: Danilo is in his third year running a small convenience store. His last loan enabled him to diversify his inventory and grow his customer base. His business has been doing really well in the last year and he is ready to again expand his inventory. He will use the new loan to buy bulk quantities of basic grains, sodas, drinks and snacks. This loan enables Danilo to buy his products in bulk and at lower prices so that his returns are greater. Danilo hopes to continue growing and reinvesting in his business so he can provide a stable future for his wife and 8-year-old son. Danilo's son is in third grade and he is proud that he can afford to have his son continue his education.

loans.use: To invest in buying products to increase his sales

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yesenia; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, ella realiza trabajos en cortes de pelo, teñidos y ondulaciones, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el salón de belleza como ruleros, tijeras, tintes y shampus.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yesenia, 32, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a beauty salon.  She does haircuts, hair coloring and hair waving.  She works from 9am until 7pm.  She is able to support her children with this business and she wants to expand and improve it.  She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like rollers, scissors, hair dye and shampoo for the beauty salon.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 28 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Justina, su esposa desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Fiorela y Emanuel a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Él es un hombre sincero y amable, todas las mañanas se dirige a sus tres terrenos productivos, donde siembra, café, achiote y plátanos en la misma proporción. Cuenta que en temporada de cosecha pasa la mayor parte del día cultivando, limpiando y fertilizando sus sembríos. Los mismos que después comercializa en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene gran acogida; pues sus clientes son conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, en especial del grano de café. A pesar de tener ingresos fijos con la cosecha de plátanos cada 15 días. Él se dedica también al trabajo de peón en otros terrenos de cultivo, donde le pagan una suma considerable de dinero cada fin de semana. Ahora sus intensiones son mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, en especial de plátanos; por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal, donde ahora pertenece y espera encontrar el socio para su progreso. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Pues está seguro cumplirá con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Manuel, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 300 mamones (plantitas de plátanos), para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, 28, lives in the community of Santa María.  He formed his family there with Justina, his wife of 7 years.  They have two children: Fiorela and Emanuel who they care for in their own house.  He’s a sincere, kind man.  Every day he heads out to his three fields where she grows coffee, achiote [annatto] and bananas in equal proportions.  He relates that during growing season he spends most of the day cultivating, weeding and fertilizing his crops which, once harvested, he sells in the city of Pichanaki where they are well received because his customers are aware of the quality of his crops, especially his coffee beans.  

Despite having steady income with banana harvesting every two weeks, he also works as a field hand on other fields where he’s paid a considerable sum of money each weekend.  Now, his intention is to improve the quality of his crops, especially the bananas, and this is why he appreciates the support he gets from the communal bank that he belongs to and hopes will become his partner for progress.

He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is his first MFP loan; he’s thankful for the opportunity he’s being given and he’s sure that he’ll reach his objectives.  Besides, he promises to be punctual with his payments.  If Manuel were to receive your support, he’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of 300 “mamones” (banana seedlings) for this next planting.

loans.use: to buy 300 banana plants.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jeny; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de costurera, ella cose pantalones, blusas y ternos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y los trabajos los hace a pedidos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de costurera, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de costurera. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, botones, agujas, tijeras y plancha.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jeny, 24, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with a sewing shop.  She makes pants, blouses and dresses.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  Her work is done to order.  She wants to expand and improve her sewing shop and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, buttons, needles, scissors and an iron.  She is happy for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors and an iron.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 37 años es un responsable padre de familia. Vive en compañía de Hilda, su esposa desde hace 6 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Brian, Brandy y Jhon; a los que alimenta y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar para el futuro de su familia. La siembra de café, plátanos y achiote son sus principales cultivos y medio de sustento económico; en todo este tiempo logró adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Pero la falta de capital de trabajo, hace que solo siembre en 3 de ellos. A pesar de su limitación no se desanima, al contrario lo incentiva a trabajar con mayor empeño para concretar su objetivo. Pues desea incrementar su producción, ahora tiene un vivero con 4 mil plantitas de café, los cuales piensa sembrar a fines de año y así comenzar a producir en mayor cantidad. Ya que tiene buenos clientes en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde vende su producción y espera poder seguir brindándole un buen grano de café y achiote para el futuro. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Edgar de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de sus cafetales, asimismo comprará sacos de fertilizantes naturales para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edgar, 37, is a responsible father.  He lives with Hilda, his wife of six years.  Together they have three children: Brian, Brandy, and Jhon, whom they nurture and raise in their own house, located in the native community of Santa María.

Ten years ago he began to work for his family's future.  Coffee, bananas, and annatto are his principal crops and means of economic support.  In all this time, thanks to his effort he has managed to acquire five hectares of agricultural lands, but lacking working capital, he has only been able to work three of them.  Despite this limitation he is not discouraged; on the contrary, it gives him the incentive to work with greater determination to realize his goal.

Because he wants to increase his production, now he has a nursery with four thousand little coffee plants, which he plans to plant at the end of the year and so begin to produce in greater quantities.  Since he has good customers in the city of Pichanaki, where he sells his products, he hopes to be able to continue offering them a good coffee bean and annatto in the future.

He belongs to the Los Amigos Cafetaleros communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP.  He hopes for the support of all of you to continue with his goals.  In addition, he promises to be punctual with his payments.

If he receives your support, he will use the requested money to buy tools for clearing his coffee plantations, and he will also buy sacks of natural fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and tools to clear his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es: Gioconda trabaja para la Renta de Chontales desde hace 8 años, desempeñandose como inspector fiscal. Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de comenzar la construccion de su casa, ya cuenta con parte de los materiales los cuales ha ido comprando poco a poco con los creditos que se le han financiado, pero ahora  necesita el cemento, arena y mano de obra para iniciar la construccion de su vivienda.
texts.en: Gioconda has been working as a tax inspector for the Chontales Tax Office for eight years.  She is requesting her seventh loan with the aim of starting to build her house.  She already has some of the materials she needs as she has been gradually buying them with her previous loans.  Now she needs to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs, so that she can start building her house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 45 años de edad soltero, labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año como Policia Municipal. Esta solicitando su  3er  credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales para apoyar a su hija  Nereyda que se acaba de casar y hacerle un pequeño cuarto donde tenga comodidad y privacidad ahora que inicia su vida de casada.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 45 years old and single.  He has been working for Juigalpa City Council for one year as a city police officer.  He is requesting his third loan with the aim of buying building materials to support his daughter Nereyda who is recently married.  He would like to build her a small room where she can be comfortable and enjoy some privacy now that she is starting her married life.  Luis' biggest dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda, de 23 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 3 hijos: Flor, Cindy y Joemel. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa María. A pesar de su corta edad, ella logró muchas cosas. Cuenta con 8 terrenos productivos en donde siembra café, achiote, plátano y maíz, sus principales sembríos. Ella trabaja con mucho esmero, desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer, pues sabe que es el único soporte de su familia. Además de ser muy astuta y aprovechar al máximo su tiempo, ya que también cría gallinas de campo, los cuales enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Ya tiene 9 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es su independencia, pues tiene la libertad de disponer de su dinero y las decisiones para la mejora de su negocio, más le dificultad la falta de apoyo, por eso tiene que contratar constantemente peones para que le ayuden en el mantenimiento y desarrollo de sus cultivos. Su objetivo es obtener una estabilidad económica para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Benilda piensa sembrar plátano y maíz en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los peones que le ayudarán a posear (orificios en la tierra para plantar semilla e injertos).
texts.en:
23-year-old Benilda is a courageous single mother who has three children: Flor, Cindy and Joemel.  They live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Santa María.

In spite of her young age, Benilda has achieved many things.  She has eight plots of land where she grows coffee, annatto, bananas and corn.  These are her main crops.  She works with a lot of care, from very early in the morning until nightfall, as she knows that this is the only source of support for her family.  In addition to being very smart, Benilda makes the most of her time as she also raises hens which she fattens and then sells at a higher price.  She has nine years experience and what she most enjoys about her work is her independence as she has freedom with her money and the freedom to make her own decisions in order to improve her business.  The difficulty she faces is a lack of support.  For this reason, she constantly has to hire laborers to help her maintain and develop her crops.  Her goal is to achieve financial stability so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Benilda is a member of the 'Los Amigos Cafetaleros' community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Benilda is planning to grow bananas and corn on her land.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in paying laborers to help her 'posear' (make smalls holes in the ground in order to plant seeds and grafted plants).

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel de 36 años de edad es soltero, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 4 años. Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de continuar con la construccion de su casa, pues el credito anterior le sirvio para levantar las paredes, y ahora necesita comprar las puertas y ventanas.
texts.en: Israel, 36, is single.  He has worked for the City of Juigalpa as a cleaner for the last four years.  He’s asking for his 4th loan to continue building his house.  He used the previous loan to erect walls and now he needs to buy the doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Iris Zulema

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Iris Zulema; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos carteras, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes instituciones y al público en general desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carteras y calzados La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carteras y calzados.  
                                                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Iris Zulema, 48, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She’s single and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling shoes and wallets.  She is an independent vendor and takes her wares to various institutions and to the general public from 8am until 7pm.  She is able to support her children through this activity and would like to expand the business so is asking for a loan to buy wallets and shoes.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony, de 28 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Anita, su esposa desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura; sus principales cultivos constan de café, plátano, achiote y maíz; los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Cuenta que tiene 2 hectáreas, los cuales adquirió gracias a su perseverancia y empuje, pues es muy alegre. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es poder vivir en el campo, “me gusta sentir el aire y la paz que brinda la naturaleza”, comenta mientras cuenta que vende su producción a la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene compradores fijos. Además de prepararse para su próxima cosecha de achiote, donde está segura podrá obtener buenos resultados. Con ello espera ahorrar lo necesario y así obtener un negocio propio para el futuro de sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar trabajando. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jhony de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jhony, 28, lives in the community of Santa María.  He formed his family there with Anita, his wife of 8 years.  They have four children, all minors that they care for in their own house.  He started working in farming when he was still a young man.  His main crops are coffee, bananas, achiote [annatto] and corn that he grows in his own fields.  He relates that he owns two hectares that he acquired through perseverance and drive since he’s very cheerful.  He has 8 years’ experience and what he enjoys the most is being able to live in the countryside.  He says: “I like to feel the air and peace that nature provides.”  He also relates that he sells his harvests in the city of Pichanaki where he has regular buyers.  He’s getting ready for his next achiote planting where he’s expecting good results.  He hopes with them to be able to save up what’s needed to acquire a business of his own for his children’s future.

He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he hopes for support from all of you to be able to continue working.  He promises to be punctual with his installment payments.  If Jhony were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of coffee seedlings and natural fertilizer for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, D. 64 años, es una adorable abuelita; que hace algún tiempo perdió su compañero y amigo,”su esposo”; ahora ella vive con su nieta Lesli D. 16 años, a quien cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D. Huaracayo. A pesar D. su edad; su fuerza y vitalidad siguen siendo su mayor virtud; ya tiene 50 años D. experiencia en la agricultura; D. la que según sus propias palabras, es su mayor satisfacción.
Sembrar maíz, papa, col, arveja y habas; le han generado grandes utilidades y en todo el tiempo que trabajó con su asociación, pudo adquirir un pequeño local en el mercado central D. su ciudad, ahí venD. los días miércoles, viernes y domingo, los productos que cosecha en sus terrenos D. cultivo. También compra algunas cosechas a terceras personas, cuando venD. todos sus alimentos. Sabe que su fuerza y vitalidad disminuirán con el pasar del tiempo y pensando en el futuro D. su nieta; está planeando darle un mejor acabado a las 3 casas que logró adquirir con tanto esfuerzo; sus planes son arrendarlas y obtener un dinero extra, con lo que pueda vivir sin dificultad y brindarle lo mejor a su nieta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Vamos al futuro huaracaino” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el poyo que le brindan; “con su apoyo puD. vencer muchas dificultades”, asegura. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Catalina D. recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. sacos D. fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío D. maíz.
texts.en:
Catalina, 64, is an adorable grandmother who some time ago lost her partner and friend: her husband.  Now, she lives with her granddaughter, Lesli, 16, who she cares for and educates in her own house located in Huaracayo.  Despite her age, her strength and vitality continue to be her greatest virtue.  She has 50 years’ experience in agriculture which, according to her very own words, is her greatest satisfaction.

To plant corn, potatoes, cabbage, peas and lima beans has generated great profits and all the time she worked with her association she was able to acquire a small locale in her city’s central market where she sells every Wednesday, Friday and Sunday the product she grows in her fields.  She also buys some crops from others when she sells out all her food. 

She’s aware that her strength and vitality will diminish in time and thinking of her granddaughter’s future she’s planning to proviD. better finishing touches to the three houses she’s acquired with so much effort.  Her plan is to rent them out to earn extra income that she can use to live problem free and to proviD. the best for her granddaughter.

She belongs to the “Vamos al Futuro Huaracaino” communal bank and this is the 12th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s being given.  “With your support I was able to overcome many difficulties,” she states, and this is the reason why she promises to be punctual with her repayments.  If Catalina were to receive your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of sacks of natural fertilizer for her next corn planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Silvia de 37 años de edad es casada, tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar, labora para el gobierno desde hace 24 años como Asesora Pedagogica. Esta solicitando su 7mo. credito con el objetivo de mejorar a su nueva vivienda, pues anteriormente vivia en Nueva Guinea y acaba de ser trasladada a Juigalpa, y su nueva vivienda no cuenta con las mejores condiciones para sus hijos, por eso desea acondicionarle los cuartos a sus hijos y asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Silvia, 37, is married and has five school age children.  She’s been employed by the government for the last 24 years as a teaching consultant.  She’s asking for her 7th loan to improve her new house because she used to live in Nueva Guinea and she’s just been transferred to Juigalpa and her new house does not have the best conditions for her children so she wants to fix up her children’s rooms to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve the rooms in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build an addition.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas y leches, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite y galletas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se  compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 48, single, and has two children. Along with her daily activities, she has a grocery store. She sells basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, cookies, and milk. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm, and through this business, she is helping her children get ahead in life.

She wants to expand the grocery store.  She is applying for the loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oil and cookies.  Guillermina is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cookies for her business.

loans.name: Karen Lisseth

texts.es: Karen de 22 años de edad es soltera, tiene un bebé de meses de nacido, trabaja para el supermercado Tiangue Cocibolca desde hace 8 meses desempeñandose como cajera.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su cuarto repellandolo y embaldosandolo, pues necesita que su bebé tenga las mejores condiciones para su desarrollo.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su hijo un hogar feliz y que cuando crezca sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Karen is 22 and single. She has several months-old baby. She has been working for eight months for the Tiangue Cocibolca supermarket as a cashier. 

She is applying for her first loan, with the aim of improving her room by plastering and tiling it.  This is because she needs her baby to have the best conditions for its development. 

Her greatest dream is to offer her son a happy home, and that when he grows up he will be a person of worth.

loans.use: To renovate a room.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Misael; el tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ternos y también tiene un negocio de internet, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y el negocio de confección de ternos lo realiza en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de internet y negocio de confección de ternos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar de ternos  como telas y tijeras y para el mantenimiento de sus computadoras.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Misael belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank, located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. 

Misael is 27, and single.  Along with his daily activities, he makes suits, and also has an internet business. He works from 7:00am to 9:00pm. He is carrying on the suit-making business on his own. By means of these businesses he is raising his children. He wants to expand his internet business, and his suit-making business. 

He is applying for a loan to buy materials for making suits such as fabric and scissors, and to pay for the maintenance of his computers. He is happy about receiving the loan, and promises to make his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy materials for making suits, such as fabric and scissors; and to maintain his computers.

loans.name: Tania Xilonem

texts.es: Tania de 30 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, trabaja para el supermercado Tiangue Cocibolca desde hace 8 meses desempeñandose como responsable de alimentos y verduras.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar las puertas para su casa, pues poco a poco ha ido haciendo su casita y le falta instalar las puertas para brindar mayor seguridad a su casa y a su familia.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a sus hijos un hogar feliz y que cuando crezcan sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Tania is 30, single, and has two school-age children. She has been working eight months for the Tiangue Cocibolca supermarket, where she is responsible for the food and vegetables section.

She is applying for her first loan with the aim of buying doors for her house. She has been working on her small house little by little, and needs to install the doors in order to provide greater security for her home and family. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her children a happy home, and that they be respectable people when they grow up.

loans.use: To buy doors for her house.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ternos, pantalones, blusas, la socia tiene una tienda de confecciones donde trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de confección de ternos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar telas, tijeras, hilos y agujas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Livia belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 52, married, and has three children.  Along with her daily activities, she has a business making suits, pants, and blouses. She has a sewing shop where she works from 7:00am to 9:00pm. Through this business, she is helping her children get ahead in life. 

She wants to expand and improve the suit-making business.  She is applying for the loan to buy fabric, scissors, thread, and needles.  Livia is happy to receive the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy fabric, scissors, thread and needles.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de quesos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8.00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar quesos al por mayor.    
                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the Kanchary communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Marcelina, age 47, is single and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cheese.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand her business of selling cheese.  She is requesting the loan to buy cheese wholesale.

She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Ofelia Ines

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Ofelia  y nos cuenta un poco de su vida, ella tiene 50 años,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta unión tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella tiene  un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la ciudad de Santa Ana, en el cual prepara variedad de platos para sus clientes, ella prepara desayunos y almuerzos, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 13h00  con la ayuda de su  hija, dia a dia llegan muchos clientes hasta su pequeño local a servirse sus platos ya que la prefieren porque prepara platos saludables sin tantos condimentos. Lleva con su negocio por año y medio en su local, pero varios años  ya que entes vendía la comida en su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Ella solicita nuevamente otro crédito por que requiere de mayor capital para comprar los productos para preparar la comida ya que también su clientela ha crecido, sin la ayuda de los créditos ella no pudiera seguir con su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para crecer económicamente.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener un mejor local.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its lovely landscapes and its beautiful fresh water resorts that are frequently visited by many tourists, the members of the communal bank Nueva Luz [New Light] meet bimonthly.  

Here we talked to Señora Ofelia and she told us a little about her life.  She is 50 years old and is in a common law marriage.  She has two children from this relationship.  Her children are older and one of them lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a small food stall in the Santa Ana market where she prepares a variety of dishes for her customers.  She makes breakfast and lunch.  She works every day from 5:00 am until 1:00 pm with the help of her daughter and everyday a lot of customers come to her small establishment.  She serves them her dishes, as they prefer hers because she makes many healthy dishes without a lot of condiments.  She has been running this business for a year and a half in this location, but, for several years,  she sold food out of her house.    

With this loan she will buy ingredients for her dishes.  She is requesting a new loan because it takes a lot of capital to buy products to prepare her dishes as her clientele has grown.  Without the help of the loan, she would not be able to stay in business.  She is a founding member of her communal bank and she likes it as the loans have really helped her to grow financially.  

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have a better locale.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia Maribel de 33 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su querida madre de 61 años y sus dos hermanas las cuales ya son mayores de edad.  Sonia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Ella tiene muchas ideas de negocio las cuales poco a poco va poniendo en marcha. Sonia posee una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como: aceite, leche, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, arroz, etc. Además, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas las cuales elabora con mucho amor y dedicación para almuerzo y cena. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes fijos. Además tiene  la ventaja de ser la líder en tiendas y tortillería en la zona donde ella reside por lo que los clientes la prefieren ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Últimamente ha pensado mucho en la posibilidad de ampliar su tienda ya que su sueño es ver florecer su negocio para poder dar una mejor oportunidad de vida a su familia. Todo esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, galletas, dulces, macarrones, detergente, maíz, etc. confía en Dios que de esta manera logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel, age 33, lives in the family house.  She lives with her family group, which is comprised of her beloved 61 year old mother and her two adult sisters.  Sonia is known for being a hard-working, responsible, and enterprising woman.  She has a lot of business ideas, and she is gradually implementing them.

Sonia has a small store at her house.  She sells a variety of basic needs items like oil, milk, sugar, beans, sweets, and rice, etc.  She also makes and sells delicious tortillas.  She makes them with much love and dedication for lunch and dinner.  She has been in this business for a long time, and she therefore has a great quantity of fixed customers.  She also has the advantage of being the leader in stores and tortilla sales in the area where she lives.  The customers prefer her because they always find what they are looking for.

Lately she has been thinking a lot about the possibility of expanding her store.  Her dream is to see her business flourish in order to be able to give her family a better quality of life.  All of this has caused her to make the decision to request this loan from Integral.  The loan is to buy a variety of products for her store.  She will buy things like rice, beans, oil, cookies, sweets, macaroni, detergent, and corn, etc.  

She trusts in God that this is the way she will achieve the improvement of her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy are variety of products like rice, beans, oil, cookies, sweets, macaroni, detergent, and corn, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, and other products.

loans.name: José Lino

texts.es: José Lino de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee un negocio de reparación, compra y venta de llantas, el taller se encuentra en el lugar donde  vive y es muy conocido en la localidad pues el ofrece un excelente servicio la reparación que realiza a las llantas es muy confiable y las llantas que vende son de muy buena calidad es por eso que últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque siempre satisface sus necesidades a muy buenos precios; José Lino es un hombre activo, con entusiasmo de salir adelante, para el que trabaja con el corazón y con perseverancia alcanza sus objetivos , es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas de esta forma, José Lino tiene fe que le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Jose Lino, 46, lives with his life partner and their son.  He has a business buying, selling and repairing tires.  His workshop is in the same place where he lives.  He is well-known in the neighborhood, because he offers excellent service.  His tire repairs are very reliable, and the tires that he sells are of good quality.  Because of this, he has lately had a lot of customers because he always satisfies their needs at very good prices.  Jose Lino is an active man who has an enthusiasm to get ahead, and so by putting his heart into his work and with perseverance, he will reach his goals.  This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy tires.  In this way, Jose Lino has faith that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life, and bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Mrs. Uon lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province with her lovely husband and child. She has a pig fattening business and she also distills liquor in her home. She says that this work keeps her really busy but, luckily, her husband, a rice farmer, often helps her. Mrs. Uon typically earns an average of $4.50 US per day to meet the family's expenses. 

Mrs. Uon is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL to use as capital to keep running her liquor distilling business and to purchase piglets for raising. For the future, Mrs. Uon plans to expand her business and to gain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for raising and to keep running her liquor distilling business

loans.name: Pedro Joel

texts.es: Pedro Joel de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; el elabora en su casa cepillos artesanales para usarlos para lavar ropa en los hogares, estos son de cerdas de nylon,  ya se hizo de mucha clientela, los distribuye en el mercado, en las tiendas, clientes que le compran por docenas pues son de muy buena calidad y los vende a excelentes precios; Pedro Joel es  un hombre dedicado al trabajo siempre dispuesto a salir adelante, para él el secreto del éxito es la perseverancia y responsabilidad, una de sus metas es expandirse con su negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, madera, nylon etc. Pedro Joel tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará llevar a  su a hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Pedro Joel is 27 years old and lives together with his children.  He works at home making brushes by hand.  These brushes are used to wash clothes.  They are made from nylon bristles.  He has a lot of customers and distributes his products in the markets and in stores.  His customers buy his products by the dozen as they are very good quality and he sells them at very good prices.  

Pedro Joel is a man who is committed to his work.  He is always ready to get ahead in life.  For him, the secret to success is perseverance and responsibility.  One of his goals is to expand his business and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a larger quantity of raw materials (wood, nylon, etc.)  Pedro Joel hopes that, through his hard work, he will manage to provide his household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy wood and nylon for making brushes

loans.name: Yasmin Esmeralda

texts.es: Yasmin Esmeralda D. veintiséis años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tienda en su casa D. residencia donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad pues es el más surtido y las personas siempre encuentran todo lo que necesitan, tiene productos D. excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable recibe a los clientes con amabilidad y con una sonrisa en el rostro; Yasmin es una mujer emprendedora para ella quien lucha alcanza sus sueños ella quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, pan, verduras, condimentos, productos instantáneos, bebidas entre otros que son los mayormente demandados y por ello se le terminan y en ocasiones tiene que decir "no hay". Yasmin Esmeralda tiene la confianza que con su trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Yasmín Esmeralda, 23, lives with her life’s companion and their son.  She has a home-based store where she sells basic need items.  Her store is very well known in her locality because it’s the best stocked and people always find everything they need.  She stocks products of excellent quality at truly accessible prices.  Service is also unequaled; she welcomes her customers with kindness and a smile on her face.

Yasmín is an enterprising woman who strives to reach her dreams.  She wants to see her business grow and this is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy snacks, bread, vegetables, condiments, instant products and soft-drinks, among other which are in highest demand and which, because of that sometimes run out, and she has to say “there is none.”  Yasmín Esmeralda is confident that she’ll be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life through her work.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 47 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida José. Margarita ha logrado establecer una tortillería en su hogar de residencia la cual día a día atiende con mucho amor y dedicación. Para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con las ricas e higiénicas tortillas que ella prepara para la hora del almuerzo y cena. Posee mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio de tal manera que sus ingresos se vean aumentados y logre mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos necesarios tales como: maíz, gas propano, cal, agua, etc. Para suplir la demanda que sus clientes hacen y consecuentemente su nivel de ingresos mejoren y calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Margarita, 47, lives in her own house with her life’s companion, José.  Margarita has managed to establish a tortilla shop at home that she tends to lovingly and with much dedication every day.  For her, the most important thing is that her customers are satisfied with the delicious and hygienic tortillas she makes for lunch and dinner.  She has a large clientele because she’s noted for being an honest, responsible woman who is dedicated to her work.  Her dream is to see her business flourish in such a way that her income increases and she attains a better quality of life for her family. For this reason she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy larger amounts of the ingredients, like corn, propane, lime powder, water, etc. needed to meet customer demand and consequently increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane, lime powder, water, etc.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia, 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Amelia has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for one year. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase different stock to sell in her store.

Amelia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from selling food and charcoal. Amelia hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita  de 62 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su hija de 26 años la cual es empleada y ayuda un poco con los gastos del hogar. Ana se dedica a la confección y venta de diversos estilos de prendas de vestir. Ella es una mujer ejemplar ya que a pesar de su avanzada edad  no se cansa de trabajar y sigue luchando por mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia. Ha trabajado toda su vida en esta actividad y gracias a Dios y a su trabajo esto es lo que le ha permitido salir adelante y dar a su hija lo necesario. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que si de confección de ropa se trata ella es la mejor en la zona. Además ofrece variedad de estilos a los mejores precios. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer amable y sobre todo dedicada en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, etc.) para elaborar diferentes prendas de vestir que ayuden a atraer a más clientes que  le permitan mejorar su nivel de ingresos así como su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita, 62, lives in her own house with her 26-year-old daughter who is employed and helps a little with household expenses.  Ana is a seamstress and sells articles of clothing in various styles.  

She’s an exemplary woman who despite her advanced age does not tire of working and continues to strive to improve her and her family’s economic situation.  She’s worked her entire life in this occupation and, thanks to God and her work, it’s allowed her to get ahead and provide her daughter with what’s been necessary.  

Many people prefer her because she’s the best clothes maker in the zone.  In addition, she sells a variety of styles at the best prices.  She has quite a few customers because she’s noted for being a kind woman who is, above all, devoted to her work. 

She’s made the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her small business.  She will buy needed raw materials (fabric, thread, needles, elastic, etc.) to make a variety of articles of clothing that will help her attract more customers that will lead to increased income and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en: Charisma is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Charisma has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Charisma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina, 53 years old, is married and has 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Carina has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 20 years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Carina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from food vending. Carina hopes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas aims to have a better quality of life someday. To make a living, her spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. They earn a daily income of 200 pesos. According to Felicitas, it is just enough to cover their expenses for meals and allowances of her two children attending school.

The couple had insufficient funds to pay for franchise renewal and paint for the motorcycle; that is why Felicitas is asking for a loan of 12,000 pesos. She wants her spouse to be able to continue providing the services.

In the future, she wants to keep earning a good income to save for the college education of her children. She wants them to earn a degree to seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and paint for the motorcycle

loans.name: Ena Del Carmen

texts.es: Ena del Carmen reside en casa propia junto a su hija  la cual ya está casada y tiene a su esposo viviendo junto a ella en la misma casa. Ena se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas tortillas. Es una mujer responsable y trabajadora la cual ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado establecer mucha clientela y cada vez los clientes la prefieren más ya que es una mujer luchadora, honesta y sobre todo amable. Para Ena lo mas importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con las ricas tortillas que higiénicamente ella prepara y es por esta razón que cada día se levanta desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para tener listas las ricas tortillas que ofrece a sus clientes. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito ya que su sueño es ver florecer su negocio para lograr mejores niveles de venta y por consecuencia de ingresos que ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (maíz, gas propano, agua, cal; etc.) para elaborar  las ricas tortillas que día con día ofrece a sus clientes. Tiene mucha fe que de esta forma logrará su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ena del Carmen lives in her own house with her daughter who is already married and has her husband living with her in the same house.  Ena makes delicious tortillas to sell.  She’s a responsible, hardworking woman who has had to work her entire life to support her family.  Thanks to her charisma she’s managed to establish a large clientele and every day her customers prefer her more since she’s a tenacious, honest and, above all, kind woman.
For Ena, the most important thing is that her customers are satisfied with her delicious tortillas that she hygienically makes and this is why she rises very early every day to have her delicious tortillas ready to offer her customers.  

She’s decided to ask for this loan because her dream is to see her business flourish to reach better sales levels and consequently higher income that will help her improve her and her family’s quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of raw materials (corn, propane gas, water, lime powder, etc.) needed to make the delicious tortillas that she sells daily to her customers.  She has faith that she will reach her goal of improving her and her family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane gas, water, lime powder, etc.

loans.name: Jenerose

texts.en:
Jenerose is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Algie

texts.en: Algie is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 1 year. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline. Algie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Algie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ruby has a retail shop that sells GT Cosmetic Products that include clothing & cosmetics. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of GT Cosmetic products.
Ruby is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of GT Cosmetics (brand name) to sell

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Romeo has a shop that buys & sells detergent, soap & beauty products. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell.
Romeo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Gemma has a retail shop that sells detergent, soap & cosmetics from PERSONAL CARE & other brands. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell. Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and married to a tricycle driver. The couple was blessed with three children, all attending school. Despite poverty, Rosemarie and her husband still find ways to improve their lives. Rosemarie's spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. He has been operating the motorcycle for almost five years and earns a daily income of PHP 300. The profits earned provide for daily meals and allowances.

Rosemarie would like to improve the services rendered by her husband. Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy side mirrors, paint and a new pair of tires for the motorcycle. These accessories would help ensure the passengers' safety and help Rosemarie and her husband earn a good income. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to continuously provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors, paint and a new pair of tires

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Liezel provides multipurpose van services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. Liezel has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline to maintain the van. Liezel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline to maintain the van

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Rose has operated a retail shop for 6 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ochirsukh

texts.en: Ochirsukh is requesting another loan in order to rent an Internet cafe room to expand his business. He needs the loan to pay the two-month rental fee in advance. Ochirsukh is a very business-minded person who uses every opportunity to earn. He believes that this new business field will increase his earning progressively.
