Ochirsukh plans to build his own house and marry his girlfriend in the near future.

loans.use: To rent an Internet cafe room in order to expand his business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Fatima provides habal-habal (motorcycle) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 2 years. Fatima has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and gasoline for motorcycle maintenance. Fatima is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Cleofa

texts.en: Cleofa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.  Cleofa has operated a retail shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cleofa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cleofa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Halema

texts.en: Halema is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Halema has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling clothing, shoes and beauty products from NATASHA and GTY. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock from NATASHA and GTY. Halema is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Halema hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & GTY

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 43 years old, is married and has two children. She has operated a store for almost 5 years, selling chemicals and fertilizers to farmers to treat pests and insects. Since the primary source of income in her neighborhood comes from rice and corn farming, she established a store selling chemicals and fertilizers. 

Mildred wants to increase her sales but has insufficient funds. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, seeds and fertilizers to sell in her store. Mildred aims for a progressive life for her family. She keeps making better sales and increasing her earnings to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Sarah has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Sarah is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Evonnie

texts.en: Evonnie is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Evonnie has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling clothing and beauty products from AVON and NATASHA. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON and NATASHA. Evonnie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evonnie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON and NATASHA

loans.name: Mandakhbayar

texts.en:
Mandakhbayar is a 35-year-old father of two children. He has been employed as a driver for a taxi service company since 2003. He owns his car and continues the taxi business. His family lives in a rented apartment.

Mandakhbayar’s wife sells shoes which are purchased from Erlian, a border town in China. She rents a stall at an outside market and the rent costs much of her profit. Therefore, Mandakhbayar and his wife plan to rent another stall beside the current one in order to expand the business. This will support him in increasing his family's income and further improving their lives. Mandakhbayar is requesting a loan to cover the rental fee of another stall for his wife's new business.

loans.use: to cover the rental fee of another stall for his wife's new business

loans.name: Braulita

texts.en: Braulita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Braulita has operated a tailoring shop for 10 years, making and repairing dresses and uniforms. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials for tailoring, such as cloth and scissors. Braulita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Braulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Harold has operated a shop for 5 years, selling clothing such as t-shirts, blouses and baby clothing. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy clothing and underwear stock to sell. Harold is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Harold hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear stock

loans.name: Analin

texts.en: Analin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Analin has operated a retail shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and coconut wine per liter. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and coconut wine to sell. Analin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and coconut wine

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is a 41-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 18, 17 and 15. She sells dried fish for a living, earning about 4,000 PHP per month. Concordia also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at her town's market.

Concordia has requested a loan to buy pig feed and more fish to sell. She hopes for her ventures to prosper. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more fish to sell

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaiwan is 25 years old, married, and has two young daughters. They live in a Mongolian ger, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. He has started his wheel-service business a year ago and it has been running quite successfully since then. He said there is no other similar service nearby and that is advantageous for his business. He wants to expand his business, as every businessman dreams.
 
Now he is requesting a loan to open a new wheel service and hire a worker there. He expects it will be successful and that he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To open a new wheel service and hire a worker for expanding his business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Fe has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines and milkfish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and has been widowed for almost 14 years. To support her children's education, she improved her house and has been offering rooms for rent, especially to students, for almost eight years. 

Virginia wants to construct new rooms and further expand her business to generate more income. Since she has insufficient funds, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy construction materials such as gravel, sand and cement to improve her business. She also wants to help students with the affordable rentals she offers. In the future, Virginia wants to increase her earnings and keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her rooms for rent

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina owns a variety store within the village of Villa Cruz San Mateo. She has had this kind of business for five years. According to her, she would like to improve her business through buying a greater stock of groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and instant noodles to sell. Marcelina could not buy her stock groceries due to increase of household expenses, most especially the allowances of her student children and their school fees. 

With the situation they are experiencing nowadays, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P25,000. She hopes that she can make her retail shop grow so that she can support her two children in finishing their studies, and improve the standard of their living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits,canned goods and instant noodles to sell in her shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Elena has a food shop that sells snacks like coconut or buko juice. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts for making buko juice. Elena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for making coconut or buko juice

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is a 59-year-old single woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has been raising pigs for 2 years. Diega built her own backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. She sells her pigs at her town's market and earns about 7,000 PHP per month. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice crops.

Diega has requested this loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and materials for the piggery. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and materials for the piggery.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Leonida has a retail shop that sells vegetables, food seasonings and spices like onions and garlic. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables, food seasonings and spices for resale. Leonida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, food seasonings and spices for resale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur. She enjoys her daily activities in acquiring profits in her sari-sari (variety) store. She is selling soap, shampoo, biscuits, canned goods and beverages to the people in her village. Her store is located near the school; that is why she needs to buy more items to sell that would increase her earnings. She had insufficient funding so she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

Marissa is now 40 years old, married and has one infant age child. Someday, she wants to establish a bigger store to conveniently stock her groceries, acquire good sales and save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Baatar is again requesting a loan to purchase some building materials, especially for a wooden floor and a roof with iron sheets, to make additional adjustments to his house. It is important to finish the house before this winter.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to make additional adjustments to his house.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Pacita has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of used clothing. Pacita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 33-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Jocelyn sells mobile phone credit loads to the people in her community. She started this business 2 years ago. Jocelyn also raises pigs and grows rice on her land. She does her best to support her family.

Jocelyn plans to use this loan to buy pig feeds, fertilizers and more mobile phone credit loads to sell. She hopes for her loading business to grow.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds, fertilizers and more mobile phone credit loads to sell.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 55 years old and a married woman who has four grown up children. She has operated the school canteen for eight years. She is thankful because her profit increases. Every day she is able to earn about P1,000. With the profit she generates from her business, she is able to improve and buy additional products needed by the children within the school.

Her husband is a private driver. The couple support one another to sustain their needs. Aside from her retailing business, Prescila has also been engaged in a hog raising business. She enjoys her daily routine because this is the main source of income for the family. 

Prescila would like to maintain the school canteen she manages to improve their living conditions. With the profit she generates from her retail shop and the help of her husband, they are able to put up another variety store within their community. 

She would like to continually improve the school canteen she operates through borrowing additional capital in the amount of P30,000. This amount will be used to purchase groceries and school supplies such as paper, bond paper and ballpoint pens for her retail business. She believes that she could make her retail store more profitable through her hard work and patience in dealing with her customers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies, such as paper, bond paper and ballpoint pens for her retail business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonilla is married to a tricycle driver. They live in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. The couple have been blessed with six children. 

For the past five years, Leonilla has operated a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport. Every day her husband wakes up early to transport the passengers going to and from the market. 

Leonilla faces a major challenge, which is renewing her franchise of motorcycle transport. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for additional capital from the lenders amounting to P30,000. This will help her business grow because her operation will not stop just because she doesn't renew her franchise. 

She also feels that she could make her motorcycle more comfortable to the passengers so that they could always rent it when they travel to nearby areas of the community where they live.

loans.use: to be used in renewing the franchise of motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 44 years old and married to a carpenter. They have four children. Florenda has been engaged in a furniture shop business, and she has been running this kind of business for seven years. 

Aside from the manufacturing business, she is also vending street foods and halo-halo (an iced dessert). She is glad because little by little her business grows through offering quality products to her customers. She would like to continually improve their finished products, such as cabinets, beds, tables and chairs, so that more customers will patronize the business. 

Her business improved during her fourth cycle loan, so she is asking for a bigger capital amount of P25,000 for her fifth cycle to buy raw woods and varnish to improve the furniture they make. 

Florenda believes that she could be a better entrepreneur someday if she could improve and make other designs of carvings for her finished products.

loans.use: to buy raw woods and varnish needed in her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish. She has had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. Gina has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad runs her general store within the local community of Dumabato Sur, Maddela Quirino. She has been running this kind of business for two years. She is 57 years of age and has been blessed with five children. 

Felicidad would like to maintain her general store in order to provide the needs of her family. She works very hard to sustain their daily needs. According to her, sometimes or most of the times she suffers from difficulties in managing her store due to some neighborhoods' bad credit. 

This challenge is the reason why she is in need of additional capital in the amount of P15,000. She hopes that she can obtain this loan amount so that she could purchase stock groceries such as soft drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her general store. Through this loan amount, she could increase her income, save some for the future of her children and for emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries such as soft drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuit  for her general store

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of t-shirts and blouses for resale. Guadalupe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of t-shirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy fish to sell. Vicenta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Lourdes has a retail shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stock from Avon and Natasha for resale.
Lourdes has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Avon and Natasha for resale.

loans.name: Heronisa

texts.en:
Heronisa is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 
Heronisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Heronisa is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dianalan

texts.en:
Dianalan is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Dianalan has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has run this business for six years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Dianalan is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Erdene-Ochir, 40, runs a taxi and freight transport business. He lives with his two daughters and his recently married wife. 
Initially, in 2009, Erdene-Ochir bought a mini truck for freight transportation. Later he bought a light car with his accumulated earnings and set up a business-taxi service in 2010. His businesses have been running well. Previous to this work, Erdene-Ochir used to work as a driver in a public organization. 
Erdene-Ochir has an adult-aged son from his previous marriage. He wants to support his son to purchase his own house and land in a rural area. He thinks that this is his fatherly responsibility and charge. Erdene-Ochir wants to buy the property now before the price rises. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the payment for the house and land for his son. He has taken several loans in the past and repaid them all successfully and on time.

loans.use: to cover the payment of house and land for his son.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Malo has been in this business for 8 years now, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Malo has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, Malo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has purified drinking water business in the Philippines. Lolita  has been in this business for 3 years.

Lolita has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more containers for her purified drinking water business. In the future, Lolita  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more containers for her purified drinking water business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children.  Alma has a food shop where she sells snacks, like rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her 3 children. Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. Gloria has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lyra Joy

texts.en:
Lyra Joy is 21 years old and she sells household goods and manages her homed-based store. She has been in business for two years and says that her business is doing well. She is thankful to God, because her previous loan helped her to increase her business and restock with a little more merchandise. She is now on her fifth loan cycle, and she is asking for additional capital of PHP20,000 to be used in buying groceries and dry goods such as kitchen utensils, hangers, bags and different kinds of blankets. She is hoping that she can obtain the loan amount she requested, so that she can provide for the needs of her family and satisfy the demands of her customers.   

In the future, Lyra Joy is expecting more development of her retail business and continued financial support of all the lenders, for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock and dry goods such as kitchen utensils, hangers, bags and different kinds of blankets for her retail business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and is married with 5 children. With 2 children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a Sari-sari Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. Grace has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Grace would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. Erlinda has been in this business for 38 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a fruits vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall. Elizabeth has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and two of her children are in school.

Janeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janeth has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Janeth has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines. Analie has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from her general store. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rug making business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rug making business.

loans.name: Joylinda

texts.en:
Joylinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Joylinda has a retail shop, selling canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Joylinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joylinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 60 years old and married. She has four children. Rosalina earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000, through NWTF, to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising other livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and widowed. With 3 children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Maribel has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

In the future Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy materials for her fishing business.
Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Remedios has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and coconut wines. She has run this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Remedios has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Gloria has a shop that sells coconuts and green bananas. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.
Gloria has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: C 1921 Iriba Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 29 years old and married. She has one child who is 1 year old and she takes care of two people. She is a leader of this group, which is called “Iriba” in local language. This means "River" in English. She is the third person from the left side. 

Beatha sells cassava flour. She currently employs two people to help her and she has been working for four years. 

Beatha and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase a large quantity of cassava flour to sell. With any profits from the loan, Beatha and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of cassava flour to resell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is engaged in a general store business. She is widowed and has been blessed with four children. For her, the best way to reach her personal goals is through dedication to her work without forgetting about being happy all the time. 

Florencia wants to see her business grow though her age is 61. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 that will make it possible for her to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, assorted biscuits and vegetables to stock her store. She hopes that her work will provide her with the opportunity to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, biscuits and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Analie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married. She has two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs and ducks.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 29 years old and married. She has one child.

Alona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Alona has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and electronic re-loads for phones.

Alona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
Dely is 51 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Dely runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more stock to sell in her general store.
Dely has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Dely aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: C 1906 Abahurijehamwe Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 32 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. He is the leader of the group called "ABAHURIJEHAMWE" in the local language. Ferdinand is the first person on the right side, wearing a blue jacket. He is known for doing carpentry and he has been in this business for about four years and his business hours are from 7am until 8pm every day. 

Ferdinand has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his carpentry business by buying more wood to create more activities like: to fabricate chairs, windows, wardrobe etc to sell. With this loan, Ferdinand will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family lifestyle.

loans.use: To expand his carpentry business by buying more wood to fabricate chairs, windows etc to sell

loans.name: Diolita

texts.en:
Diolita is 41 years old and married with eleven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Diolita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional cases of soft drinks and gallons of coconut wine.
Diolita has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying rice.
Diolita aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft drinks and gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Joycy

texts.en:
Joycy is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has one child. 

Joycy has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from MSE and NATASHA. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy merchandise from MSE and NATASHA to resell.

Joycy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Joycy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from MSE and NATASHA to resell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more stock for her business.

Editha has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns income from food vending and selling plastic ware.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.
 
Melchor has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants, ampalaya, red bell pepper, and squash. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Melchor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melchor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 52 years old and married. She has eight children.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Erenia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Erenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en:
Janalyn is 39 years old and married. She has three children.

Janalyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells brooms in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Janalyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling brooms for six years and also earns an income from dealing in rice and corn.

Janalyn aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 31 years old and married. She has three children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and networking beauty products.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Marina has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for sale.

Marina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 42 years old and married. She has eight children.

Joselyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells brooms and bags in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Joselyn has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the brooms and bags business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Joselyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: 02.06.06 Đông Sơn Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Quỳnh is 58 years old. She is married and has two children.

Quỳnh is the group leader of the 06 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Quỳnh supports one dependent with her business in Thanh Hoá city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Quỳnh has a retail business selling clothes. Quỳnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

This is Quỳnh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Quỳnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for 25 years.

Fe requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Emma has a food shop or carenderia that sells pork and chicken adobo, pancit bihon and bulalo. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands. Emma is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 21 years now, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.

Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall. Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old, married and has 12 children, 5 of whom are in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Pacita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lhe

texts.en:
Lhe is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Lhe has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lhe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lhe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
S. Madu Group has 15 members. The group is composed of women in the village who have the same business: raising pigs. They pursue this effort to support the family economy. The group members are located in a rural area so that their main job is as farmers, but with assistance from MUK, they want to pursue this business more seriously.

Ni Ketut, head of the group, is married and has two children who are married. Her husband worked as a builder. Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy two piglets and the rest to buy food. With this venture, she dreams of using the profits to fix her kitchen.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Sheila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned good, snacks and beverages.

Sheila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sheila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 51 years old and married with 7 children.

Lani works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lani has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lani aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Concejo

texts.en:
Concejo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Concejo has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Concejo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Concejo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.en:
Luz Mary is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

Luz Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Luz Mary has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Luz Mary aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Wenalyn

texts.en: For the past five years Wenalyn, a 37-year-old married mother of two living in the Philippines, has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Wenalyn has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 22 years old and single, lives in the Philippines where he has operated a shop selling green and yellow bananas for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, Emmanuel has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas to sell, and in the future hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy green & yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri, who is 37, lives in the village of Giorgitsminda, Southern Georgia with his wife Jana. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with one cow whose milk is used to make cheese which is sold in nearby Akhaltsikhe. They also grow potatoes, beans and maize on a family-owned plot of the land. Harvested vegetables are also sold at the Akhaltsikhe market. The family's total average monthly income is 250 Laris (approximately 150 USD).

Now requesting a loan to purchase three or four calves, Badri will raise and then sell them in early spring for a profit. This will increase the family's income, enabling them to save some money for house renovations in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells napkins, detergents, soaps, and shampoo. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will  use to buy detergents, napkins, and soaps to sell.

Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, napkins, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil lives in Vale, in the southern part of the mountainous region of Georgia. He is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Elmira, and 3 daughters (17, 12 and 11 years old).  All three children go to school.  Elmira is a housewife and also she helps her husband in the family agricultural business. Avtandil and Elmira have 1.5 hectares of land. They grow potatoes and sell  5 tons of potatoes per year on average to the greengrocery retailers. Along with potato growing, Avtandil is busy in his own workshop. He is a joiner and makes various types of furniture: furniture for bedrooms, kitchen and dining rooms. He sells the furniture in nearby towns. Total average monthly income for this 5 person family is 500 Laris (approximately 300 USD). 

Avtandil requested credit for purchasing a new, modern joiner’s bench. It will allow Avtandil to improve the quality of the produced furniture, as well as to increase the volume of production. As Avtandil sells more and better quality products, his income will increase.  Avtandil and Elvira plan to use it for purchasing new goods for the children and household in order to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a joiner's bench

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Bredza in the eastern part of the country. She is 56 years old and married.  She lives with her husband, Akaki, her 31 year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her 3 year-old granddaughter. 

Natalia’s son has seasonal work. He is employed as a construction worker and is busy seasonally, mainly in the spring and summer seasons. Natalia and her husband are leading the agricultural business of the family, which is an important source of income for the family. Natalia and Akaki grow beans, wheat and tulips on family-owned 2 hectares of land. Natalia sells harvested vegetables and flowers in Khashuri (nearby town).  Total average income of the family is 800 Laris per month. 

Natalia requested credit for cultivation of the land and to purchase wheat for sowing. After proper cultivation and purchasing high quality seeds, Natalia will get a good harvest next spring and sell it for a fair price. The family will get the planned amount of income, which will be used for financing family daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase wheat for sowing

loans.name: Sheiryl

texts.en:
Sheiryl is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single.  Sheiryl has a retail shop that sells electronic loads of several networks like SMART, GLOBE & SUN CELLULAR.  She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads to sell.  Sheiryl is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sheiryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher is from the village of Giorgitsminda, Akhaltsikhe district. Jimsher’s village is located in Southern part of Georgia. The main business of the local population there is potato growing and dairy production. 

Jimsher is 50 years old.  He is married and lives in the village with his wife, Mtvarisa.  The only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and produce cheese, which is sold in the village. Also Jimsher and Mtvarisa grow potatoes, beans and maize on a family-owned plot of land. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold locally as well. Total average monthly income for the family is 350 Laris (approximately 210 USD). 

Jimsher requested credit for two purposes. He will purchase 2 or 3 calves and raise them. In spring, Jimsher will sell grown calves for a higher price and get profit. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for some renovation work on the house. 

After using the credit according to the predetermined purposes, the income of the family will increase and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and renovate small part of the house

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children.  Lilibeth has a retail shop that sells used clothing, or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of used clothing, or ukay-ukay, to sell.  Lilibeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing ,or ukay-ukay, to sell

loans.name: Cristomie

texts.en:
Cristomie is 43 years of age, married and has two children who attend school.  It is a big responsibility to be the head of the family.  Cristomie always tries to give the best quality of life to his family.  Cristomie's main source of income is farming.  He also engages in a hog raising business as an additional source of income of the family to further sustain his family needs.

Cristomie is asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy piglets to raise and to buy feed for the hogs.  He will manage his business well for a continuous source of income for the family and to be able allow his children to finish their education through income generated from the business.  Cristomie wishes to see his children wearing a cap and gown for graduation and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and to buy feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano is 50 years old, married, and has three children. He and his wife are involved in farming activities in their village. Floriano manages an agricultural business, which includes planting corn and raising hogs. He has managed his corn field for 20 years while operating his hog raising business only when he has enough capital. 

Floriano is requesting a loan for 26,000 PHP, which he will use to buy piglest to raise.  He wants to continue to operate his hog raising business for an alternative source of income for the family and hopes it becomes one of his stable sources of income aside from farming.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Julan

texts.en:
Julan is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Julan has a shop that sells fruits such as mangoes and apples. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fruits to sell.

Julan is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and describes herself as aggressive, humble, and trustworthy. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells sweaters. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an open air market in Nairobi and her primary customers are retailers from different parts of the town. 

Josephine's biggest business challenge is her low purchasing power. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to add to her stock of sweaters . Her business goal is to open another shop in the city center within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old.  She lives in the village of Tsakhani, Adigeni District.  Marina is married.  She lives with her husband Shota, her 22-year-old son, 18-year-old daughter and 72-year-old mother-in-law. 

Marina and Shota lead the agricultural business of the family.  They have a dairy farm and sell cheese in a local market.  Along with the dairy, they grow various types of vegetables and corn on the family's own land and sell other harvested products locally. 

Marina requested credit for paying the study fee for her daughter, a student at high school.  After paying the study fee, Marina’s daughter will continue to study at the high school.  She studies well and tries her best to get good education in order to ensure a sustainable future for herself.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's high-school study fee.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old and married, with 2 children.  Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice and food vending.  Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is 33 years old and married, with 2 children. With one child in school, Rapuncel works very hard to provide for them.  Rapuncel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rapuncel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, oil, spices, bread, etc.  In the future, Rapuncel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 56 years old and married, with 7 children.  Rosana works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Rosana has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  Rosana aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with 3 children. Josie has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.  Josie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is from the village Varkhani. She is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband, Merab, two sons (27 and 26 years old) and a daughter-in-law. 

The family is busy with an agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm. Milk is used for cheese production, which is sold locally. Along with the dairy, Nunu trades second-hand clothes. She purchases clothes at a wholesale price and then sells them in her shop and nearby villages at a retail price. 

Nunu requested credit for purchasing seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of the clothes to the customers and increase her sales, and, consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and married with five children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tobacco business for eight years, and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Veronica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Guy Herman

texts.fr:
Client de 43 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre  18 mois et 17 ans. A l’arrêt de ses études universitaires , il commence avec la vente de la friperie il y a de cela 17 ans.

Il est client a Hope depuis bientôt 3 cycles, il a rembourse avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables, pour son quatrieme cycle, il veut toujours dans le même sens,acheter des ballots de fin de séries, tel que pantalons, polos, T shirts, qu'il nettoie et fait repasser au pressing pour vendre a ses clients.   

Ses ventes vont de 30000 fr a 95000 fr par jour, très enthousiaste , il promet aller loin avec Hope Congo, parce qu’il a pour projet d'ouvrir une boutique des habits prêts a porter.

Comme bon père de famille, il s'occupe bien de ses enfants, et est entrain de d'investir pour construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Guy Herman is 43 years old and the father of 3 children aged between 18 months and 17 years. He started selling second hand clothing 17 years ago, after university. He is completing his third loan cycle with HOPE and has so far repaid his loans successfully and managed to build up considerable savings. He is requesting a fourth loan so that he can, once again, buy some bales of end of season clothing including trousers, polo shirts and t-shirts, which he will spruce up and take to the dry cleaners before reselling to his customers. He generally earns between 30 000 and 95 000 francs a day.

An enthusiastic businessman, Guy Herman intends to enjoy a long collaboration with HOPE Congo as he would one day like to open his own shop selling ready-to-wear clothing. An attentive father, he takes good care of his children and is currently investing in building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy some bales of end of season clothing including trousers, t-shirts and polo shirts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 47 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming vegetables for 18 years and earns additional income from pig fattening and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Adeline Michelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, mariée avec 2 enfants a sa charge, elle se lance dans le commerce de la friperie en 2007 a l'arrêt de ses etudes pour subvenir a ses besoins.
Elle achète des ballots de friperie de sacs et des chaussures  pour enfants en cuir qu'elle fait nettoyer et vend en détail au marche.
Elle a déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts, et ces prêts lui ont permit d'accroitre son commerce, ses ventes ont largement augmentes, elle a en moyenne 25.000 a 75.000 fr par jour, surtout qu'a la période de la rentrée scolaire les chaussures et sacs sont bien achetés par les parents d'élèves.

Elle a plusieurs stratégies pour faire face a la concurrence ; elle choisit les meilleurs produits ,elle a des prix abordables pour attirer sa clientèle.

Dans l'avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour vendre les articles en cuir .
texts.en:
This client is 31 years old, married, and has two children in her care.  She started selling second-hand goods in 2007 when she stopped her studies in order to support herself.

The borrower buys bundles of second-hand bags and leather children's shoes which she cleans up and sells retail in the market.  She has already been through several loan cycles and the loans have enabled her to grow her business.  Her sales have greatly increased and she makes, on average, 25,000 to 75,000 francs a day, especially during the back-to-school season when she sells a lot of shoes and bags to parents of school children.

The borrower has several strategies for dealing with the competition: she chooses the best products and she charges reasonable prices in order to attract customers.  In the future, she would like to open a store in which to sell leather goods.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand bags and shoes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks.  She has had this business for nine years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie 8 et 24 ans, coiffeuse depuis bientôt 20 ans, elle se débrouillait tant bien que mal, et quand elle reçoit le premier de Hope, son activité prend de la vitesse, elle a rembourse ses prêts avec succès et a des épargnes considérables. 
Ses revenus sont de 40000 fr a 130000 fr par jour, elle a également des filles mères qui apprennent  le métier de la coiffure auprès d'elle.
Avec ce quatrième prêt , elle va acheter des produits comme 10 kg de démêlants, 10 kg de defrisants, des lots de pinces, lots des peignes tiges, des mèches et tissages.
Elle  a aussi acheter une tonne de ciment, et 10 tôles d'aluminium  pour avancer la construction de son salon de coiffure.
Tres enthousiaste , elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout pour qu'elle puisse se faire un nom dans le monde de la coiffure.
texts.en:
Pierette, age 44, is married and the mother of three children, age 8 to 24. For nearly 20 years, she's been a hairdresser. She managed to run her business as best one can and, when she received her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hope, her business soared.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and was able to put quite a large amount of money away. Her daily revenue amounts to XOF 40'000 to 130'000 (ca US$ 60 to 200). She also trains several girl mothers who learn hairdressing with her.

With her fourth loan, she will buy 10 kg of detangling product, 10 kg of hair straightening product, bundles of hair grips, tail combs, hair extensions, and weaves.

She also bought one ton of cement and ten aluminum sheets to progress with building her hair salon. Very enthusiastic, she has at heart to follow through in order to make a name for herself in the hairdressing world.

loans.use: to buy detangling product, hair straightening product, hair grips, tail combs, hair extensions, and weaves.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Evelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.   In the future, she would like to save money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: buy materials to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a variety store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Lilian requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy different products to sell in her variety store.   In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Chanda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Chanda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer comes from the village Arali in South Georgia. He is 61 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Lali, two sons (22 and 20 years old) and his 90-year-old father. Vladimer is the lead in the agricultural business for his family. They have a milk cow and sell cheese they produce, which is sold locally.  Vladimer also grows cabbages and potatoes on family-owned land and sells the harvested products locally as well. Lali works in the local branch of an international charity organization and gets a monthly salary in the amount of 150 Laris per month. 

Vladimer requested credit to pay for school tuition for his children, who are students at a high school.  His elder son studies law and the younger one studies economics. They are studying hard in order to get good education and become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: pay school tuition for his children

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has 2 children. She is 41 years old and one of her children is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 1 year.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Theresia Mukayili

texts.en:
Theresia is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself as patient. 

She operates a cereals sales business where she sells beans, rice, millet, groundnuts and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a shopping centre in Kakamega and her primary customers are the local people and students at a nearby university. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add to her stock of cereals. 

Her business goal is to grow it to wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will give good education to her children.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and repair her fishing boat.

Marites has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 40 years old, 2 children who are in school and other two are working to help the family.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment.

Marites has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold is 37 years old and has five children. Mary Gold is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Gold is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Gold requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her business.

Mary Gold has been farming vegetables for 18 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Gold would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a farmer, planting corn in the Philippines. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with four children. Among his children, only his youngest child went to college and is about to finish. His other three children are already working and help him financially to sustain their family necessities and his child's school fees.

Ricardo wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy piglets and hog feed. He plans to develop his business, earn a higher income and save some of it for the future emergencies of the family, especially since he and his wife are getting older.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Rosalina has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Rosalie Alias

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec un enfant de 20 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce en 2000. 
Aux trois cycles passes, il a eu une forte capacité de remboursement et a fait des épargnes énormes .
Cliente de Hope, elle est aujourd'hui a son quatrième,et avec ce prêt elle a acheté des cartons de jus de fruits importes, des packs d'eau , de la boisson minérale,de la boisson gazeuse et un congélateur pour conserver ses boissons.
Ses ventes sont de 40.000 fr a 140.000 fr par jour et avec ses bénéfice, elle prend soin de son enfant et assure la scolarité de son enfant. 
Pour l'avenir , elle veut être une grande femme d'affaire, très fière d'elle, elle tient a s'affirmer dans le monde des affaires
texts.en:
Rosalie Alias, age 48, is single with a 20-year-old child. She started her business in 2000. She had no problem repaying her previous three loans, and was able to put away a large amount of money.

She's now seeking her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, Hope, in order to buy boxes of imported fruit juice, bags of water, mineral water, sparkling drinks, and a freezer to store them.

Her daily sales amount to XOF 40'000 to 140'000 (ca US$ 80 to 280). With her profits, she intends to take care of her child and pay his school expenses.

In the future, she wants to be a big businesswoman. Proud of herself, she has at heart to make a name for herself in the business world.

loans.use: to buy boxes of imported fruit juice, bags of water, mineral water, sparkling drinks, and a freezer

loans.name: Mavjuda's Group

texts.en:
Mavjuda is the leader of this group. She is 37 and brings up a son and a daughter; both children study at school. Her husband works in Russia; each month he transfers 5000 soms to meet the family's needs. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, Mavjuda started to sell materials. At the moment her business runs well. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fabrics and materials to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future she wishes to expand her business and then save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from the village Shalauri. He is 60 years old and lives with his family: his wife Zhenya and 23-year-old son. Givi and his son work as worker-constructors in the village. This job is seasonal and they are mainly busy during summer and fall months. Along with their main job, Givi and Zhenya lead the family-owned small dairy farm. They have a milk cow and produce yogurt, which is sold in Telavi (a nearby town). The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris (approximately USD 425). 

Givi requested a loan to purchase one additional milk cow. Zhenya will double the amount of produced yogurt as well as income from the sales. Givi and Zhenya plan to make some savings, in order to expand the cattle-shed, as they plan to get more milk cows in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 48 years old and married. She has 5 children. Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling slippers. Carmelita aspires to save enough to repair a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Merline Nadège

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 36 ans, célibataire avec une fille de 13 ans,a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de première  en 2004, elle se lance dans la vente de poisson sale. 
Ayant déjà bénéficie de 3 cycles de prêts auprès de Hope ,elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables, ses revenus ont largement augmentes, elle a en moyenne 40000 fr a 80000 fr par jour.

Pour ce quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer son stock en achetant des cartons de poissons sales, comme 10 cartons de Krovin,10 cartons de morues, 10 cartons de requins, 10 cartons de soles....Elle a commence a vendre le poisson en détails, en gros ,et demi gros.

Tres entreprenante, elle est très engagée dans le commerce, parce qu’elle tient a aller loin dans son commerce, avec les bénéfices , elle a achète  un terrain, ou elle est entrain de construire un dépôt pour qu'a la longue elle puisse faire la vente en gros du poisson sale. Tres bonne gestionnaire, elle s'occupe de la scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en:
Merline Nadège is 36 years old, single and has a daughter aged 13. She left school during her sixth year of high school and started selling salted fish in 2004. She has already completed 3 loan cycles with HOPE and has repaid her previous loans successfully. She has also seen a solid increase in revenue to, on average, between 40 000 and 80 000 francs a day, and has managed to build up considerable savings.

Merline Nadège is requesting a fourth loan so that she can restock on salted fish, including 10 cartons of Krovin fish, 10 cartons of cod, 10 cartons of shark and 10 cartons of sole. As well as selling fish to individual customers, she is also starting to sell fish semi-wholesale and wholesale. 

A very enterprising woman, Merline Nadège is fully engaged in her retail business and has big ambitions for it. She has already used some of her profits to buy some land on which she is now constructing a warehouse so that, eventually, she is able to build a wholesale business selling salted fish. A responsible and organised mother, she is making sure her daughter gets a good education.

loans.use: to buy cartons of salted fish wholesale.

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans,celibataire avec 6 enfants ,  ayant déjà bénéficié de 3 cycles de prêts a Hope, elle a rembourse avec succès et a des épargnes considérables, ses ventes ont largement augmentes de 25000 fr a 150.000fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer son stock de cartons de poissons sales en achetant 15 cartons de morues, 20 cartons de soles,15 cartons de requins, 15 cartons de thons.

Elle tient a tout prix a atteindre ses objectifs, celui d'ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale dans peu de temps et importer les cartons de poissons de l'étranger pour être grossiste.
Avec ses bénéfices elle continue a épargner et prend soi de ses enfants.
texts.en:
