This client is 44 years old and single with six children. She has already received three loans from Hope, which she reimbursed successfully. She has put aside considerable savings. Her sales have gone up a lot from 25,000 to 150,000 francs per day. 

On receiving her fourth loan, she is going to add to her stock of salted fish by buying 15 cartons of cod, 20 cartons of sole, 15 cartons of shark, and 15 cartons of tuna. 

She is absolutely intent on attaining her objectives: opening a salted fish depot in a short time and importing cartons of fish from overseas in order to be a wholesaler. 

With her profit, she continues to save and to care for her children.

loans.use: to buy 65 boxes of different types of salted fish, such as cod, sole and tuna.

loans.name: Alex Ouma

texts.en:
Alex is a 24 year old single man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a a transport business where he provides transport services to the local people at Kakamega. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located along Lurambi-Kakamega road. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

Alex will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle. His business goal is to purchase more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will purchase a van to serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) is a farmer. She grows cucumbers and tomatoes. Her husband, Sat, is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives in separate home, one is a garment worker, one sells desserts and another one attends school. 

Srey is requesting another loan of $200 to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: to put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 45 year old married woman. She has 5 children, with ages ranging from 10 to 24 years. She describes herself to be visionary. 

Pamela operates a restaurant business where she sells food to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located next to a bus station. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of food items. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will diversify into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran (in the photo) is a diamond cutter in Phnom Penh. His wife, Chinda, is a rice farmer and raises pigs at home. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is young. The family is living in a village across the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saran is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000, to assist in his wife’s pig raising business. The loan will be used to buy additional pigs to raise and pig feed.

loans.use: To assist in his wife’s pig raising business by buying pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng (in the photo) and his wife, Leab, have been married since 1999 and have three sons who are in school. They live in a village along National Road 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Seng is a construction worker. His wife sells Khmer noodle, or Num Banh Chok, which are considered the national dish of Cambodia and can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber.

Seng is requesting a loan of $500 USD to build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: to build a restroom for his family's use.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 57 years old and married with three children. To make a living, Cesar engages in an agricultural business, primarily in farming corn in their village. Aside from farming, he also runs a hog-raising business to bring in a higher income.

Cesar's wife is his partner in managing and growing their business. They do their best to grow and make their business successful. Due to a lack of capital, Cesar has requested a loan of P27,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. He hopes to succeed in this type of business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 45-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. He describes himself as a visionary. 

He operates a farming business where he sells farm produce, such as cabbages and kale. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located near a technical institute in Kakamega. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be seasonality and a poor road network. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy a van for transporting his farm produce to Kakamega town.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin (in the photo) is 28 years old and her husband, Chanthol, is 37 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have no children. 

Narin sells sugar palm and raises ducks and chickens at home. He husband is an aide-de-camp. Narin asked for a Kiva loan once already. She hopes to continue expanding her duck farming business. She is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy additional ducks to raise.

loans.use: to expand her duck farming business by buying additional ducks to raise.

loans.name: Vana

texts.en:
Vana (in the photo) sells fish in the village that her husband catches. Her husband, Vang, is a fisherman. They also grow peanuts and lotus. They have been married since 1992 and have four sons. One son is a security guard and the others are in school.

Vana is applying for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is from the village Vardzia in the Imereti region. He is 57 years old. Giorgi leads the agricultural activities of his family. They own two cows, two calves and two bulls. The family sells dairy products in Zestaponi (a nearby town) at the open market. Along with the dairy products, Giorgi's family earns income from the sale of nuts and grapes harvested from the family's 100 nut trees and 400 vines. Also, Giorgi takes wood from local forests and sells it in the village, hauling the wood with his bulls. 

Giorgi’s family has six members, including his wife, Nazi, a 31-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (a 5-year-old granddaughter and 4-year-old grandson). Giorgi and his son are the income providers in the family. Giorgi’s son is a worker-constructor and he works on private house construction in the district. Their total average monthly income is 700 Laris  (approximately 420 USD). 

Giorgi has requested credit to purchase a bull. He will use it for transportation of the wood from the forest. He will bring more wood and sell it locally. It will increase the income of the family, which will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for more than 10 years. Together with his family, he grows diverse products such as cucumbers, onions, wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. It pleases him to sow diverse crops, as it is profitable to invest in a variety of vegetables and sell his harvest monthly, according to market demand. 

His business makes 150 USD per month. But the most tedious part is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his first loan with AqroInvest CU, and he is promising to repay the loan on time. Yadigar will invest the money in purchasing seeds, fertilizers and gardening tools.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gardening tools

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 31 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherry has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

Cherry has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Hebert is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 15 years. He describes himself as a visionary. 

He operates a retail store where he sells school bags, sauce pans, basins, mattresses and more. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping center. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase his stock of general items. His goal is to grow his business to wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase a van to facilitate running of the business.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses for resale

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 51 years old and married. She is peacefully living within the local community of Dumabato Sur, Maddela. Filipina has been blessed with two children.

Filipina has been involved in her hog-raising business for almost 10 years. She is happy because her piglets are doing well. Everyday, she feeds them regularly for their optimum growth. One thing she is thankful for is the improvement of their living conditions. She aims to improve her hog-raising business to be able to help her husband in generating more income to cover all their household expenses. To be able to achieve her goal, she is requesting financial assistance amounting to P20,000 to purchase feed for her hogs.

She would be thankful if her loan request is granted and she can further provide for the financial needs of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed to raise hogs

loans.name: Zakhida

texts.en:
Zakhida is a hardworking widow with three children. Her hard living conditions and poorness pushed her start her business. For the past 10 years, Zakhida has been running a cattle breeding business. She buys small calves, raises them, and then resells them at a profit. Zakhida is also engaged in gardening. 

Zakhida is requesting an 800 AZN loan to buy cattle and expand her business. She hopes to use her profit to make plans for her older son’s wedding.

loans.use: to purchase calves and fodder

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and is married with three children. For the past three years, she has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  

Gina is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère d'un garçon age de 9 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce bientôt 8 ans, quand elle finit ses études universitaires.
Parmi les première cliente de Hope, elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycle de prêts, elle a toujours eu  une grande capacité de remboursement et détient des épargnes considérables, ses revenus ont largement augmentes, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 fr a 100.000 fr par jour.
Pour ce quatrième prêt , elle persévère en achetant plus de marchandises, continuer avec la vente des produits divers , comme poisson sale, le poisson fume, les produits d'alimentation, elle fait les gâteaux, du yaourt,tous  ce dont les clients cherchent.

Toujours motivée par ce qu'elle fait , elle tient a aller loin , atteindre ses objectifs et être une femme d'affaire.
texts.en:
A client aged 39, married and the mother of a son of nine years old, she got into business about eight years ago when she finished her university studies. 

Among the first clients of Hope, she has already received three loans and she has always had a great capacity for reimbursement and has put aside considerable savings. Her income has gone up a lot and she makes sales for on average between 25,000 and 100,000 francs per day.  

For this fourth loan, she will persevere in buying more merchandise and continue selling various sorts of goods such as salted fish, smoked fish, grocery items. She has cookies, yogurt, everything her customers are looking for. 

Always motivated by her business, she intends to go far, attain her objectives, and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy items for her business to bolster her stall inventory.

loans.name: Immamverdi

texts.en:
Immamverdi is a married father of three children. He lives with his family the village of Agsu, where he runs a small downtown store where he sells home products. Immamverdi 's store is well-known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many of his customers go shopping after they are done with their work. Immamverdi has been in this business for eight years and has good client history. 

Immamverdi is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase merchandise to increase the variety of his products. He has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming sustainable, but he has handled these challenges well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon (in the photo) is 57 yeas old and lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with eight children, threes sons and five daughters. Four are married and live separately, three are garment workers and another one is assisting his mother in the farming business.  

Savon is a weaver and she is also a vegetable farmer. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Enhmurun

texts.en: Enhmurun is 25 years old and lives in a small house with his mother in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He graduated from technology college in 2005 as a computer operator.  He worked in a local bank as a security guard during 2007-2010. He has operated a taxi service since 2010.   Enhmurun is attending a one year Chamber of Commerce foreign affairs training. He is a hardworking, diligent and friendly man who says "After I finish my training, I am thinking of starting my own business".   He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay for his training fee.

loans.use: To pay his training fee

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is single and has a tobacco business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more tobacco to sell in her stall.  Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell in her stall

loans.name: Silveriano

texts.en:
Life can be pulled by goals just as surely as it can be pushed by drive.  That’s what Silveriano is doing now. Silveriano’s goal in life is to give a better quality of living to his family. He and his wife are doing their best for the assurance of his goal.  At the age of 53, Silveriano is getting old. He wants to have a stable source of income and be able to meet the needs of his family. 

Silveriano is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed.  In the future, Silveriano wants to expand his piggery house and increase his hogs, and double his earnings from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and married, with four children.  Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.  Julie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Joice Mary

texts.en: Joice is 51 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 13 to 22. She is known as ambitious and patient, and has earned a living for the last five years by running a restaurant in a local shopping center where she now employs two people. Her main challenge is fluctuating food prices, and she is applying for a loan to expand her restaurant. Her goal is to provide all of her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Sovoeun

texts.en: Sovoeun is 20 years old and single. She lives with her brothers, sister and widowed father in a village along National Road No. 5 about 20 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh City. Her father makes a living by buying and selling cows, getting them from remote districts and selling them to middlemen who come to buy them at his house. Sovoeun makes a living as a garment worker. She is applying for her first loan, for $1,200, to help expand her father's business by buying more cows to sell. She will also use part of the loan to pay her brother's school fees.

loans.use: to help her father's business and pay school fees.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch is 53 years old and lives with her 3 children in a ger, a mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in the Darhan Province of Mongolia. Her oldest son owns his own small business and the other two are college students. She operates a used-clothes trading business. In 2010, she started her own business with 200,000 MNT by renting a small shop. Her current assets are 470,000 MNT. She has already gained recognition from her customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I have a plan to expand my business by increasing my assets". She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothes and new clothes from the city of Erlian.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and new clothes from Erlian

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 31 years old and her husband, Sopho, is 32 years old (pictured together).  They have been married since 1999 and have four children, two sons and two daughters who are in school. The family is living in a village along National Road five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Chan sells grocery items, while her husband is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because it is old and it breaks down.  She will also use part of the loan to buy more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband and more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Map (pictured with his loom), 31, is a weaver, while his wife, Sophea, 26, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Map is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for his weaving business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old, married and has four children who range from 2 to 10 years old. He is patient and ambitious, and has earned a living for the last six years by running a hardware business where he sells spades, padlocks, machetes and hammers. His business is located in a shopping center and his biggest challenge is inflation. He is applying for a Kiva loan for 80,000 Kes to buy more machetes, spades and hammers to sell to his customers. His goal is to grow his business and acquire his own premises within five years. He hopes to give his children a good education, including through the university level.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.ru:
Rafail jenat i imeyet trex detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Rafail 52 qoda. 
Eto vtoraya ssuda Rafaila , on udachno oplatil svoy perviy kredit bez zaderjki, za svoyu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive. 
SEychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Rafail zanimayetsya skotovodstvom uje 7 let, ranshe on razvodil ovec, seychas on razvodit korov. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/164214
texts.en: Rafail is married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Rafail is is 52 years old.  This is Rafail's second loan.  He successfully repaid his first loan without delays and is very grateful to Kiva lenders for that loan.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and develop his business.  Rafail has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years.  He previously bred sheep and now breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en: Khakim  is 34 years old, married and makes a living by selling mobile phones and Sim cards. He also helps set up new devices and repair existing ones. He has been in this business for three years and earns about $250 a month. Khakim tries to use modern up-to-date technologies to satisfy his customers' demands and requirements. He is applying for a loan for 800 AZN to buy more Sim cards to sell and to improve his store.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Alain Christian

texts.fr:
Client de 44 ans, marie et père d'une fille de deux ans,il se lance dans la vente des livres chrétiens et bibles il y'a de cela 11 ans, quand il était a l'université, et il  est client de Hope  bientôt une année. 
Ayant déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts, il rembourse sans difficultés et a une capacité d’épargnes énormes.
Ses recettes sont de 200.000 fr a 1.000.000 fr par jour. Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va acheter  10 des  cartons de bibles, 10 cartons  des livres chrétiens de différents genres, des livres religieux.

Il a des stratégies de vente et de distribution très efficace, il fait la livraison a domicile, des ventes a crédits.
Il est entrain de construire une grande librairie et veut dans peu de temps faire la vente en gros des livres chrétiens.
Comme bon père , il s'occupe valablement de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client of 44 years old is married and the father of a daughter two years old. He got into selling Christian books and Bibles 11 years ago, when he was still in the university and he has been a client of Hope for almost one year. 

Having already received several loans, he reimbursed them without difficulty and has a capacity for enormous savings. His receipts are from 200,000 to 1,000,000 francs per day. With this new loan, he is going to buy 10 cartons of Bibles, 10 cartons of Christian books of various sorts, and other religious books.  He has sales and distribution strategies that are very efficient. He makes home deliveries and sells on credit. 

He is building up a big library and intends soon to sell Christian books wholesale. As a good father, he takes suitable care of his family.

loans.use: to buy Christian books and Bibles.

loans.name: Esther Banchili

texts.en: Esther is a 33 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 2 to 11. She describes herself as hardworking, and has for the last 10 years earned a living by selling various food items, including ground nuts and beans. Her business is in Kakamega town, and her biggest challenge is a shortage of funds. She is applying for a Kiva loan for Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals and groceries to sell to her customers. Her main goal is to begin selling clothing as well as food withing the next five years. She would also like to buy a van, because it will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lhamdegmed

texts.en:
Lhamdegmed is 51 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Umnugovi province of Mongolia. Her children are both high school students. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Lhamdegmed has a business making traditional Mongolian clothes. She started her business two years ago. She is planning to expand her business and have more customers. She is a diligent and talkative woman who says "I like my business and want to expand it more. At the same time, it brings me a sufficient amount of income." She is requesting a 1,300,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to buy materials and participate in a trade fair.

loans.use: To buy materials and participate in a trade fair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his cafe.

loans.name: Mary Wangeci

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 14 years to 18 years. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a cereals sales business where she sells beans, groundnuts (peanuts), greengrams (mung beans), onions etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

Her business is located in the town of Kakamega. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the temporary business premises that do not withstand bad weather conditions. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of cereals. Her business goal is to grow it to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Djahangir

texts.ru:
Djahangir 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Djahangir yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Bala Bahmanli vmeste so svoyey jenoy i dochkoy. On uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta. On delayet yogurt i Kefir, prodayot ix v magazini.
texts.en: Djahangir is 53 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Djahangir is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region together with his wife and daughter.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to increase the amount of milk products.  Djahangir makes yogurt and buttermilk and sells the products to stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is 25 and is married with one child. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years. 

Taleh loves his business and enjoys being involved in it. He buys livestock at the local city markets, brings it home and feeds it for a certain period of time. When the livestock gains weight, he sells it at a good price. Taleh wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) for the purchase of livestock. His brother actively helps him to run the business. His monthly income is $70 US. 

Taleh plans to use the profits from his business to renovate his house and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Aloys fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «Mettons ensemble ». Il a 77 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 30 à 49 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Aloys est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer une race améliorée du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Aloys voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de soigner sa femme.
texts.en:
Aloys is a member of the Twibumbirehamwe group.  The group's name means 'Let's Get Together'.  Aloys is 77 years old, married, and has six children who are between 30 and 49 years old.  He completed four years of his primary education.

Aloys is a rice grower.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Aloys' strategy for growing his business is to sow an improved strain of rice.  In the coming years, Aloys would like to expand the area of land over which he sows his rice.  He plans to use his profits to take care of his wife.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase income

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up three sons and two daughters. The daughters study at school, two sons work in construction and the third son works in Russia. 

Jumagul is engaged in cattle breeding, after her marriage the parents presented her with a calf and since that time she has been breeding cattle. At the moment she is applying for a loan because she needs money to finish her house construction. With money received from the loan she will purchase building materials. 

In the near future she plans to expand her cattle breeding business and also build a new shed to keep cattle. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line–People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan–Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Patience Stella

texts.en: Patience is a 28-year-old divorced woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 8 years. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a cereal sales business where she sells maize, beans, peas, peanuts, millet, and sorghum. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase maize. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a van to facilitate running her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 24 years old, married with one son. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have an opportunity to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of making a living in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses.

Since 2009, Vusal has supported his family through his efforts. Through the years, he tried various types of activities and finally, four years ago, he started his business selling cellphones. He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. His current monthly income is about 170 USD. His shop is in a good location in the central city bazaar. 

Currently, his business is doing well, but Vusal needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Vusal requests 900 AZN. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to cover customer demand

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 43 years old, has owned and operated a food vending business for six years.  While promoting healthier living to customers, Nenita sees this business venture as an opportunity to be an entrepreneur, and help her family with their household expense. 

Nenita is married to a farmer and this couple had been blessed with three children.  Two of her children are still studying, while the third one is married. She saw a need to create healthier food choices for people in her community while satisfying their taste buds.  Nenita sells siopao, native cakes and homed-made breads door to door and by order.  Her greatest challenge is overcoming roadblocks, like acquiring credit and operating and financing the food production. She is requesting a loan for P20,000, to purchase sacs of flour, baking soda, yeast, brown sugar and milk for her food production business.

She dreams of improving the appearance and taste of the food she makes, leading to an increase in her income.    This will allow her to buy an oven and other equipment needed, to fulfill a higher volume of customer orders and make a wider variety of foods.  She hopes that she can fulfill her dreams and send her children into higher level of education with her savings from the business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, baking soda, yeast, brown sugar and milk for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Esperdion

texts.en:
Esperdion is 59 years old, and runs a hog fattening business.  He is married and blessed with five children, two of whom are married, two are  construction workers and one is a student. 

He has been managing his hog raising business for 15 years.  For 20 years he has also been a maker of water pump in their community.  He is a very patient and industrious father.  He operates two businesses to provide for the needs of his family.  It is quite difficult, but his willingness to lift his family from poverty motivates him to do the work.

He is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccine for his hogs. He wants to develop his hog fattening business further to earn a higher income, so he can provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccine for his hogs

loans.name: Mary Maraga

texts.en:
Mary is a 38 year old married woman.  She has 5 children in ages ranging from 6 to 18 years.  She describes herself as a visionary. 

She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, flour, detergents and other general items.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Her business is located in a shopping center.  Her biggest challenge is inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her inventory.  Her business goal is to grow the small store into a wholesale business within 5 years.  In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and put up rental houses on it.

loans.use: sugar, flour, rice, detergents etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Umurimo Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Umurimo. Le nom du groupe signifie « le travail ». Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 à 3 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionner du riz et utilisation des fertilisants pour augmenter la récolte. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs, vendeurs  de riz dans sa région et acheter d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soins de sa famille et payer le minerval de son petit frère.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the group Umurimo. The name of the group means "work". He is 31 and married with two children, one and three years old. His educational level is 6 years of primary school. 

Jean Bosco is a rice grower. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming. 

His strategy for growing his business is to sow select rice seed and use fertilizers to increase his harvest. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to be among the best farmers and sellers of rice in his region and also would like to buy other fields. With the profit, he intends to take care of his family and pay school fees for his younger brother.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 34 years old, engaged in a hog fattening business for two years and a fish and meat vending business for three months.   With diligence, she successfully added this new livelihood.  With a loan amount of P25,000 she will buy  three hogs and feeds.  Part of the loan will also be used for her other business. She wants to grow her business, so she can afford to send her two children to school.

She wishes to lift her family from poverty, so she is working hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes, with the help of this loan amount, she will earn net income to save for their future.

loans.use: to buy  three hogs and feeds. Part of it will be used for other business.

loans.name: Follykue

texts.fr:
Follykue est un homme de 31 ans. Il est marié à une infirmière. Il n’a pas encore d’enfant.
Follykue gère sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 2010. Il  sert une large variété de clients dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé. Il achète les produits à Lomé.
Follykue a requis son premier crédit à  WAGES afin d’acheter des  boites de conserves, des bidons d’huile, des sacs de riz et des boissons BB. Il veut réinvestir ses profits dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Follykue voudrait diversifier ses offres alimentaires et agrandir ainsi son activité.
texts.en:
Follykue is a man of 31, married to a nurse, and he has no children yet. 

Follykue has been managing his own general store since 2010. He serves a wide range of customers in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood. He buys his products in Lomé.

Follykue has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy tins of food, jerrycans of oil, sacks of rice, and BB brand drinks. He wants to reinvest his profit in the business. 

In the coming years, Follykue would like to diversify his product range and thus expand his business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and drinks.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 48 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a primary source of income. He was blessed with seven children and has to provide for their needs, especially for their education. But due to the difficulty of life, his eldest already married to lessen the burden on their father by decreasing the family needs. One of his children also stopped studying and choose to help him in the business.


Edison is earning P3,000 each disposing time, but it is very minimal to provide for their needs. With the aspiration to increase his sales, he is asking for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to buy vitamins for his current hogs and to purchase two more hogs as additional sources of sales. He hopes through his hard work and this loan amount, he will provide better living condition and will not have to experience forever the pain of poverty.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for his current hogs and to purchase two more hogs as additional sources of sales

loans.name: Halima Abdalla

texts.en:
Halima is a 47-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 13 to 21 years. She describes herself to be ambitious, patient and joyous. 

She operates a utensils business in which she sells cups, plates, jugs and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of cups, plates, jugs and other plastic utensils. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide her children with a good education to the university level.

loans.use: to add stock of plates, jugs, cups, etc.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 52 years old and married. He is blessed with two children and provides for their needs. He has a piggery business as a source of income. Despite the difficulty in caring for his pigs, he is patiently working hard to achieve greater income soon. He knows that his diligence will be reciprocated with success. His wife also helps him to improve their living conditions by selling vegetables in their market every day.

Dante is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for his hogs to avoid food deficiency. He hopes to earn a higher income for security purposes in times of emergencies, as well as for the future studies of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
Nemat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Nemat 28 let.
Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsay skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu on nauchislya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom i razvodil korov. SEychas Nemat nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupir korov dlya uvelciheniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en: Nemat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Makhmudlu village of the Fuzuli region together with his friendly family.  He is married and has one child.  Nemat is 28 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years and breeds cattle.  He learned this business from his father, who used to be involved in animal husbandry and bred cattle too.  Nemat currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en: Lonah is a 43-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years old. She describes herself as a visionary. She operates a cereals sales business. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge as inflation. She will use this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to add more stock of maize. Her business goal is to expand into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future she can buy a van to facilitate the running of her business.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a lotions and cosmetics retailer. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children. Every day she sells cosmetics and, aside from this, she also sells viands within their village. She needs to buy merchandise such as lotions, make-up, lipstick, eye shadow and other beauty products for her direct selling business. This will help her improve the business and the service that she provides to her customers. 

Marites is aiming to fill all the orders coming to her, but the income she generates from her business is just sufficient to cover household expenses due to the high cost of basic commodities. For this reason, Marites is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos. She hopes that she can meet the demands of her customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase stock cosmetic products such as lotions, make-up, lipstick, eye shadow and other beauty products for her direct selling business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and is engaged in a piggery business as one of his sources of income. He has been doing this for 10 years and has been earning PHP 5,000 every disposing season. This is not enough to support them, so as a result, he also operates a farming business to raise his two children. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs and to use in his farming business. He hopes this will lead to growth in his businesses. He devotes himself to working hard in order to support the needs of his family as well as to cover his children's educational obligation. He hopes to provide for his children so that they can finish their education and become degree holders which would help to lift their standard of living. He will not be able to borrow anymore for that reason.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs and to use in his farming business

loans.name: Icyerekezo Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe Icyerekezo. Le nom du groupe signifie «Destination ».Il a 33 et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 1 à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Etienne est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est faire la semence sélectionnée et l’utilisation d’engrais chimiques. Dans les prochaines années, Etienne voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz après la récoltées. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et soigner sa famille.
texts.en:
Etienne is a member of the group Icyerekezo. The name of the group means  "Destination". He is 33 and married with three children between one and seven years old, of whom one is enrolled in school. His own educational level is six years of primary school. 

Etienne is a rice farmer. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is to sow select seed and to use chemical fertilizer. In the coming years, Etienne would like to expand the area he cultivates after the harvest. With the profit, he expects to educate his children and care for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme de 31ans. Elle est épouse d’un tapissier. Elle a  03 enfants. 
Ayaba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale  dans le quartier de Doumassesse. Elle achète ses marchandises à Lomé. 
Ayaba a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons de sucres en paquets, des boites de laits concentré et en poudre, des sardines en boites et des tomates fraîches.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait améliorer la gestion de son commerce pour doubler ses bénéfices. Avec ce profit, elle prévoit de s’acheter un terrain pour construire.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 31-year-old woman who is married to an upholsterer. She has three children. 

Ayaba became a reseller in 2007. She sells general food products in the district of Doumassesse. She buys her stock in Lomé.

Ayaba is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy boxes of sugar packets, cans of condensed, some powdered milk, canned sardines, and fresh tomatoes.

In the coming years, Ayaba would like improve her business management skills to double her profits, which she will use to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza.  In 2011, Ahmad decided he wanted to have a farm of his own, including several sheep. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to own his own farm that focuses on breeding and trading sheep, since there is no business like this in the area. He hopes that this will allow him to have a successful business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy sheep for the farm

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala 33 qoda. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Aybasanli vmeste so svoim mujem id etmi. Ona zamujem i iemyet 2 detey. 
Uje 5 let ona iemyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji raznix tovarov( kraski dlya volos, zakolki, bujiteriyu, svechki batareyki i t.d). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit noviy tovar dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Tunzala is 33 years old.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Aybasanli village of the Fuzuli region together with her husband and children.  She is married and has two children.  She has been involved in selling various merchandise (hair color, hair accessories, jewelry, candles, batteries, etc.) in her store for five years.  Tanzala currently needs 2000 AZN to buy new merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Moriba S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the institutions in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  This group of teachers has come to Kiva partner SMT, based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 20,000,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf.

Moriba is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old was born in Kenema, married and has 4 children who are attending primary school. Moriba has been a teacher for 15 years now. He has requested this loan in order to educate his children. He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Good Rice Group

texts.fr:
Ananie fait partie du groupe Good Rice. Il a 56 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 7 à 25 ans, dont 5 scolarisés et il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de secondaire.

Ananie est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir les champs à cultives et utilisation des fertilisants et  acheter d’autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Ananie voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ananie belongs to the Good Rice group. He is 56 years old and married with nine children between seven and 25 years old, five of whom are at school. He has one other person in his care apart from his children. He has six years of secondary education.

Ananie is a rice farmer. This is his first loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his farming activity. 

He plans to grow his business by expanding his farming fields, using fertilizers and buying other fields. In the coming years Ananie would like to be among the best rice farmers in his region. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr:
Client de 65 ans, il se lance dans la vente des boissons il y'a de cela 25 ans, et il est aujourd'hui client de Hope Congo bientôt une année et il a déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts.
Il gère un dépôt de boissons gazeuses et boissons alcoolises.Il a des recettes de 200.000 fr a 500.000fr par jour.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer son stock en achetant une palette e boissons gazeuses, une palette de boissons alcoolises et de la boisson importée.Il fait la vente en gros et fait des livraisons dans les domiciles, les restaurants et bars.
Tres connu dans le secteur, gentil il est très fier de son partenariat avec Hope parce qu'il arrive a réaliser ses objectifs , avoir une autonomie , vendre ses propres produits au lieu de prendre a crédit les produits de la brasserie  et de récupérer  les benefices , alors qu'avec les différents prêts, il a son propre capital.Il compte aller jusqu'au bout avec Hope.
texts.en:
This client is 65 years old.  He started selling drinks 25 years ago and has been a client of Hope Congo for almost one year.  He has already benefited from several loan cycles.

The client manages a soda and alcoholic drinks warehouse.  He makes 200,000 to 500,000 francs a day.

With this new loan, he will strengthen his stock by purchasing a pallet of soda, a pallet of alcoholic drinks and some imported drinks.  He sells wholesale and delivers to houses, restaurants and bars.

The borrower is very well known in his neighborhood.  He is kind and very proud of his partnership with Hope because he is managing to achieve his goals, work independently and sell his own products instead of taking products from the brewery on credit and recovering the profits.  With these loans, he has his own capital.  He plans to go all the way with Hope.

loans.use: to buy a pallet of soda, a pallet of alcoholic drinks and ten cartons of imported drinks

loans.name: Jusufu P.'s Group

texts.en:
Jusufu is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kenema city, this 26-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He is married and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Jusufu has requested this loan in order to buy local produce like cocoa and coffee for resale.

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, seeking a loan of 7,000,000 leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy local produce like cocoa and coffee for resale

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.ru:
Mahammad 28 let. On jenat i imeyt odnogo rebonka. Mahammad yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fzuuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
On 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, ranshe on razvodil ovec a seychas razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. 
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Mahammada, v perviy raz on bral 1600AZN chtobi kupit ovec. Za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive. On blagopoluchno oplatil svoyu ssudu bez zaderjok.
texts.en: Mahammad is 28 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Mahammad is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years and used to breed sheep, but now breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase livestock quantity available for sale.  This is Mahammad's second loan.  He previously took out 16000 AZN to buy sheep.  He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for that loan.  He successfully repaid that loan without delays.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Abesamihigo D Group

texts.fr:
Athanase fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo D. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il a 51 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 8 à 28 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Athanase voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et acheter d’autres surfaces après la récolter. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en: Athanase is a member of  the "Abesamihigo D" group. The group’s name means “performers.” He is 51 years old and married, with nine children from 8 to 28 years of age, six of whomo are in school. His education level is six years of primary school. Athanase  is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice. His business strategy is to do use selected seeds. In the years to come, Athanase would like to be among the best rice farmers in his region and buy  additional land after harvesting. He plans to use his revenues to provide for his children’s education and other needs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice

loans.name: Senani

texts.ru:
Senani uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
Senani yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fzuuli regione, posolok Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Senani rodilsya v 1956 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey.
texts.en: Senani has been involved in animal husbandry for nine years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale.  Senani is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bala Bakhmanli village of the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Senani was born in 1956.  He is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.fr:
Femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 15 ans.Elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais il y' a de cela 20 ans.Elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycles de prêts.
Ses ventes ont largement augmentées , elle a en moyenne 55.000 fr a 200.000 fr par jour.

Avec le nouveau prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en achetant des 20 cartons de poules a bouillir,20 cartons  de la viande avant et arriéré, 20 cartons de cuisses de poulets...
 Tres entreprenante, elle tient a aller au bout avec Hope,elle a déjà sa chambre froide et veut continuer dans le même sens.
texts.en: She is 45 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of 5 and 15. She has been in the business of selling fresh goods for the past 20 years. She has already benefited from three previous loans. Her sales have increased significantly, she makes on average between 55,000 and 200,000 cfa francs per day. With this new loan, she is going to replenish her inventory by purchasing 20 cases of chickens, 20 cases of different cuts of meat, and 20 cases of chicken thighs. Very entrepreneurial, she intends to continue working with Hope Congo. She already has a freezer room and will continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy boxes of whole chickens, chicken thighs and fish.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a Palestinian woman. She is married and has seven sons and four daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary, and one of her sons is a rickshaw driver. Mirvat wants to help her son to purchase a new rickshaw to drive and increase the family income, but she doesn't have enough money to share with her son, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

When Mirvat gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her son to purchase a new rickshaw so he will work extra hours to improve the family income and provide better living conditions to the family. 

Mirvat is a conservative woman, so her son Ahmad is photographed instead next to the rickshaw he will buy.


About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 43-year-old married man and father of two children. He opened a grocery store in 2006 and is working hard to improve it. Ahmad has 10 years of experience in this field. He is very talented in developing such a business.
Ahmad has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to increase his store's merchandise of goods necessary for the autumn-winter season.
Ahmad opened his store in 2006 and it has improved a lot since he started. He hopes the requested loan will have a great effect on his business development and family’s sociA. conditions improvement.

loans.use: To increase his store's merchandise of autumn-winter season goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Daisy M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of 8,400,000 SLL to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan from their monthly salaries. 

Daisy is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Segbwema village, the 48 year old has been in the teaching profession for 25 years now. She is married and has 3 children – 1 in secondary school and 2 in college. Daisy has requested this loan to buy building materials like iron bars and  corrugated iron and zincs for the construction of a family house. She will also use part of the loan to pay her children's college fees.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 25-year-old, married man living in Ain with his wife and little child. Adel has been selling fresh chicken since 2003 and is working hard on improving his business. Adel is well known in the region and most of his clients are neighboring villagers. 
His business is well developed because of the good quality of products he serves and his prices.
To provide his family with a better lifestyle, Adel opened a bakery to increase his income and improve his family’s social and financial situations.
Adel is working with his father; they are sharing and improving the same businesses. That’s why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy chicken at special prices.
This is Adel’s forth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. All his previous loans helped a lot in increasing his business capital and improving his workplace.  He has a good standing as a borrower.
He hopes to continue improving his business, to expand and be the owner of a big chicken farm.

loans.use: To buy chicken at special prices

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.ru:
Siyavush yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Araz Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Yemu 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. 
Siyavush seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta. On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov dlya proizvodstva molochnix produktov. On prodayot molchniye produkti v magazini. Tak kak yego produkciya xoroshaya v nem imeyetsya mnogo zaprosov sredi pokupateley.
texts.en: Siyavush is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Araz Dilagarda village of the Fuzuli region together with his family.He is 32 years old, married and has one child.  Siyavush currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase the amount of produced milk products.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years and breeds cattle for production of milk products.  He sells milk products to stores.  Siyavush has many orders among customers because he has quality products.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 25-year-old, single man, living and working in wood manufacturing in Ain region. 
Mahdi opened a wood factory a year ago and its income is good enough to let him take the courageous step forward to request a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner. He wants to open a new business manufacturing aluminum. He believes that both business will support each other by attracting constructors dealing with him for a whole project through the special packages he will be able to offer.
Mahdi is a man with a good reputation; he is a hard worker who improves himself in a very smart way and is supported by most of his family members.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is a Palestinian young man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He has another source of income from working in agriculture. Ameer wants to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing seedlings and needed fertilizers but he has not got enough money to pay for this. Therefore, he needs a loan from FATEN. When Ameer gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the seedlings and fertilizers and prepare well for the coming winter season. In this way, he will be competitive with others and sell more to increase his income and improve his living conditions. Ameer is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers in preparation for the winter season

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from the village Vachnadziani, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Tea, two daughters (16 and 9 years old) and 62-year-old mother. Both children go to school. 

Davit is the only income provider in the family. He is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow strawberries and peaches on a family-owned 0.5 hectare plot of the land. Fruits are sold by Davit. Along with the farming activities, Davit is busy with trade as well. He has a minibus and uses it for transportation and sales of greengroceries. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris (approximately 540 USD). 

Davit requested credit to increase his stock in trade. He will purchase more greengrocery products for resale. With a wider assortment, he will attract new clients and increase revenue from sales. Davit plans to save the additional income for his elder daughter’s education as she is entering a high-school next year.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pauline Isichi

texts.en: Pauline is a 20-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 months to 4 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a business where she sells groceries and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 months. Her business is located at Kakamega town. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of cereals and groceries. Her business goal is to own her own premises for storing her goods within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children and buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: To buy groceries and cereals

loans.name: Vilma Ester

texts.es:
Vilma vive en Ciudad del Este, tiene 20 años, ella está estudiando Licenciatura en lengua. Ella tiene 3 hermanos que también están estudiando en la facultad. Comenta que sus padres trabajan en una empresa familiar.
Vilma actualmente trabaja en la universidad donde estudia. Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, para poder trabajar en su profesión y de esa forma poder ayudarse a si misma y a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para un gastos de materiales para poder culminar sus estudios. Vilma agradece a la Fundación ya que le ayudará en su estudio.
texts.en: Vilma, 20, lives in Ciudad del Este.  She’s studying towards a  Bachelor’s in Language.  She has three siblings who are also enrolled in the university.  She comments that her parents work in a family business.  Vilma currently works at the university where she attends classes.  She very much wants to finish her coursework to be able to work in her profession and thus help herself and her family.  She is asking for the loan to cover some educational expenses and be able to complete her studies.  Vilma is grateful to the Fundación because it will help her with her studies.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Gilbert Shisakwa

texts.en: Gilbert is a 25-year-old, married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a furniture making business where he sells items such as couches, cupboards, dining tables and doors. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor road networks that affect timber transportation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber. His business goal is to put up a big workshop within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will purchase a pick-up to facilitate the running of his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and fodder.

loans.name: Abuzuzanya Group

texts.fr:
Florent fait partie du groupe Abuzuzanya. Le nom du groupe signifie «fulness together ». Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 2 à 17 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Florent est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des fertilisants et la semence sélectionner. Dans les prochaines années, Florent voudrait vendre beaucoup la production récolte dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florent is a member of the Abuzuzanya group.  The group's name means 'Fullness Together'.  Florent is 43 years old, married, and has eight children between 2 and 17 years of age.  Four of his children are in school.  Florent studied for eight years at primary school.

Florent is a rice grower.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Florent's strategy for growing his business is to use fertilizers and selected seeds.  In the coming years, he would like to sell a lot of the harvested crops in his region.  With the profits he makes, he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his early 40s, is married with four children who are still going to school. He has been running a general store for 6 years now. He works from 6 a.m to 9 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to increase his store inventory.
His dream is to one day be able to buy a pick-up for collecting his shop items.

He will share this loan with his loan group "New Africa" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en: Hussien, 51, has been in the trading business for a while now selling aluminum parts. He also has his own store where they make cabinets and other stuff from aluminum based on the customer’s order. Now Hussien has applied for a loan to expand his business and use other types of materiA. such as metA..

loans.use: to expand his business and use other types of material such as metal.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old married man and is the father of three children. He has been selling bread all over Tyre region since 2005. Ahmad has 19 years of experience in this business. In addition to selling bread, Ahmad works in a bakery and is very expert in this field.
Ahmad is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua to increase his business capitA. and distribute more bread to a wider region.
Ahmad is very sensitive about his family’s living conditions and that is why he works hard in both businesses to provide a good income to cover all their needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase stock of bread for sale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 25-year-old lady. Since she is a conservative person, she requested that her husband, Ammar, appear in the photo. Ammar works in the marketing field. Using his experience, Fatima and her husband started a small retail business a while ago, buying mainly car accessories at wholesale prices and re-selling them to the stores. They have managed to buy a small warehouse and a distributing bus. Now Fatima has applied for a loan to get a larger collection of car accessories for distribution. This couple has two young children.

loans.use: to get more car accessories for her distribution business.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a married woman and a mother of three children. She sells fish and has been for twenty years. She is still working on improving her business as much as she can.

Sawsan is a hard-working woman, and she aims to raise her children to be educated. That’s why she insists on educating them to get high degrees in the future.

Sawsan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for her children's educational fees. Her business is going fine but not enough to cover all of her requested expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 30-year-old, single woman. She describes herself as tolerant. Emily runs a beauty salon where she provides hair and beauty services to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs two staff members. 

Her business is located in a shopping center in Kisumu. Financial constraints are her biggest business challenges. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy hair weaves, relaxers and treatments. Her business goal is to grow the business and also start a cosmetics shop within five years. 

Emily hopes that in the future she will open a hair-dressing school.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, relaxers and treatment.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 29-year-old, single woman who opened a cafeteria three years ago to make her living. She sells coffee, tea, and hot chocolate, in addition to special fresh juices, biscuits, nuts, chocolates, and chips.

Heba is working hard to improve her business. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase her business capital by buying big quantities of tobacco, drinks, and snacks with good prices for the winter season.

Heba is already an Al Majmoua borrower, and her previous loan helped a lot in improving her business. She hopes this loan will also have a positive effect.  

Heba is expert in this field, since she used to work in a café before she started her own business. Most of her customers are her neighboring villagers. She hopes to expand her business more and more and to start providing a delivery service for her customers.

loans.use: to increase her business capital by buying more stock for good prices for the winter season.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has one son. He has a taxi and works as a taxi driver with a low income, and it is the only source of income for the family. Jamal wants to improve the taxi conditions by purchasing a new engine so the taxi's work capacity will increase. The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for a new engine, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Jamal gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase a new engine for his taxi. This will increase the capacity for the taxi to work and enable Jamal to work extra hours to increase his income and provide better living conditions to his family. Jamal is photographed next to his taxi.


About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Victor Otieno

texts.en:
Victor is a single man. He describes himself to be honest and patient. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he provides transport services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in Kisumu. He describes his biggest business challenge to be accidents.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a garage.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new season products to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 33-year-old Lebanese, married man living with his wife and five children. He has been working in car furnishing for the past 18 years. His business income is very important in supporting his family and handling their high living expenses.
